original: nyi 'og gi mkhan po a'a ts'arya dzi na mi tra dang / su rendra bo dhi dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / bo dhi mi tra dang / bod kyi mkhan po ratna ra kashi ta dang / dharmma t'a sh'i la dang /
analyzed: nyi 'og gi mkhan po a'a ts'arya dzi na mi tra dang / su rendra bo dhi dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / d'a na sh'i la dang / bo dhi mi tra dang / bod kyi mkhan po ratna ra kashi ta dang / dharmma t'a sh'i la dang /
translated: the preceptors of India, Ācārya Jinamitra, Surendrabodhi, Śīlendrabodhi, Dānaśīla, Bodhimitra, and the Tibetan preceptors Ratnarakṣita and Dharmātāśīla,

original: lo ts'a ba mkhas par chud pa dzny'a na se na dang / dza ya rakshi ta dang / manydzu shr'i warmma dang / ratnendra sh'i la la sogs pas theg pa che chung las 'byung ba'i rgya gar gyi skad las bod kyi skad du bsgyur zhing ming du btags pa rnams dkar chag tu bris te /
analyzed: lo ts'a ba mkhas par chud pa dzny'a na se na dang / dza ya rakshi ta dang / manydzu shr'i warmma dang / ratnendra sh'i la la sogs pas theg pa che chung las 'byung ba'i rgya gar gyi skad las bod kyi skad du bsgyur zhing ming du btags pa rnams dkar chag tu bris te /
translated: The translators who had mastered the language were Jnanakirti, Jayarakshita, Manjushribhadra, Ratneshvarashri, and others. They wrote down in a catalogue all the names of the texts that had been translated from the Indian language into Tibetan, according to the Great and Lesser Vehicles.

original: nam du yang gzhung lugs de las mi bsgyur zhing kun gyis bslab du rung bar gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: nam du yang gzhung lugs de las mi bsgyur zhing kun gyis bslab du rung bar gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas /

original: sngon lha sras yab kyi ring la /
analyzed: sngon lha sras yab kyi ring la /
translated: In the past, during the reign of the prince's father,

original: a'a ts'arya bo dhi sa tva dang / ye shes dbang po dang / zhang rgyal nyen nya bzang dang / blon khri gzher sang shi dang / lo ts'a ba dzny'a na de ba ko sha dang / lce khyi 'brug dang ; bram ze a'a nanda la sogs pas chos kyi skad bod la ma grags pa las ming du btags pa mang dag cig mchis pa'i nang nas kha cig chos kyi gzhung dang /
analyzed: a'a ts'arya bo dhi sa tva dang / ye shes dbang po dang / zhang rgyal nyen nya bzang dang / blon khri gzher sang shi dang / lo ts'a ba dzny'a na de ba ko sha dang / lce khyi 'brug dang ; bram ze a'a nanda la sogs pas chos kyi skad bod la ma grags pa las ming du btags pa mang dag cig mchis pa'i nang nas kha cig chos kyi gzhung dang /
translated: Acharya Bodhisattva, Yeshe Wangpo, Zhang Gyelnyen Nawa Zang, Minister Trishe Sangshi, translator Jnanakosh, Che Khyi Druk, Brahmin Anand, and others translated many terms that were not known in Tibet.

original: by'a ka ra na'i lugs dang mi mthun te /
analyzed: by'a ka ra na'i lugs dang mi mthun te /
translated: Some of these were not in accord with the system of Vyakarana.

original: mi bcos su mi rung ba rnams kyang bcos /
analyzed: mi bcos su mi rung ba rnams kyang bcos /
translated: Some were not suitable to be corrected, but they were corrected.🔽Some were added because of the importance of the terms.

original: skad kyi ming gces so 'tshal gyis kyang bsnan nas theg pa che chung gi gzhung las ji ltar 'byung ba dang / gna'i mkhan po chen po n'a g'a rdzu na dang / ba su bandhu la sogs pas ji ltar bshad pa dang / by'a ka ra na'i sgra'i lugs las ji skad du 'dren pa dang yang bstun te /
analyzed: skad kyi ming gces so 'tshal gyis kyang bsnan nas theg pa che chung gi gzhung las ji ltar 'byung ba dang / gna'i mkhan po chen po n'a g'a rdzu na dang / ba su bandhu la sogs pas ji ltar bshad pa dang / by'a ka ra na'i sgra'i lugs las ji skad du 'dren pa dang yang bstun te /
translated: In this way, the terms were made in accordance with how they appear in the scriptures of the Mahayana and Hinayana, how they are explained by the great Indian scholars Nagarjuna, Vasubandhu, and so on, and how they are presented in the system of Vyakarana grammar.

original: mjal dka' ba rnams kyang tshig so sor phral nas gtan tshigs kyis bshad de gzhung du bris /
analyzed: mjal dka' ba rnams kyang tshig so sor phral nas gtan tshigs kyis bshad de gzhung du bris /
translated: Those that were difficult to understand were explained with reasoning by separating the words and were written down in the text.

original: skad rgyad pa bshad mi 'tshal ba sgra bzhin du bsgyur bar rigs pa rnams kyang sgra btsan par bgyis te ming du btags /
analyzed: skad rgyad pa bshad mi 'tshal ba sgra bzhin du bsgyur bar rigs pa rnams kyang sgra btsan par bgyis te ming du btags /
translated: Those that were suitable to be translated literally without needing to be explained were also given names by emphasizing the words.

original: skad kha cig don bzhin du gdags par rigs pa rnams kyi don btsan par bgyis te ming du btags nas /
analyzed: skad kha cig don bzhin du gdags par rigs pa rnams kyi don btsan par bgyis te ming du btags nas /
translated: Those that were suitable to be named according to their meaning were given names by emphasizing the meaning.

original: btsad po'i spyan @132a * //
analyzed: btsad po'i spyan @132a * //
translated: In the presence of the king,

translated: After consulting with the king and ministers, the method of translating Dharma and the names given to the Indian language in Tibetan were finalized.

original: bkas bcad pa /
analyzed: bkas bcad pa /
translated: The edict:

original: dam pa'i chos bsgyur ba'i lugs ni don dang yang mi 'gal la bod skad la yang gar bde bar gyis shig / dharmma bsgyur ba la rgya gar gyi skad kyi go rims las mi bsnor ba bod kyi skad du bsgyur na don dang tshig tu 'brel zhing bden
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsgyur ba'i lugs ni don dang yang mi 'gal la bod skad la yang gar bde bar gyis shig / dharmma bsgyur ba la rgya gar gyi skad kyi go rims las mi bsnor ba bod kyi skad du bsgyur na don dang tshig tu 'brel zhing bden
translated: When translating Dharma, do not alter the order of the Indian language. If you translate it into Tibetan, the meaning and the words will be connected and true.

original: ma bsnor bar sgyur cig bsnor na bde zhing go ba bskyed pa cig yod na /🔽tshigs bcad la ni rtsa ba bzhi pa'am /
analyzed: ma bsnor bar sgyur cig bsnor na bde zhing go ba bskyed pa cig yod na / tshigs bcad la ni rtsa ba bzhi pa'am /
translated: Do not alter it. If there is a way to translate it that is easy and generates understanding,

original: drug pa 'ang rung ste /
analyzed: drug pa 'ang rung ste /
translated: then in a verse, either four or six lines are suitable.🔽In a single verse, alter and translate it as is convenient.🔽 In a prose passage, alter and translate both the words and the meaning as is convenient, as long as the meaning is not lost.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi nang na gang bde ba bsnor zhing sgyur cig / rkyang pa la ni don gang bsnyegs pa yan chad kyi tshig dang don gnyis ka la gar bde bar bsnor zhing sgyur cig / skad gcig la ming du mar 'dren pa ni ltag
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi nang na gang bde ba bsnor zhing sgyur cig / rkyang pa la ni don gang bsnyegs pa yan chad kyi tshig dang don gnyis ka la gar bde bar bsnor zhing sgyur cig / skad gcig la ming du mar 'dren pa ni ltag
translated: In a single language, if there are many names, it is like the back of a horse.

original: 'og dang bstun la gar snyegs pa bzhin du ming thogs shig / goo ta mya lta bu goo'i sgra las tshig dang / phyogs dang / sa dang / 'od dang / rdo rje dang / ba lang dang / mtho ris la sogs pa rnam ba du mar snyegs pa dang /
analyzed: 'og dang bstun la gar snyegs pa bzhin du ming thogs shig / goo ta mya lta bu goo'i sgra las tshig dang / phyogs dang / sa dang / 'od dang / rdo rje dang / ba lang dang / mtho ris la sogs pa rnam ba du mar snyegs pa dang /
translated: For example, Gautama, from the word Gau, corresponds to speech, direction, earth, light, vajra, ox, heaven, and so forth in many ways.

original: koo shi ka lta bu'i rtsva ku sha thogs pa dang / mkhas pa dang / padma la dga' ba dang / 'ug ba dang / mdzod ldan la sogs pa'i sgra'i lugs las drangs shing bsgyur na sna grangs mang po zhig tu snyegs la /
analyzed: koo shi ka lta bu'i rtsva ku sha thogs pa dang / mkhas pa dang / padma la dga' ba dang / 'ug ba dang / mdzod ldan la sogs pa'i sgra'i lugs las drangs shing bsgyur na sna grangs mang po zhig tu snyegs la /
translated: For example, Kauśika, from the word kuśa grass, corresponds to skilled, lotus, owl, having a treasury, and so forth in many ways when drawn out and translated according to the rules of grammar.

original: bsgyur ba rnams gcig gi nang du ni sna grangs de kun 'dur yang mi btu ba ste /
analyzed: bsgyur ba rnams gcig gi nang du ni sna grangs de kun 'dur yang mi btu ba ste /
translated: When translated, all those terms are included in one, but they are not combined.

original: gcig tu chad par byar yang gtan tshigs chen po med pa rnams ni mi bsgyur bar rgya gar skad so na zhog cig / gar yang drang du rung ba'i tshig byung na /
analyzed: gcig tu chad par byar yang gtan tshigs chen po med pa rnams ni mi bsgyur bar rgya gar skad so na zhog cig / gar yang drang du rung ba'i tshig byung na /
translated: Those that cannot be divided into one and for which there is no great reason to translate, do not translate, but leave them in the Indian language.

original: phyogs gcig tu chad par mi bsgyur bar spyir snyegs su rung bar gyis shig / yul dang / sems can dang / me tog dang / rtsi shing la sogs pa'i ming bsgyur na yid gol zhing tshig mi bde ba dang / 'ol phyir bsgyur du rung ba don du de ltar yin nam ma yin gtol med pa rnams la /🔽mgo la yul zhe 'am /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu chad par mi bsgyur bar spyir snyegs su rung bar gyis shig / yul dang / sems can dang / me tog dang / rtsi shing la sogs pa'i ming bsgyur na yid gol zhing tshig mi bde ba dang / 'ol phyir bsgyur du rung ba don du de ltar yin nam ma yin gtol med pa rnams la / mgo la yul zhe 'am /
translated: When translating the names of countries, sentient beings, flowers, plants, and so forth, if the mind is confused and the words are uncomfortable, and if it is unclear whether the translation is correct or not,🔽then add a word such as “country” or “flower” to the head of the name, and leave the Indian language as it is.

original: me tog ces pa la sogs pa gang la bya ba'i ming gcig bla thabs su snon la rgya gar skad so na zhog cig / grangs la rgya gar skad bzhin du bsgyur na dge slong brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa ni stong
analyzed: me tog ces pa la sogs pa gang la bya ba'i ming gcig bla thabs su snon la rgya gar skad so na zhog cig / grangs la rgya gar skad bzhin du bsgyur na dge slong brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa ni stong
translated: When translating numbers, if they are translated according to the Indian language, it would be “one hundred and fifty-three monks,” and so forth.

original: nyis brgya lnga bcu zhes tha mal par bod kyi skad bzhin bsgyur na don dang yang mi 'gal ba bod kyi skad @132b la yang bde bas grangs bsdom du rung ba rnams bod skad kyi lugs bzhin du thogs shig pa ri dang / sam dang /

translated: The two hundred and fifty, if translated according to the Tibetan language of ordinary people, is not contradictory to the meaning and is also easy in the Tibetan language, so translate those that can be counted as numbers according to the Tibetan language, such as pa ri, sam,

original: yang dag pa zhe 'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa zhe 'am /
translated: Completely or perfectly or closely should be translated according to the words.🔽Those that do not pursue an additional meaning do not need to be added with verbal impurities, so translate them according to the meaning.

original: nye ba zhes sgra bzhin du sgyur cig / don lhag par snyegs pa med pa rnams ni tshig gi lhad kyis bsnan mi dgos kyis don bzhin du thogs shig / rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i tshig rnams ni ma 'doms na ming gang bod skad du spyir grags shing
analyzed: nye ba zhes sgra bzhin du sgyur cig / don lhag par snyegs pa med pa rnams ni tshig gi lhad kyis bsnan mi dgos kyis don bzhin du thogs shig / rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i tshig rnams ni ma 'doms na ming gang bod skad du spyir grags shing
translated: Those words that belong to a category, if not edited, should be given any name that is well known in the Tibetan language and

original: tshig tu gar bde bar gdags so //
analyzed: tshig tu gar bde bar gdags so //

analyzed: 'doms na so sor btags pa bzhin du thogs shig / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos la sogs pa zhes dang sko long gi tshig gi rim pa ni sangs rgyas la zhe sa'i tshig tu bsgyur /

translated: In the case of others, it should be done with the middle-length words.

analyzed: sngon lha sras yab kyi spyan sngar mkhan po dang lo ts'a ba mkhas pa 'tshogs pas /
translated: Previously, in the presence of the father, the prince, the scholars, the abbot and the lotsawa,

analyzed: dharmma dkon mchog sprin dang / langkar gshegs pa bsgyur te /
translated: the Dharmadhatu Megha and the Lankavatara were translated.🔽In accordance with the system of the established rules, translate it.🔽From this royal order, no one should change it.

analyzed: bsgyur ba dang 'chad pa'i grva so so nas skad gsar du ming gdags dgos pa zhig yod na yang /

translated: In the corners of each [page] one should not write the name of the person [to whom the book belongs], but rather the reasonings that appear in the treatises of Dharma and in the treatises of grammar, and the way in which the Dharma is to be designated.

analyzed: pho brang du bcom ldan 'das kyi ring lugs kyi 'dun sa dang / dharmma zhu chen 'tshal ba'i grvar phul la /
translated: In the palace, in the assembly hall of the lineage of the Bhagavat, and in the corners of the great Dharma assembly, one should offer [the book] and

analyzed: snyan du zhus te bkas bcad nas skad kyi dkar chag gi dkyus su bsnan no //

analyzed: gsang sngags kyi rgyud rnams gzhung gis gsang bar bya ba yin te /

analyzed: sangs pa la snyegs /

analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na / buddhee ti k'a sha n'a da buddha bi buddha padma bata /
translated: In another way,🔽buddha is explained as “the one who has opened the lotus of the mind.”

original: blo bye zhing rgyas bas na padma kha bye zhing rgyas pa dang 'dra bar yang bshad de sangs rgyas zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: blo bye zhing rgyas bas na padma kha bye zhing rgyas pa dang 'dra bar yang bshad de sangs rgyas zhes bya'o ;
translated: It is also explained as being like a lotus that has opened and expanded, and so it is called “buddha.”

original: tshig gi don sbyir na chos thams cad thugs su chung cing ma lus par byang chub pa la bya /
analyzed: tshig gi don sbyir na chos thams cad thugs su chung cing ma lus par byang chub pa la bya /
translated: In general, the meaning of the word is that it refers to the one who has fully awakened to all phenomena without exception.

original: bha ga b'a na zhes bya ba gcig tu na /🔽bha ga na m'a ra tsa tushta pa tva dva bha ga b'an /
analyzed: bha ga b'a na zhes bya ba gcig tu na / bha ga na m'a ra tsa tushta pa tva dva bha ga b'an /
translated: Bhagavān. In one way,🔽bhagavān is explained as “the one who has conquered the four māras.”

original: zhes bya ste bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom pa la bya /
analyzed: zhes bya ste bdud bzhi bcom pas na bcom pa la bya /
translated: It refers to the one who has conquered the four māras.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na bhag ni legs pa rnam pa drug gi ming ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na bhag ni legs pa rnam pa drug gi ming ste /
translated: In another way, bhag is the name of the six excellences:

original: gzugs dang / grags pa dang / dbang phyug dang / dpal dang / shes rab dang / brtson pa ste 'di drug gi spyi la bya /
analyzed: gzugs dang / grags pa dang / dbang phyug dang / dpal dang / shes rab dang / brtson pa ste 'di drug gi spyi la bya /
translated: form, fame, power, glory, wisdom, and diligence. It refers to the one who possesses these six.

original: b'an zhes 'byung ba ni bhag sy'a st'i ti bha ga b'an zhes ldan bar bshad de /
analyzed: b'an zhes 'byung ba ni bhag sy'a st'i ti bha ga b'an zhes ldan bar bshad de /
translated: The term bhagavat is explained as bhagavān satatī bhagavān, meaning endowed with bhaga.

original: de rnam grangs 'di skad du bya ba las sngar bsgyur ba'i tshig grags pa btsan bar bya ste /
analyzed: de rnam grangs 'di skad du bya ba las sngar bsgyur ba'i tshig grags pa btsan bar bya ste /
translated: Since this is a synonym, the previously translated term bhagavat should be used, as it is more well-known.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dag las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan la mtshan 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dag las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan la mtshan 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: As it is said in the sūtras, The qualities of the Buddha are beyond worldly conventions.

original: zhes kyang 'byung bas na /
analyzed: zhes kyang 'byung bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'jig rten pa'i bha ga b'an las khyad bar du 'das zhes bla thabs su bsnan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bha ga b'an las khyad bar du 'das zhes bla thabs su bsnan te /
translated: it is said that bhagavat is superior to worldly bhaga.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes btags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes btags /
translated: Thus, it is designated as bhagavat.

original: 'jig rten ba'i bha ga b'an zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten ba'i gzhung nyid las kyang bcom par mi 'chad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten ba'i bha ga b'an zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten ba'i gzhung nyid las kyang bcom par mi 'chad de /
translated: As for the worldly bhaga, it is not explained as conquered even in worldly texts.

original: legs pa dang ldan pa zhes 'chad bas 'jig rten ba'i bha ga b'an ni legs ldan zhes gdags /
analyzed: legs pa dang ldan pa zhes 'chad bas 'jig rten ba'i bha ga b'an ni legs ldan zhes gdags /
translated: Since it is explained as endowed with excellence, the worldly bhaga is designated as bhagavat.

original: ta th'a ga ta zhes bya ba ta th'a ni de bzhin ga ta ni gshegs ba'am byon ba'am mkhyen ba'am gsungs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ta th'a ga ta zhes bya ba ta th'a ni de bzhin ga ta ni gshegs ba'am byon ba'am mkhyen ba'am gsungs pa la bya ste /
translated: Tathagata: Tath means “thus” and gata means “gone” or “come” or “known” or “spoken.”

original: tshig gi don spyir na sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams ji ltar gshegs shing phyin pa dang / chos thams cad gyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid ji lta ba mkhyen zhing gsungs ba la bya mod kyi /
analyzed: tshig gi don spyir na sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams ji ltar gshegs shing phyin pa dang / chos thams cad gyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid ji lta ba mkhyen zhing gsungs ba la bya mod kyi /
translated: In general terms, the meaning of the words is that he has gone in the same way as the buddhas of the past have gone, and he has known and spoken about the nature of all phenomena, just as it is.

original: sngar grags ba bzhin de bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa zhes gdags /
analyzed: sngar grags ba bzhin de bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa zhes gdags /
translated: However, he is designated a tathagata in the same way that he was known in the past.

original: aarhan zhes bya ba gcig tu na /
analyzed: aarhan zhes bya ba gcig tu na /
translated: Arhat: In one sense,

original: p'u dza mar ha t'i ti aarhan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: p'u dza mar ha t'i ti aarhan zhes bya ste /
translated: arhat means “worthy of worship” (pūjya-arha).

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa kun gyis mchod par 'os pas na mchod 'os zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa kun gyis mchod par 'os pas na mchod 'os zhes kyang bya /
translated: He is worthy of worship by all gods, humans, and so forth.

original: yang gcig tu na /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na /
translated: In another sense,

original: kle sha aa ri @133b ha da b'an aarhan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kle sha aa ri @133b ha da b'an aarhan zhes bya ste /
translated: arhat means “enemy destroyer” (kleśa-ari-han).

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: He is the destroyer of the enemy of the afflictions.

original: rnam pa 'di las 'dir ni don btsan par bya ste dgra bcom pa zhes btags /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di las 'dir ni don btsan par bya ste dgra bcom pa zhes btags /
translated: Of these aspects, here the meaning of “enemy destroyer” is the most important.

original: samyaksam buddha zhes pa samyaka ni yang dag pa /🔽sam ni sa mant'am /
analyzed: samyaksam buddha zhes pa samyaka ni yang dag pa / sam ni sa mant'am /
translated: Samyak sambuddha means “fully enlightened.”🔽Samyak means “perfect” or “correct.”

original: sam p'urnna ste ma lus pa 'am rdzogs pa /
analyzed: sam p'urnna ste ma lus pa 'am rdzogs pa /
translated: Sam means “complete” or “perfect.”

original: buddha ni sangs rgyas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: buddha ni sangs rgyas pa la bya ste /
translated: Buddha means “awakened.”

original: sbyir na chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ma nor bar thugs su chud cing mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan te /
analyzed: sbyir na chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ma nor bar thugs su chud cing mngon par byang chub pa'i mtshan te /
translated: In general, it is a name that refers to the perfect realization and full awakening of the essence of all phenomena.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya /
translated: It is called “perfect, complete buddha.”

original: bidy'a tsa ra na sam panna zhes pa bi dy'a ni rig pa /
analyzed: bidy'a tsa ra na sam panna zhes pa bi dy'a ni rig pa /
translated: Vidya-caraṇa-sampanna means “endowed with knowledge and conduct.”🔽Vidya means “knowledge.”

original: tsa ra na ni rkang pa /
analyzed: tsa ra na ni rkang pa /
translated: Caraṇa means “feet.”

original: sam banna ni ldan pa'am phun sum tshogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sam banna ni ldan pa'am phun sum tshogs pa la bya ste /
translated: Sampanna means “endowed” or “perfect.”

original: bslab pa gsum dang sbyar na lhag pa'i shes rab ni rig pa /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum dang sbyar na lhag pa'i shes rab ni rig pa /
translated: When applied to the three trainings, higher wisdom is knowledge.

original: lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i khrims ni rkang pa /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i khrims ni rkang pa /
translated: Higher mind and higher ethics are feet.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang sbyar na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the eightfold noble path,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni rig pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni rig pa /
translated: right view is knowledge.

original: lhag ma bdun ni rkang pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma bdun ni rkang pa ste /
translated: The remaining seven are feet.

original: rig pa mig dang 'dra bas mtshon nas rkang pas phyin cing thob par 'gyur bas na rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya /🔽su ga ta ces bya ba gcig tu na ;🔽sho bha na ga ta su ga ta su r'u pa bata ces bya ste /

translated: Because he has attained the goal by means of the feet, having been shown the way by the eye of knowledge, he is called the one with knowledge and feet.🔽 Sugata.🔽 Sugata means he who has gone well (sugata), or he who has gone to the other side (paragata).

original: legs par gshegs pas na legs par gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: legs par gshegs pas na legs par gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone well,

original: gzugs legs pa bzhin /🔽aa pu nar praty'a ga ta su nashta dzvar bata ces bya ste /🔽phyir mi ldog ba gshegs pas na legs par gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs legs pa bzhin / aa pu nar praty'a ga ta su nashta dzvar bata ces bya ste / phyir mi ldog ba gshegs pas na legs par gshegs pa ste /
translated: like a well-formed form.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone without returning, like a well-cured disease.

original: rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin /🔽y'a bangga ta byag ma n'a ta su ga ta /🔽su p'urna ghat ba ta ces bya ste /🔽ji tsam du 'gro bar bya ba ma lus par phyin pas na legs par gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: rims nad legs par byang ba bzhin / y'a bangga ta byag ma n'a ta su ga ta / su p'urna ghat ba ta ces bya ste / ji tsam du 'gro bar bya ba ma lus par phyin pas na legs par gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.

original: bum pa legs par gang bzhin pa zhes 'byung /🔽yang na gcig tu na /
analyzed: bum pa legs par gang bzhin pa zhes 'byung /🔽yang na gcig tu na /
translated: He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.🔽 He is called the one who has gone well because he has gone to the end of all that is to be gone, like a well-filled vessel.

original: dharmma skandha las 'byung ba su ga ta ai ti su khi to bha ga b'an /🔽svarga ta aa bya thi ta /
analyzed: dharmma skandha las 'byung ba su ga ta ai ti su khi to bha ga b'an / svarga ta aa bya thi ta /
translated: The word sugata is derived from sukha and gata.

original: dharmma sa ma nv'a ga ta /
analyzed: dharmma sa ma nv'a ga ta /
translated: The word dharma is derived from dhr and ma.

original: ta du tsya te su ga ta ces 'byung ste /
analyzed: ta du tsya te su ga ta ces 'byung ste /
translated: The word buddha is derived from budh.

original: bcom ldan 'das bde bar gyur cing mtho ris kyi bde ba dang ldan la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bde bar gyur cing mtho ris kyi bde ba dang ldan la /
translated: The Bhagavan is one who has attained bliss and the bliss of the higher realms.

original: gnod ba mi mnga' zhing gnod pa med pa'i chos dang ldan pas na bde bar gshegs pa 'am bde ba brnyes pa la yang bya ste /
analyzed: gnod ba mi mnga' zhing gnod pa med pa'i chos dang ldan pas na bde bar gshegs pa 'am bde ba brnyes pa la yang bya ste /
translated: He is one who is free from harm and possesses the Dharma of being free from harm.🔽He is one who has attained bliss.

original: 'dir sngar grags ba dang / dharmma skandha las 'byung ba dang sbyar te bde bar gshegs pa zhes btags /
analyzed: 'dir sngar grags ba dang / dharmma skandha las 'byung ba dang sbyar te bde bar gshegs pa zhes btags /
translated: The word lokanatha is derived from loka and natha.

original: lo ka bid ces bya ba lo ka ni 'jig rten /
analyzed: lo ka bid ces bya ba lo ka ni 'jig rten /
translated: Loka means world and natha means knowledge.

original: bid ni bid dzny'a na ste de bzhin gshegs pas nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du gdul ba'i sems can gyi khams la gzigs shing /🔽skal ba yod ba dang med pa rtogs par mkhyen pas na 'jig rten @134a * //
analyzed: bid ni bid dzny'a na ste de bzhin gshegs pas nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du gdul ba'i sems can gyi khams la gzigs shing / skal ba yod ba dang med pa rtogs par mkhyen pas na 'jig rten @134a * //
translated: The Tathagata sees the realms of sentient beings to be tamed three times each day and three times each night.🔽He knows who has the fortune to be tamed and who does not.

original: mkhyen pa zhes bya /
analyzed: mkhyen pa zhes bya /
translated: He is called the knower of the world.

original: aa nu tta ra pu ru sha da mya s'a ra thi zhes bya ba /
analyzed: aa nu tta ra pu ru sha da mya s'a ra thi zhes bya ba /
translated: Anuttara-purusha-damya-sārathi means the unexcelled trainer of beings to be tamed.

original: aa nutta ra ni bla na med pa /
analyzed: aa nutta ra ni bla na med pa /
translated: Anuttara means unexcelled.

original: pu ru sha da mya s'a ra thi ni skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: pu ru sha da mya s'a ra thi ni skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba ste /
translated: Purusha-damya-sārathi means the trainer of beings to be tamed.

original: sor mo'i phreng ba la sogs ba zhe sdang che ba dang / dga' bo la sogs pa 'dod chags che ba dang / lteng rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa gti mug che ba'i 'dul ba'i sems can rta rgod dang 'dra ba 'dul dka' ba rnams 'jam pos 'dul ba yang 'jam pos btul /
analyzed: sor mo'i phreng ba la sogs ba zhe sdang che ba dang / dga' bo la sogs pa 'dod chags che ba dang / lteng rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa gti mug che ba'i 'dul ba'i sems can rta rgod dang 'dra ba 'dul dka' ba rnams 'jam pos 'dul ba yang 'jam pos btul /
translated: He tamed beings to be tamed such as Aṅgulimāla, who had great hatred, Nanda, who had great desire, and Udraka Rāmaputra, who had great ignorance, who were like wild horses difficult to tame. He tamed those to be tamed with gentleness with gentleness,

original: drag pos 'dul ba yang drag pos btul /
analyzed: drag pos 'dul ba yang drag pos btul /
translated: he tamed those to be tamed with fierceness with fierceness,

original: gnyi gas 'dul ba yang gnyigs btul te /
analyzed: gnyi gas 'dul ba yang gnyigs btul te /
translated: and he tamed those to be tamed with both with both.

original: thabs bzang zhing sla bas thabs thabs bzhin du btul nas don sgrub pa'i mchog mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par kha lo sgyur zhing 'jog pas na /
analyzed: thabs bzang zhing sla bas thabs thabs bzhin du btul nas don sgrub pa'i mchog mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas par kha lo sgyur zhing 'jog pas na /
translated: He guided them and established them in the supreme goal of nirvana by taming them with whatever method was good and easy, just like taming with a method.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, he is called the unexcelled trainer of beings to be tamed.

original: sh'a sta zhes bya ba sh'a su aa nu shi shto zhes bya ste /🔽phyir tshig gi don du na ston zhing slob pa la bya /
analyzed: sh'a sta zhes bya ba sh'a su aa nu shi shto zhes bya ste / phyir tshig gi don du na ston zhing slob pa la bya /
translated: Sasta means he who teaches and instructs (sasana-anusasana).

original: ta ni tshig gi don du bya bar zad de /
analyzed: ta ni tshig gi don du bya bar zad de /
translated: Ta is merely a word meaning to do.

original: spyir na lha dang mi la sogs pa thams cad kyi ston par gyur bas na ston pa zhes bya /🔽dzin zhes bya ba dzi ta p'a pa ka aa ku sha la dharmma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyir na lha dang mi la sogs pa thams cad kyi ston par gyur bas na ston pa zhes bya / dzin zhes bya ba dzi ta p'a pa ka aa ku sha la dharmma zhes bya ste /
translated: In general, he is called the Teacher because he is the teacher of all gods, humans, and so forth.

original: sdig pa dang mi dge ba'i chos las rgyal bas na rgyal ba zhes bya /🔽t'a yi zhes bya ba t'a yi ni sant'a na pa la na yo:zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdig pa dang mi dge ba'i chos las rgyal bas na rgyal ba zhes bya / t'a yi zhes bya ba t'a yi ni sant'a na pa la na yo:zhes bya ste /
translated: Jin means he who is victorious over evil and unvirtuous phenomena (jitapâpa-akusala-dharma).

original: 'phags pa'i lam thugs su chud pa bstan zhing bshad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam thugs su chud pa bstan zhing bshad de /
translated: Tâ means he who has realized and explained the path of the noble ones (tâya-nisthâna-pâlanaya).

original: rgyun mi gcod pa dang / skyob cing skyong ba la bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun mi gcod pa dang / skyob cing skyong ba la bya ste /
translated: It means to be uninterrupted, to protect, and to care for.

original: p'a la skyong ba zhes btags pa zhig kyang gud na yod pa dang ma 'dom par bya ste skyob bar btags /
analyzed: p'a la skyong ba zhes btags pa zhig kyang gud na yod pa dang ma 'dom par bya ste skyob bar btags /
translated: Pâla is a separate word meaning to care for, but it is not to be taken separately; it is to be taken as to protect.

original: ma h'a rishi zhes bya ba ma h'a chen po /
analyzed: ma h'a rishi zhes bya ba ma h'a chen po /
translated: Maharshi means great sage (mahâ-rsi).

original: ri shi ni ri shi ga too zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ri shi ni ri shi ga too zhes bya ste /
translated: Rishi means rishigat.

original: shes pa dang ldan pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: shes pa dang ldan pa la'ang bya /
translated: It also means “endowed with knowledge.”

original: yang gcig tu na /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na /
translated: In another way,

original: ri dhye ti pra ni dh'a nan zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: ri dhye ti pra ni dh'a nan zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: it means ridhyate pranidhanam,

original: smon pa rnams 'byor zhing 'grub pa la'ang bya /
analyzed: smon pa rnams 'byor zhing 'grub pa la'ang bya /
translated: “aspirations are accomplished.”

original: yang gcig tu na /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na /
translated: In another way,

original: k'a ya b'agma no bhi ri dzu she te ai ti ri shi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: k'a ya b'agma no bhi ri dzu she te ai ti ri shi zhes bya ste /
translated: it means kayavagranobhirjuṣṭa iti rishi,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid drang por gnas shing srong bas na drang srong chen po zhes pa tags /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid drang por gnas shing srong bas na drang srong chen po zhes pa tags /
translated: “the great sage, because his body, speech, and mind are straight and upright.”

original: aam gi ras zhes bya ba thog ma drang srong nyid kyi lus las byung bas na bdag lus skyes zhes bshad ba dang / aam gi ras ni nyi ma ste /
analyzed: aam gi ras zhes bya ba thog ma drang srong nyid kyi lus las byung bas na bdag lus skyes zhes bshad ba dang / aam gi ras ni nyi ma ste /
translated: Angiras means “born from my body,” because it arose from the body of the sage himself.

original: nyi ma'i rigs yin pas na nyi rgyud ces kyang bshad du rung bar 'dul ba'i dngos po dang / bshad pa las 'byung la /
analyzed: nyi ma'i rigs yin pas na nyi rgyud ces kyang bshad du rung bar 'dul ba'i dngos po dang / bshad pa las 'byung la /
translated: Angiras also means “the sun,” so it is also suitable to explain it as “the sun lineage.”

original: mdo sde dag las sku'i kha dog nyi ma bzhin du lham me lhang nger bzhugs pa'i yon tan lta bur yang bshad pas nyi ma'i rgyud ces btags /
analyzed: mdo sde dag las sku'i kha dog nyi ma bzhin du lham me lhang nger bzhugs pa'i yon tan lta bur yang bshad pas nyi ma'i rgyud ces btags /
translated: Since the sutras explain that the qualities of the Buddha's body are radiant and bright like the sun, the name is also given as the sun tantra.

original: de @134b bzhin gshegs pa so so'i mtshan la /
analyzed: de @134b bzhin gshegs pa so so'i mtshan la /
translated: The individual names of the tathagatas are as follows.

original: bi shva bhu ga zhes bya ba /
analyzed: bi shva bhu ga zhes bya ba /
translated: Vishvabhuj.

original: bi shva ni thams cad /
analyzed: bi shva ni thams cad /
translated: Vishva means all,

original: bhu dza p'a lan aa bhya ba ha ra yo zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: bhu dza p'a lan aa bhya ba ha ra yo zhes 'byung ste /
translated: and bhujapalanabhyavahara means to protect.

original: longs par kun la spyod pa 'am sems can thams cad skyob pa la bya ste /
analyzed: longs par kun la spyod pa 'am sems can thams cad skyob pa la bya ste /
translated: It means to enjoy all or to protect all sentient beings.

original: skabs 'dir sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yin pas na thams cad skyob ces btags /
analyzed: skabs 'dir sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yin pas na thams cad skyob ces btags /
translated: Since it is the name of a buddha in this context, it is given as All Protector.

original: kra kutstshunda ces bya ba ;
analyzed: kra kutstshunda ces bya ba ;
translated: Krakucchanda.

original: kra ni kra ma ste 'khor ba /
analyzed: kra ni kra ma ste 'khor ba /
translated: Kra means to go around,

original: kutstshunda ni / ti kung sa ya ti zhes bya ste /🔽'khor ba 'joms pa 'am /
analyzed: kutstshunda ni / ti kung sa ya ti zhes bya ste / 'khor ba 'joms pa 'am /
translated: and kucchanda means to destroy.

original: sel ba la bya ste /
analyzed: sel ba la bya ste /
translated: It means to destroy samsara or to eliminate it.

original: 'khor ba 'jig ces bya /
analyzed: 'khor ba 'jig ces bya /
translated: It is called Destroyer of Samsara.🔽 Some texts also have Krakucchanda.

original: yang yi ge kha cig gi nang nas kra kutstshunda ces kyang 'byung ste /🔽kutshi ta tshando /
analyzed: yang yi ge kha cig gi nang nas kra kutstshunda ces kyang 'byung ste /🔽kutshi ta tshando /
translated: Kucchanda means to destroy.

original: aa ti krando sm'a di ti zhes bya ste /
analyzed: aa ti krando sm'a di ti zhes bya ste /
translated: His name is Atikrānti-saṃmati.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan cing bshad pas mi dge ba dang log pa la dad pa bsal zhing med par byas pa'i mtshan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan cing bshad pas mi dge ba dang log pa la dad pa bsal zhing med par byas pa'i mtshan te /
translated: He is called this because he has dispelled and eliminated non-virtue and wrong faith by teaching and explaining the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: log dad sel zhes bya /
analyzed: log dad sel zhes bya /
translated: He is called Dispeller of Wrong Faith.

original: k'a shya pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: k'a shya pa zhes bya ba /
translated: His name is Kāśyapa.

original: ka shya ga te zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ka shya ga te zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that he is called Kāśyapagotra.

original: chad pas bcad pa 'am gnod par bya ba'i rigs pa yin /
analyzed: chad pas bcad pa 'am gnod par bya ba'i rigs pa yin /
translated: He is of the lineage of those who are to be punished or harmed.

original: pa ni p'a la ni skyob ba'am skyong ba'i drang srong gi rigs su skyes pa la bya ste /
analyzed: pa ni p'a la ni skyob ba'am skyong ba'i drang srong gi rigs su skyes pa la bya ste /
translated: Pa means pālana, which means a sage who protects or cares for.

original: chad pas bcad cing gnod par bya ba las skyob pas na gnod skyob ces kyang bya /
analyzed: chad pas bcad cing gnod par bya ba las skyob pas na gnod skyob ces kyang bya /
translated: He is called Protector from Harm because he protects from being punished and harmed.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na /
translated: In another way,

original: k'a shya d'i pa to zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: k'a shya d'i pa to zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: he is called Kāśyapa.

original: skal ba yod pa'i sems can chos bshad pa'i 'od kyis snang bar bya ba'i rigs ba rnams gcig tu na k'a shya d'i pa to zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: skal ba yod pa'i sems can chos bshad pa'i 'od kyis snang bar bya ba'i rigs ba rnams gcig tu na k'a shya d'i pa to zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: He is of the lineage of those who are to be illuminated by the light of the Dharma explained to fortunate sentient beings.

original: skal pa yod pa'i sems can chos bshad pa'i 'od kyis snang bar bya ba'i rigs pa rnams srung zhing skyob pas na 'od srungs zhes kyang byar rung ste /
analyzed: skal pa yod pa'i sems can chos bshad pa'i 'od kyis snang bar bya ba'i rigs pa rnams srung zhing skyob pas na 'od srungs zhes kyang byar rung ste /
translated: It is also appropriate to call him Kasyapa because he protects and saves those beings who are fortunate enough to be illuminated by the light of the Dharma teaching.

original: sngan chad ming du btags te grags pa bzhin du 'od srungs zhes btags /
analyzed: sngan chad ming du btags te grags pa bzhin du 'od srungs zhes btags /
translated: He was given the name Kasyapa because he was famous for having been given that name in the past.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi ming la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phung po dang / ye shes dang sku gsum la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi ming la mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phung po dang / ye shes dang sku gsum la /
translated: The name of a buddha's good qualities is the aggregate that is equal to the unequalled, and the three bodies of gnosis.🔽Asamasamapancaskan

original: aa sa ma sa ma panytsa skandha zhes bya ba aa sa ma ni mi mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: aa sa ma sa ma panytsa skandha zhes bya ba aa sa ma ni mi mnyam pa ste /
translated: dhas means the aggregate that is equal to the unequalled.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la bya /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams la bya /
translated: Asamasa refers to the buddhas of the past.

original: sa ma ni mnyam pa ste sngon gyi sangs rgyas de dag nyid dang mtshungs par gyur ba la bya /
analyzed: sa ma ni mnyam pa ste sngon gyi sangs rgyas de dag nyid dang mtshungs par gyur ba la bya /
translated: Sama means equal and refers to being the same as those buddhas of the past.

original: panytsa skandha ni phung po lnga ste zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po ste /
analyzed: panytsa skandha ni phung po lnga ste zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po ste /
translated: knowledge and vision of complete liberation.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la mnga' ba'i phung po 'di dag phal pa la med pas na mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la mnga' ba'i phung po 'di dag phal pa la med pas na mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i phung po lnga zhes bya /
translated: Since these aggregates, which are possessed by the buddhas, are not possessed by ordinary beings, they are called the five aggregates that are equal to the unequalled.

original: dharmma dh'a tu bi shuddha zhes bya ba chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: dharmma dh'a tu bi shuddha zhes bya ba chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: The line “dharmadhatu visuddha” means the completely pure sphere of reality.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i chos rnams skye zhing 'byung ba dang dbyings su gyur pas na chos kyi dbyings de bzhin @135a * //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i chos rnams skye zhing 'byung ba dang dbyings su gyur pas na chos kyi dbyings de bzhin @135a * //
translated: Since the noble qualities such as the powers and the fearlessnesses are born and arise in the sphere of reality, the sphere of reality is the source of all of them.

original: nyid la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa sbrin dang 'dra ba dangs shing byang ste /
analyzed: nyid la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa sbrin dang 'dra ba dangs shing byang ste /
translated: The sphere of reality, suchness, is pure and cleansed of the clouds of the temporary afflictive obscurations and the knowledge obscurations.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings dag pa dang 'dra ba san chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag ba zhes bya /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings dag pa dang 'dra ba san chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag ba zhes bya /
translated: The space-like pure expanse of reality is called the “pure expanse of reality.”

original: a'a darsha dzny'a na zhes bya ba me long lta bu'i ye shes yin te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la dmigs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa thams cad dang bral te kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa gnas gyur bas /
analyzed: a'a darsha dzny'a na zhes bya ba me long lta bu'i ye shes yin te chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa la dmigs pas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa thams cad dang bral te kun gzhi rnam bar shes pa gnas gyur bas /
translated: Ādarśa-jñāna is the mirrorlike pristine awareness. Since it focuses on the pure expanse of reality, it is free from all thoughts of subject and object and is the transformation of the ground consciousness.

original: me long phyis pa'i nang du ci yang snang ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba la bya ste /
analyzed: me long phyis pa'i nang du ci yang snang ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan snang ba la bya ste /
translated: It is like a polished mirror in which anything can appear. It is the appearance of the reflections of all phenomena.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes zhes bya /
translated: This is called “mirrorlike pristine awareness.”

original: sa ma t'a dzny'an zhes bya ba thog mas dang po la de kho na nyid mngon bar rtogs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sa ma t'a dzny'an zhes bya ba thog mas dang po la de kho na nyid mngon bar rtogs pa'i tshe /
translated: Samatā-jñāna is the pristine awareness of equality. When one first realizes suchness,🔽one realizes equality without distinguishing between oneself and others.

original: bdag dang gzhan du mi 'byed cing mnyam ba nyid du rtogs bas gong nas gong du sbyangs ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi gnas ba'i mya ngan las 'das par gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mi 'byed cing mnyam ba nyid du rtogs bas gong nas gong du sbyangs ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sa la mi gnas ba'i mya ngan las 'das par gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: When one has trained in this again and again, one attains the buddha level and the state of nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas 'phos te /🔽ye shes su gnas gyur ba la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas 'phos te / ye shes su gnas gyur ba la mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya ;
translated: The defiled mind consciousness is transformed and🔽becomes the gnosis of equality.

original: pra tya be ksha na dzny'a na zhes bya ba so sor rtog pa'i ye shes yin te /
analyzed: pra tya be ksha na dzny'a na zhes bya ba so sor rtog pa'i ye shes yin te /
translated: The gnosis of individual discernment pratyabhisamayajñana is the transformed state of the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin dang bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur ba /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin dang bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur ba /
translated: It is the basis of all powers of retention, concentrations, meditative stabilizations and states of composure.

original: shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug bas chos kyi char chen po 'bebs shing the tshom sna tshogs gcod pa dang / sku bee d'u rya la sogs pa rin po che'i mdog tu ston pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes 'jug bas chos kyi char chen po 'bebs shing the tshom sna tshogs gcod pa dang / sku bee d'u rya la sogs pa rin po che'i mdog tu ston pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin te /
translated: It is the cause for the appearance of the body of the Buddha in the colors of lapis lazuli and so forth and for the rain of great Dharma that falls and cuts through the various doubts, because it is the gnosis that engages with all objects of knowledge without obstruction.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes zhes bya /
translated: This is called the gnosis of individual discernment.

original: kri ty'a nushtha na dzny'an zhes bya ba bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes yin te /
analyzed: kri ty'a nushtha na dzny'an zhes bya ba bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes yin te /
translated: The gnosis that accomplishes activities krityanusthanajñana is the transformed state of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thabs sna tshogs dbag tu med bas sems can mang po'i don mdzod pa'i gzhir gyur pa yin te /🔽bya ba sgrub ba'i ye shes zhes bya /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thabs sna tshogs dbag tu med bas sems can mang po'i don mdzod pa'i gzhir gyur pa yin te / bya ba sgrub ba'i ye shes zhes bya /
translated: The consciousnesses of the five sense organs such as the eyes are transformed, and this becomes the basis for the benefit of many sentient beings in all the worlds through the infinite variety of methods.🔽This is called “the gnosis that accomplishes activities.”

original: dharmma k'a ya zhes bya ba chos kyi sku yin te /
analyzed: dharmma k'a ya zhes bya ba chos kyi sku yin te /
translated: Dharmakaya.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa dang sbyar na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te chos kyi sku zhes bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa dang sbyar na chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa dang / me long lta bu'i ye shes ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te chos kyi sku zhes bya /
translated: In terms of the buddha level, the pure expanse of reality and the mirrorlike gnosis are the nature of suchness and are called the “dharmakaya.”

original: sambho ga k'a ya zhes bya ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin te /
analyzed: sambho ga k'a ya zhes bya ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yin te /
translated: Sambhogakaya.

original: mnyam ba nyid kyi ye shes dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis kyis chos kyi longs spyod dang skyid ba chen po ma lus pa myong bar mdzad ba rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku la bya ste /
analyzed: mnyam ba nyid kyi ye shes dang so sor rtog pa'i ye shes gnyis kyis chos kyi longs spyod dang skyid ba chen po ma lus pa myong bar mdzad ba rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku la bya ste /
translated: The gnosis of equality and the gnosis of individual realization experience in their entirety the enjoyment of the Dharma and great bliss, and this is the body of Vairochana.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes bya /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku zhes bya /
translated: The third is called the sambhogakaya, the body of perfect enjoyment.

original: @135b nirmm'a na k'a ya zhes bya ba sprul pa'i sku yin te /
analyzed: @135b nirmm'a na k'a ya zhes bya ba sprul pa'i sku yin te /
translated: The nirmanakaya, the emanation body, is called the nirmanakaya, the emanation body.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis sems can so so cis 'dul ba bzhin du thabs thabs su sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul te /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyis sems can so so cis 'dul ba bzhin du thabs thabs su sku dang gsung dang thugs sprul te /
translated: The wisdom of accomplishing activities emanates bodies, speech, and minds in various ways, in accordance with the individual disciples of sentient beings.

original: sna tshogs su ston pa la bya bas na /
analyzed: sna tshogs su ston pa la bya bas na /
translated: Since it is the activity of displaying various emanations,

original: sbrul pa'i sku zhes bya /
analyzed: sbrul pa'i sku zhes bya /
translated: it is called the emanation body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la /
translated: The ten powers of the tathagatas

original: da shata th'a ga ta ba lam zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yin te /
analyzed: da shata th'a ga ta ba lam zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu yin te /
translated: are called the dasha-tathagata-balani, the ten powers of the tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes sbrib pa med pas shes bya'i dngos po gang la yang thogs pa med de mkhyen pa 'di bcu'i mthu nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan las 'phags pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu zhes bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes sbrib pa med pas shes bya'i dngos po gang la yang thogs pa med de mkhyen pa 'di bcu'i mthu nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan las 'phags pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu zhes bya /
translated: Since the unobstructed wisdom of the tathagatas is not impeded by any object of knowledge, this knowledge is superior to that of shravakas and others. Therefore, it is called the ten powers of the tathagatas.🔽The power of knowing what is correct and incorrect

original: sth'a n'a sth'a na dzny'an ba lan zhes bya ba gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: sth'a n'a sth'a na dzny'an ba lan zhes bya ba gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: is called sthana-asthana-jnana-bala.

original: gnas ni legs par spyad pas 'bras bu yid du 'od ba 'grub pa dang / nyes par spyad pas 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba smin par 'gyur ba la sogs pa la bya /
analyzed: gnas ni legs par spyad pas 'bras bu yid du 'od ba 'grub pa dang / nyes par spyad pas 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba smin par 'gyur ba la sogs pa la bya /
translated: The domain refers to the fact that the results of good action are accomplished as desirable and the results of bad action ripen as undesirable.

original: gnas ma yin pa ni legs par spyad pa'i 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong bar gyur ba dang / nyes par spyad pa'i 'bras bu yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa ni legs par spyad pa'i 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong bar gyur ba dang / nyes par spyad pa'i 'bras bu yid du 'ong bar 'gyur ba la bya ste /
translated: The non-domain refers to the fact that the results of good action become undesirable and the results of bad action become desirable.

original: srid pa dang mi srid pa ma nor bar mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
analyzed: srid pa dang mi srid pa ma nor bar mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
translated: Because he possesses the power of unerring knowledge of what is possible and impossible, it is called the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible.🔽The power of knowledge of the ripening of karma

original: karmma bi p'a ka dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: karmma bi p'a ka dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: The power of knowledge of the ripening of karma is called karmavibhaktajnanabala in Sanskrit.

original: bla na med pa'i ye shes kyis 'das pa dang ; ma 'ongs pa dang / da lta byung ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa las kyi rgyu gang gis /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i ye shes kyis 'das pa dang ; ma 'ongs pa dang / da lta byung ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa las kyi rgyu gang gis /
translated: With unsurpassed knowledge, he knows the ripening of the results of the karma that has been taken up in the past, present and future.

original: gnas gang du 'bras bu smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /🔽n'a n'a dhi mukti dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: gnas gang du 'bras bu smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya / n'a n'a dhi mukti dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: The power to know where the results of actions will ripen.🔽The power to know the various inclinations of beings.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.

original: zag ba dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang khams gsum la dga' zhing mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs mkhyen pas na mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
analyzed: zag ba dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang khams gsum la dga' zhing mos pa rnam pa sna tshogs mkhyen pas na mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
translated: The power to know the various elements.

original: n'a n'a dh'a tu dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /🔽khams zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bag chags kyis grub pa'i bsam pa'i khams dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams dang / rnam par byang ba'i khams la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: n'a n'a dh'a tu dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te / khams zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi bag chags kyis grub pa'i bsam pa'i khams dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams dang / rnam par byang ba'i khams la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.

original: khams tha dad pa mang po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar thugs su chud pas na khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
analyzed: khams tha dad pa mang po'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar thugs su chud pas na khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
translated: The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.🔽The power to know the various elements.

original: aindri ya pa r'a pa ra dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa @136a * //
analyzed: aindri ya pa r'a pa ra dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa @136a * //
translated: The power of knowing what is supreme and what is not supreme is called indriya-para-apara-jnana-bala.

original: mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: It is the power of knowing what is supreme and what is not supreme.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i rim pa dang rnam grangs ma lus par mkhyen pa'i dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rab dang / 'bring dang / tha ma'i rim pa dang rnam grangs ma lus par mkhyen pa'i dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
translated: It is the power of knowing without exception the order of the faculties of faith and so forth, whether they are superior, middling, or inferior.

original: sarba tra g'a mi n'i bra ti bantha  ba lan zhes bya ba thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: sarba tra g'a mi n'i bra ti bantha  ba lan zhes bya ba thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: The power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere is called sarvatraga-gamini-pratipat-jnana-bala.

original: 'gro ba lngar skye ba'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das bar 'gro ba'i lam la sogs pa lam mo cog chub par mkhyen pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen ba'i stobs zhes bya /
analyzed: 'gro ba lngar skye ba'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das bar 'gro ba'i lam la sogs pa lam mo cog chub par mkhyen pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen ba'i stobs zhes bya /
translated: It is the power of knowing all paths, such as the paths that lead to rebirth in the five realms and the path that leads to nirvana.

original: sarba dhy'a na bi moksha sa m'a dhi sa m'a patti sam kla sha bya ba d'an dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyom par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs ba dang / rnam bar byang ba dang ldang pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: sarba dhy'a na bi moksha sa m'a dhi sa m'a patti sam kla sha bya ba d'an dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyom par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs ba dang / rnam bar byang ba dang ldang pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: The power of knowing the various dhāyanas, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, as well as their defilements and purification, is called the power of knowing all the dhāyanas, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, as well as their defilements and purification.

original: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mang po dang ; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la sogs pa la bya /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar ba brgyad dang / stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mang po dang ; mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la sogs pa la bya /
translated: This refers to the four such as the first dhyāna, the eight liberations, the many samādhis such as emptiness, the nine serial absorptions, and so on.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni lta ba dang dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nyon mongs par gyur ba la bya /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni lta ba dang dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis nyon mongs par gyur ba la bya /
translated: Defilement refers to being afflicted by various views and focal objects.

original: rnam par byang ba ni 'khor ba la chags pa med pa dang mi dmigs pa dang ldan pas rnam par dag pa la bya //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni 'khor ba la chags pa med pa dang mi dmigs pa dang ldan pas rnam par dag pa la bya //
translated: Purification refers to being free of attachment to saṃsāra and being endowed with nonapprehending.

original: ldan pa ni lugs dang mthun pa 'am mi mthun pa dang thod rgal la sogs pa'i tshul gyis ldan ba mkhyen pa la bya /
analyzed: ldan pa ni lugs dang mthun pa 'am mi mthun pa dang thod rgal la sogs pa'i tshul gyis ldan ba mkhyen pa la bya /
translated: “Possession” refers to knowing the possession of the afflictions in the forward or reverse order, in a skipping order, and so on.

original: p'urba ni b'a s'a nu smri ti dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen ba'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: p'urba ni b'a s'a nu smri ti dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen ba'i stobs yin te /
translated: Purvanivāsānusmrtijñānabala means “the power of the knowledge that remembers previous states.”

original: bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi tshe rabs grangs med pa tshun chad gnas gar skyes pa dang / byad gzugs kyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba dang / mtshan ma dang rtags ci yod pa dang las kyi rgyu cis skyes pa mkhyen pas na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi tshe rabs grangs med pa tshun chad gnas gar skyes pa dang / byad gzugs kyi rnam pa ci 'dra ba dang / mtshan ma dang rtags ci yod pa dang las kyi rgyu cis skyes pa mkhyen pas na sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /
translated: This power is the knowledge of where one and all sentient beings were born in the past, what their physical appearance was, what signs and marks they had, and what karmic causes gave rise to their birth.

original: tsyu tyu pa patt'i dzny'an ba lan zhes bya ba shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: tsyu tyu pa patt'i dzny'an ba lan zhes bya ba shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: Cyutyupapādajñānabala means “the power of the knowledge of death and rebirth.”

original: lha'i spyan gyis sems can rnams gang nas shi 'phos nas gang du skyes ba ma lus bar gzigs pas na shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /🔽a'a shra baksha ya dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba zag bzad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: lha'i spyan gyis sems can rnams gang nas shi 'phos nas gang du skyes ba ma lus bar gzigs pas na shi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya / a'a shra baksha ya dzny'a na ba lan zhes bya ba zag bzad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: The power of knowing death and birth is called cyutyupapādajñānabala.🔽The power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements is called āsravakṣayajñānabala.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bag chags yan chad zad cing byang bar gzigs @136b pas na zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi la tsa tva ri ta th'a ga ta bee sh'a ra dyam zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bag chags yan chad zad cing byang bar gzigs @136b pas na zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi la tsa tva ri ta th'a ga ta bee sh'a ra dyam zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi yin te /
translated: The power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements is called āsravakṣayajñānabala.🔽The four fearlessnesses of the tathagatas are called catvāri tathāgatavaiśāradyāni.

original: mi 'jigs ba bzhi dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa phal pa mang bo'i nang du byon nas khyu mchog gi gnas rlabs po che zhal gyis 'che ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs ba bzhi dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa phal pa mang bo'i nang du byon nas khyu mchog gi gnas rlabs po che zhal gyis 'che ste /
translated: The four fearlessnesses are as follows.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor zhing yang dag par seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pas na mi 'jigs ba zhes bya /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor zhing yang dag par seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pas na mi 'jigs ba zhes bya /
translated: Since he turns the Brahma wheel and roars the perfect lion's roar, he is fearless.

original: de la mngon par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs ba gnyis ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i yon tan yin pas na rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la mngon par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa dang zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs ba gnyis ni sangs rgyas nyid kyi rgyud la mnga' ba'i yon tan yin pas na rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
translated: Of these, the two fearlessnesses of manifest enlightenment and the knowledge of the destruction of defilements are the perfect fulfillment of one's own goal, for they are qualities possessed by the mindstream of a buddha.

original: bar du gcod ba'i chos des par bstan pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i lam bstan ba la mi 'jigs pa gnyis ni gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa yin pas na gzhan gyi don te /
analyzed: bar du gcod ba'i chos des par bstan pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i lam bstan ba la mi 'jigs pa gnyis ni gzhan la phan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa yin pas na gzhan gyi don te /
translated: The two fearlessnesses of teaching the factors that are obstacles and the path of definite deliverance are the benefit of others, for they are taught in order to benefit others.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bstan pa'ang yin no //
translated: They also teach the perfect fulfillment of one's own and others' goals.

original: sarba dharmm'a bhi sam bo dhi bee sh'a ra dyan zhes bya ba chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba la mi 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: sarba dharmm'a bhi sam bo dhi bee sh'a ra dyan zhes bya ba chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba la mi 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: Sarvadharma abhisambodhi vaiśāradya means fearlessness with regard to the manifest complete enlightenment of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad phyag mthil du skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu bzhag pa dang 'dra bar thugs su chud de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad phyag mthil du skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu bzhag pa dang 'dra bar thugs su chud de /
translated: The Tathagata has realized all phenomena to be like a myrobalan fruit in the palm of his hand.

original: mngon par byang chub pa la shes rab brnyes pas dge sbyong ngam bram ze'ang rung ;
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa la shes rab brnyes pas dge sbyong ngam bram ze'ang rung ;
translated: He has attained the wisdom of full enlightenment, so no ascetic or brahmin,

original: lha'i mig dang pha rol gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa lha'am bdud kyang rung rdzu 'phrul dang ldan zhing mthu che ba'i tshangs pas kyang chos dang mthun pas mngon par sangs rgyas pa ma yin par brgal ba'i gzhi dang gtan tshigs med
analyzed: lha'i mig dang pha rol gyi sems shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa lha'am bdud kyang rung rdzu 'phrul dang ldan zhing mthu che ba'i tshangs pas kyang chos dang mthun pas mngon par sangs rgyas pa ma yin par brgal ba'i gzhi dang gtan tshigs med
translated: no god, demon, Brahma or anyone else with great powers and miraculous abilities can legitimately dispute that he is fully enlightened.

original: de brgal gyis dogs pa med pas na chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de brgal gyis dogs pa med pas na chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs ba zhes bya ste /
translated: He has no fear that they might dispute this, so this is called fearlessness in fully and perfectly knowing all phenomena.

original: mi 'jigs pa 'og ma gsum gyi mjug kyang 'di dang 'dra bar bshad /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa 'og ma gsum gyi mjug kyang 'di dang 'dra bar bshad /
translated: The conclusion of the other three fearlessnesses is explained in the same way.

original: sarb'a shra paksha ya dzny'a na bee sh'a ra dyan zhes bya ba zag pa thams cad pa mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs ba yin te /
analyzed: sarb'a shra paksha ya dzny'a na bee sh'a ra dyan zhes bya ba zag pa thams cad pa mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs ba yin te /
translated: Sarva-asrava-parakshaya-jñana-vaisharadya means fearlessness in knowing the exhaustion of all defilements.

original: zag pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ming ste ;
analyzed: zag pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ming ste ;
translated: Asrava means afflictive emotion.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ma bral na srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyang slar 'dzag cing ltung bas na zag pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ma bral na srid pa'i rtse mo man chad kyang slar 'dzag cing ltung bas na zag pa zhes bya /
translated: If one is not free from afflictive emotions such as attachment, one will fall back down from even the peak of existence, so it is called asrava.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te zad par mkhyen pa la zag pa ma zad par sun dbyung zhing don rtags kyis brgal du med de /🔽mi dogs pas na zag pa thams @137a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te zad par mkhyen pa la zag pa ma zad par sun dbyung zhing don rtags kyis brgal du med de / mi dogs pas na zag pa thams @137a * //
translated: Knowing that all afflictive emotions have been eliminated and are exhausted, one cannot be refuted by others who say that the defilements have not been exhausted.

original: zad par mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: zad par mkhyen pa la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya /
translated: Since one has no doubts, it is called fearlessness in knowing the exhaustion of all defilements.

original: aanta ra yik dharmm'a na n+ya tha t'a ni shtsi ta by'a kar na bee sh'a ra dyan zhes bya ba bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: aanta ra yik dharmm'a na n+ya tha t'a ni shtsi ta by'a kar na bee sh'a ra dyan zhes bya ba bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: Antarayika-dharma-anyatha-ata-niyatha-vacana-vaisharadya means fearlessness in prophesying that the conditions that obstruct the path to liberation will not change.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos zhes bya ba bag med pa dang ngo tsha mi shes pa dang khrel med pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar du gcod pa rnams bar chad kyi chos yin no zhes lung bstan cing bshad pa la thog tu ma bab pa med pas na bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa zhes
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos zhes bya ba bag med pa dang ngo tsha mi shes pa dang khrel med pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar du gcod pa rnams bar chad kyi chos yin no zhes lung bstan cing bshad pa la thog tu ma bab pa med pas na bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa'i lung bstan pa la mi 'jigs pa zhes
translated: The teachings on obstacles are the teachings on heedlessness, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment and so on that are obstacles to the arya path and the side of virtue.🔽Since there is nothing that is not included in the teachings and explanations on the teachings on obstacles, it is called fearlessness in the definitive teachings on the teachings on obstacles that do not become something else.

original: bya / sarba si pa d'a dhi ga m'a yi neery'a ni ka pra ti patta th'a tva bee sh'a ra dyan zhes bya ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bya / sarba si pa d'a dhi ga m'a yi neery'a ni ka pra ti patta th'a tva bee sh'a ra dyan zhes bya ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob par 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa yin te /
translated: Sarvasipada-adhigama-ayinikapratipat-tatha-vaisyardya means fearlessness in the path that definitely leads to the attainment of all that is perfect and fearlessness in the path that definitely leads to the attainment of all that is perfect.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa bshad pa la nges par nges par 'byung ba'i lam ma yin no zhes dge sbyong ngam bram
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas nyan thos rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i lam mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal mthar 'byin pa bshad pa la nges par nges par 'byung ba'i lam ma yin no zhes dge sbyong ngam bram
translated: The Tathagata has explained to the Shravakas the path of definite deliverance, which will bring them the perfect bliss of nirvana and the end of suffering.🔽No one can dispute this, saying that it is not the path of definite deliverance, and so the Shravakas will certainly obtain all that is perfect.

original: ze sus kyang brgal zhing gzhan du bsgyur du med pas na phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob bar 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la /
analyzed: ze sus kyang brgal zhing gzhan du bsgyur du med pas na phun sum tshogs pa thams cad thob bar 'gyur ba nges par 'byung ba'i lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la /
translated: The fearlessness of the Tathagata in proclaiming that he has attained the path of definite deliverance is the first of the four fearlessnesses.🔽The eighteen distinctive qualities🔽The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are as follows.

original: aashta da sha be ni ka buddha dharmm'a zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yin te /
analyzed: aashta da sha be ni ka buddha dharmm'a zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yin te /
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are called the eighteen buddhadharmas.

original: chos 'di rnam nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: chos 'di rnam nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang mi mnga' ste /
translated: These qualities are not possessed by Shravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, or Bodhisattvas.

original: phal dang thun mong du gyur pa ma yin la /
analyzed: phal dang thun mong du gyur pa ma yin la /
translated: They are not shared in common with ordinary beings.🔽Since only the Buddha possesses these qualities, they are called the

original: sangs rgyas nyag gcig la yon tan 'di rnams mnga' bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyag gcig la yon tan 'di rnams mnga' bas na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya /
translated: unshared qualities of the Buddha.

original: n'a sti ta th'a ga ta sya sakha li tan zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul ba mi mnga' ba yin te /
analyzed: n'a sti ta th'a ga ta sya sakha li tan zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul ba mi mnga' ba yin te /
translated: As for “the Tathāgata has no error,” the Tathāgata has no error in his🔽physical, verbal, or mental actions. Therefore, it is said that the Tathāgata🔽has no error.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las la nor zhing thog tu ma bab pa med pas na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya /🔽n'a sti ra bi tan zhes bya ba ca co med pa yin te /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las la nor zhing thog tu ma bab pa med pas na de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya / n'a sti ra bi tan zhes bya ba ca co med pa yin te /
translated: As for “the Tathāgata has no chatter,” some arhats have errors such as🔽saying “pot” when they mean “jar,” or saying “jar” when they mean “pot.”🔽They also have chatter and verbal errors due to not having purified their🔽latent potentials. The Tathāgata does not have such things. Therefore, it is🔽said that he has no chatter.

original: dgra bcom ba kha cig la ma nor nas ku co 'don pa dang / sngon gyi bag chags ma byang bas ca co che zhing tshig la 'khral 'khrul yod pa lta bu ma yin pas ca co med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: dgra bcom ba kha cig la ma nor nas ku co 'don pa dang / sngon gyi bag chags ma byang bas ca co che zhing tshig la 'khral 'khrul yod pa lta bu ma yin pas ca co med pa zhes bya /
translated: As for “the Tathāgata has no forgetfulness,” some arhats, when they are🔽not paying attention, forget where they are going, where they are staying,🔽what they are doing, and what they are saying. The Tathāgata does not

original: n'a sti mu shi ta smri ti t'a zhes bya ba bsnyel ba med pa @137b yin te /
analyzed: n'a sti mu shi ta smri ti t'a zhes bya ba bsnyel ba med pa @137b yin te /
translated: have such things. Therefore, it is said that he has no forgetfulness.

original: dgra bcom pa la ma da gongs pa'i ye shes mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la ma da gongs pa'i ye shes mi mnga' ste /
translated: Arhats do not have the gnosis that is not in error with regard to the past.

original: bsnyel nas sems can gyi don bya ba la sogs pa shor ba dang / dus las yol ba lta bu ma yin pas na bsnyel ba med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: bsnyel nas sems can gyi don bya ba la sogs pa shor ba dang / dus las yol ba lta bu ma yin pas na bsnyel ba med pa zhes bya /
translated: They are not free from the possibility of forgetting something and then missing an opportunity to benefit a sentient being, for example, or of being late.

original: n'a sti sa m'a hi ta tsittam zhes bya ba sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: n'a sti sa m'a hi ta tsittam zhes bya ba sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “their minds are never without meditative equipoise” means that they are never in a state of mind that is not in meditative equipoise.

original: dgra bcom pa dag nam ting nge 'dzin gang la zhugs pa de'i tshe /🔽ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag nam ting nge 'dzin gang la zhugs pa de'i tshe / ting nge 'dzin de la mnyam par gzhag pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: When arhats enter a meditative absorption,🔽they are not like the Thus-Gone One, who has attained the supreme meditative absorption.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ting nge 'dzin mchog brnyes pas na ting nge 'dzin la zhugs kyang rung ma zhugs kyang rung ste /🔽mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pas na sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med ba zhes bya /🔽n'asti n'a n'a t'a sam dzny'a zhes bya ba /
