analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ting nge 'dzin mchog brnyes pas na ting nge 'dzin la zhugs kyang rung ma zhugs kyang rung ste / mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pas na sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med ba zhes bya / n'asti n'a n'a t'a sam dzny'a zhes bya ba /
translated: Whether or not the Thus-Gone One enters meditative absorption,🔽he is never in a state of mind that is not in meditative equipoise.

original: tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “they do not have the perception of multiplicity” means that they do not have the perception of multiplicity.

original: dgra bcom pa dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la bye brag tu 'dzin cing nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos la sogs pa la tha dad du 'byed pa lta bu mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la bye brag tu 'dzin cing nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos la sogs pa la tha dad du 'byed pa lta bu mi mnga' ste /
translated: They do not have the kind of discrimination that Arhats have, for instance, in regard to samsara and nirvana, or in regard to the phenomena of defilement and purity.

original: sems mnyam pa nyid dang chos mnyam pa nyid du gzigs pas na tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sems mnyam pa nyid dang chos mnyam pa nyid du gzigs pas na tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa zhes bya /
translated: They see the sameness of mind and the sameness of phenomena, so they are said to be without the discrimination of difference.

original: n'astya pra ti sam khy'a yo peksha zhes bya ba so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa yin te /
analyzed: n'astya pra ti sam khy'a yo peksha zhes bya ba so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa yin te /
translated: Asatyapratisaṅkhyāyoppekṣā means that they do not have the equanimity of nonconsideration.

original: dgra bcom pa dag sems can gyi don la ma brtags par yal bar 'dor ba lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag sems can gyi don la ma brtags par yal bar 'dor ba lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: Unlike Arhats, who leave sentient beings aside without considering what to do for them,

original: skal ba yang med dang dus la bab ma bab gzigs nas dus dang sbyor ba ma gtogs par yal bar 'dor ba med pas na so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med ba zhes bya /
analyzed: skal ba yang med dang dus la bab ma bab gzigs nas dus dang sbyor ba ma gtogs par yal bar 'dor ba med pas na so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med ba zhes bya /
translated: they do not leave anyone aside without considering whether the time is right to help them or not. They only leave them aside if the time is not right, so they are said to be without the equanimity of nonconsideration.

original: n'a sti tsatshanda sya h'a ni zhes bya ba 'dun pa nyams pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: n'a sti tsatshanda sya h'a ni zhes bya ba 'dun pa nyams pa med pa yin te /
translated: Asati chandasyahan means that they do not have the waning of interest.

original: dgra bcom pa dag spyod yul dman bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la mos shing 'dun ba med de nyan thos kyi bya ba la mos pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag spyod yul dman bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la mos shing 'dun ba med de nyan thos kyi bya ba la mos pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: Arhats have a limited sphere of activity, so they have no interest in the tathagatas’ level, unlike the interest they have in shravaka activities.

original: sangs rgyas sems can gyi don mdzod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi 'chad par bya ba la sogs pa la rtag tu 'dun par 'jug pas na 'dun pa nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sems can gyi don mdzod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi 'chad par bya ba la sogs pa la rtag tu 'dun par 'jug pas na 'dun pa nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: But bodhisattvas are always interested in the buddhas’ activities for the sake of sentient beings and in ensuring that the lineage of the Three Jewels is not broken, and so on.

original: n'asti b'i rya sya h'a ni zhes bya ba brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: n'asti b'i rya sya h'a ni zhes bya ba brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa yin te /
translated: Nastyabhiryasya hanih means that their diligence never declines.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can gcig gi phyir bskal bar chos bshad kyang sku dang gsung dang thugs bsnyel bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sems can gcig gi phyir yang 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med ba 'das te gshegs pas na @138a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can gcig gi phyir bskal bar chos bshad kyang sku dang gsung dang thugs bsnyel bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sems can gcig gi phyir yang 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med ba 'das te gshegs pas na @138a * //
translated: The tathagatas never forget their bodies, speech, or minds, even though they may be teaching the Dharma for an eon for the sake of a single sentient being, and they go to worlds beyond countless buddhafields for the sake of a single sentient being.

original: brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: So their diligence never declines.

original: nasti smri ti h'a ni zhes bya ba dran pa nyams pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: nasti smri ti h'a ni zhes bya ba dran pa nyams pa med pa yin te /
translated: Nastyasmrtihanih means that their mindfulness never declines.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / mos pa la sogs pa sems can 'dul ba'i thabs dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad dang / chos thams cad ji ltar gzigs shing dgongs pa la phyis ye shes kyis brtag mi dgos te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang / mos pa la sogs pa sems can 'dul ba'i thabs dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad dang / chos thams cad ji ltar gzigs shing dgongs pa la phyis ye shes kyis brtag mi dgos te /
translated: The way in which he sees and knows the minds, conduct, thoughts, aspirations and so forth of all sentient beings, the methods for training sentient beings, all the deeds of the buddhas and all phenomena, is not something that needs to be investigated by wisdom at a later stage.

original: nyams pa med pas na dran pa nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: nyams pa med pas na dran pa nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: Since it is without decline, it is called “unfailing memory.”

original: n'asti sa m'a dherh'a ni zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: n'asti sa m'a dherh'a ni zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa yin te /
translated: The samadhi called “unfailing samadhi” is unfailing samadhi.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid la snyoms par 'jug cing de las mi g-yo bar 'dzin pas na ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid la snyoms par 'jug cing de las mi g-yo bar 'dzin pas na ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: Since it is absorbed in the sameness of the suchness of all phenomena and holds it without wavering, it is called “unfailing samadhi.”

original: n'asti pra dzny'a y'art'a ni zhes bya ba shes rab nyams pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: n'asti pra dzny'a y'art'a ni zhes bya ba shes rab nyams pa med pa yin te /
translated: The “unfailing wisdom” is unfailing wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / so sor yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa mnga' bas na shes rab nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin pa mkhyen pa mi zad pa dang / so sor yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa mnga' bas na shes rab nyams pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to have inexhaustible wisdom because he has inexhaustible knowledge of the conduct of all sentient beings, inexhaustible knowledge of the ripening of sentient beings, and inexhaustible knowledge of the analytical knowledges.

original: n'asti bi mukterha ni zhes bya ba rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: n'asti bi mukterha ni zhes bya ba rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa yin te /
translated: Nastavimuktairha nah means he is inexhaustible in liberation.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las grol bas na rnam par grol ba nyams ba med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las grol bas na rnam par grol ba nyams ba med pa zhes bya /
translated: He is said to be inexhaustible in liberation because he is liberated from all the obscurations of affliction and the obscurations to knowledge.

original: sarba k'a ya karma dzny'a na burbam ga mam dzny'a n'a nu pa ri bartt'i zhes bya ba lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: sarba k'a ya karma dzny'a na burbam ga mam dzny'a n'a nu pa ri bartt'i zhes bya ba lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: Sarvakaya karma jnanapuranagamanajnananupurivartiti means all his physical actions are preceded by and followed by wisdom.

original: dgra bcom ba kha cig lus kyi las bsam bzhin ma yin bar byed de /
analyzed: dgra bcom ba kha cig lus kyi las bsam bzhin ma yin bar byed de /
translated: Some arhats perform physical actions without thinking,

original: 'jig rten gyi yid dang 'gal ba lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yid dang 'gal ba lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: but this is not like the actions of those who are contrary to the minds of worldly people.

original: spyod lam bzhi po kun gyis kyang sems can 'dul te /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi po kun gyis kyang sems can 'dul te /
translated: They also train sentient beings in all four modes of activity.

original: ye shes sngar 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung bas na ye shes sngon du 'gro ba yin /
analyzed: ye shes sngar 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung bas na ye shes sngon du 'gro ba yin /
translated: They are preceded by wisdom because they arise from the cause of previously arisen wisdom.

original: ye shes dang lhan cig 'byung zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pas na ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: ye shes dang lhan cig 'byung zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pas na ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: They follow wisdom because they occur simultaneously with wisdom and are engaged in by wisdom.

original: bsdus na lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya /
analyzed: bsdus na lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya /
translated: In brief, all physical actions are called preceded by wisdom and following wisdom.

original: ngag dang yid kyi skabs su yang ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba 'di bzhin du bshad /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi skabs su yang ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba 'di bzhin du bshad /
translated: The same explanation is given for speech and mind.

original: sarba w'akkarmma dzny'an b'urbam ga mam dzny'an'a nu pa ri bartti zhes bya ba ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: sarba w'akkarmma dzny'an b'urbam ga mam dzny'an'a nu pa ri bartti zhes bya ba ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: All verbal actions are preceded by wisdom and follow wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad cing chos bstan pa la don @138b med cing chung za bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad cing chos bstan pa la don @138b med cing chung za bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: He acts for the welfare of all sentient beings and teaches the Dharma without it ever becoming meaningless or insignificant.

original: gsung gi yan lag drug cu dang ldan pas na ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya /
analyzed: gsung gi yan lag drug cu dang ldan pas na ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya /
translated: Since his speech is endowed with the sixty branches of speech, all his verbal actions are said to be preceded by and to follow after wisdom.

original: sarba man: karmma dzny'a na p'urbam ga mam dzny'a n'a nu pa ri bartti zhes bya ba yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: sarba man: karmma dzny'a na p'urbam ga mam dzny'a n'a nu pa ri bartti zhes bya ba yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: All his mental actions are preceded by and follow after wisdom.

original: nyon mongs ba dang spros pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral te /
analyzed: nyon mongs ba dang spros pa'i bag chags thams cad dang bral te /
translated: He is free from all the habitual tendencies of afflictions and conceptual thoughts.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' don dam pa'i mtshan nyid dang ma bral bas na yid kyi las thams cad ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang pa zhes bya /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' don dam pa'i mtshan nyid dang ma bral bas na yid kyi las thams cad ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang pa zhes bya /
translated: Since he is never separate from the ultimate reality, the limit of reality, all his mental actions are said to follow after wisdom.

original: aa t'i te dhva n+ya sam ga m'a pra ti ha ta dzny'a na darsha nam pa ri ba rtta te zhes bya ba 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: aa t'i te dhva n+ya sam ga m'a pra ti ha ta dzny'a na darsha nam pa ri ba rtta te zhes bya ba 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “he has the wisdom vision that is unobstructed and unhampered with regard to the past” means that he has the wisdom vision that is unobstructed and unhampered with regard to the past.

original: dgra bcom pa ltar 'das pa'i dus kyi dngos po ci la brtags pa sna gcig mkhyen gyi gzhan la thogs shing mi mkhyen pa lta bu ma yin gyis /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ltar 'das pa'i dus kyi dngos po ci la brtags pa sna gcig mkhyen gyi gzhan la thogs shing mi mkhyen pa lta bu ma yin gyis /
translated: Unlike an arhat, who knows only one thing when examining a thing from the past and is obstructed and does not know anything else,

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sa chu me rlung gi rdul phra mo'i grangs dang / sems can gyi bsam pa dang spyod pa la sogs pa ma lus pa mnyam par gzhag pa dang / ma bzhag pa'i dus dang sbyar ba med cing cil yang thags thogs med pa thugs su chud pas na /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sa chu me rlung gi rdul phra mo'i grangs dang / sems can gyi bsam pa dang spyod pa la sogs pa ma lus pa mnyam par gzhag pa dang / ma bzhag pa'i dus dang sbyar ba med cing cil yang thags thogs med pa thugs su chud pas na /
translated: the Buddha comprehends without exception the buddhafields of the past, the number of the most subtle particles of earth, water, fire and wind, the thoughts and deeds of sentient beings and so on, and he does so without entering meditative equipoise and without any impediment whatsoever.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug pa zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, it is said that he has the wisdom vision that is unobstructed and unhampered with regard to the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus kyi skabs su yang 'di bzhin du sbyar zhing bshad /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus kyi skabs su yang 'di bzhin du sbyar zhing bshad /
translated: This should be applied in the same way to the past and present.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la /
translated: The four correct knowledges

original: tsa tushth'a pra ti sam bid ces bya ba so so yang dag bar rig pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: tsa tushth'a pra ti sam bid ces bya ba so so yang dag bar rig pa bzhi yin te /
translated: catuḥpratisamvid means the four correct knowledges.

original: chos dang don dang des pa'i tshig dang spobs ba bzhi la mkhas pas so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya /
analyzed: chos dang don dang des pa'i tshig dang spobs ba bzhi la mkhas pas so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya /
translated: They are called correct knowledges because one is skilled in the four: Dharma, meaning, language and confidence.🔽The three miracles

original: cho 'phrul gsum la tri ni pr'a ti h'ary'a ni zhes bya ba cho 'phrul gsum yin te /
analyzed: cho 'phrul gsum la tri ni pr'a ti h'ary'a ni zhes bya ba cho 'phrul gsum yin te /
translated: triṇirmitaḥ prātihāryāṇi means the three miracles.🔽ādeśanāprātihārya means the miracle of revealing the mind, knowing what others are thinking.

original: a'a de sha na pr'a ti h'arya zhes bya ba pha rol gyi snying la ci sems pa mkhyen pas ji sems pa kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / ri ddhi pr'a ti t'a rya nam mkha' la gshegs pa dang / sku lus mang por sprul pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang /
analyzed: a'a de sha na pr'a ti h'arya zhes bya ba pha rol gyi snying la ci sems pa mkhyen pas ji sems pa kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / ri ddhi pr'a ti t'a rya nam mkha' la gshegs pa dang / sku lus mang por sprul pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dang /
translated: ṛddhiprātihārya means the miracle of transformation, such as traveling through space and emanating many bodies.

original: aa nu sh'a sa sh'a sa n'i pr'a ti h'arya bden pa gnyis kyi sgo nas chos thams cad gtan la phab bar bkrol te phan zhing rjes su mthun par bshad pas na rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul rnam pa 'di gsum ngo mtshar che ba'i rmad du byung
analyzed: aa nu sh'a sa sh'a sa n'i pr'a ti h'arya bden pa gnyis kyi sgo nas chos thams cad gtan la phab bar bkrol te phan zhing rjes su mthun par bshad pas na rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul rnam pa 'di gsum ngo mtshar che ba'i rmad du byung
translated: The miracle of instruction is also wondrous and marvelous.

original: bas sems can mang po dad cing 'dun par mdzad pas na cho 'phrul gsum zhes bya /🔽byang chub sems @139a * //
analyzed: bas sems can mang po dad cing 'dun par mdzad pas na cho 'phrul gsum zhes bya / byang chub sems @139a * //
translated: It is the three miracles that cause many beings to have faith and to be inspired.🔽The explanation of the word bodhisattva.

original: dpa'i sgra bshad pa la po dhi sa tva zhes bya bas tva na ye sh'am ste bo dhi satva zhes pa bo dhi byang chub /
analyzed: dpa'i sgra bshad pa la po dhi sa tva zhes bya bas tva na ye sh'am ste bo dhi satva zhes pa bo dhi byang chub /
translated: Bodhisattva is explained as bodhi sattva.

original: satva ni sems dpa' 'am sems stobs che ba la bya /
analyzed: satva ni sems dpa' 'am sems stobs che ba la bya /
translated: Sattva means “being” or “one with great courage.”

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub pa la gcig tu brtul zhing me nur bas na byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub sgrub pa la gcig tu brtul zhing me nur bas na byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: They are called bodhisattvas because they are resolute and undeterred in their pursuit of unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: mah'a satva zhes bya ba ma h'a ni chen po /
analyzed: mah'a satva zhes bya ba ma h'a ni chen po /
translated: Mahayana is explained as mahat sattva.

original: satva ni sems dpa' ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa lta bu ma yin gyi /🔽sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: satva ni sems dpa' ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa lta bu ma yin gyi / sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir /
translated: Sattva means “heroic being.” It is not like the generation of the thought of enlightenment of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽It is the generation of the thought of enlightenment of the bodhisattvas, who have the thought, “I will become a buddha for the sake of all sentient beings, and I will liberate all sentient beings.”

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la zhugs pas na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la zhugs pas na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya /
translated: Because they have entered into unsurpassable enlightenment in order to liberate all sentient beings, they are called “great heroic beings.”

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos kyi sa'i rim pa'i ming la da sha bh'u mi zhes bya ba sa bcu yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos kyi sa'i rim pa'i ming la da sha bh'u mi zhes bya ba sa bcu yin te /
translated: The names of the stages of the grounds of the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and śrāvakas are called daśabhūmi, the “ten grounds.”

original: sa gong ma'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i rten du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sa gong ma'i yon tan thob par bya ba'i rten du 'gyur zhing /
translated: They are called “grounds” because they are the support for attaining the qualities of the higher grounds,

original: sa de nyid yon tan gyi gzhi yin pas nas zhes bya /
analyzed: sa de nyid yon tan gyi gzhi yin pas nas zhes bya /
translated: and because those grounds themselves are the basis of qualities.

original: sa dang po pra mu di ta ces bya ba ni don chen po sngon 'dris pa ma yin pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thob pa dang / byang chub dang nye zhing sems can mang po'i don sgrub ba gzigs nas dga' ba rlabs po che skye bas rab tu dga' ba zhes bya /
analyzed: sa dang po pra mu di ta ces bya ba ni don chen po sngon 'dris pa ma yin pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems thob pa dang / byang chub dang nye zhing sems can mang po'i don sgrub ba gzigs nas dga' ba rlabs po che skye bas rab tu dga' ba zhes bya /
translated: The first ground, called “The Joyful One,” is so called because one sees that one has attained the great aim, the supramundane mind that is not previously familiar, that one is close to enlightenment, and that one will accomplish the welfare of many sentient beings, and so one gives rise to a great wave of joy.

original: sa gnyis pa ni bi ma la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa ni bi ma la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The second level is called Immaculate.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i ltung ba phra mo yan chad kyang byang bas na dri ma med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i ltung ba phra mo yan chad kyang byang bas na dri ma med pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called Immaculate because even the most subtle downfalls of ethical violations are purified.🔽The third level is called Illuminating.

original: sa gsum pa pra bt'a ka ri zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su dag pa ye shes kyi snang ba chen po'i gnas su gyur pa thob bas na 'od byed pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sa gsum pa pra bt'a ka ri zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po yongs su dag pa ye shes kyi snang ba chen po'i gnas su gyur pa thob bas na 'od byed pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called Illuminating because one has attained the state of the completely pure aggregate of meditative absorption that transcends the levels of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha and is the basis for the great illumination of timeless awareness.

original: sa bzhi pa aartsi shma ti zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa aartsi shma ti zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The fourth level is called Radiant.

original: nyon mongs pa sreg pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi me'i 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sreg pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi me'i 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya /
translated: It is called Radiant because it is the radiance of the fire of the aspects of enlightenment that consume afflictive states.

original: sa lnga pa su du rdza ya zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las 'das pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sgom zhing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka la mi gnas pa'i shes rab yongs su dag par sbyang zhing sgom
analyzed: sa lnga pa su du rdza ya zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las 'das pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sgom zhing 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka la mi gnas pa'i shes rab yongs su dag par sbyang zhing sgom
translated: The fifth level, the one called Hard to Master, is so called because it is very difficult to train in and cultivate the completely pure wisdom that does not abide in either samsara or nirvana while meditating on the four noble truths that transcend those of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: pa shin tu dka' bas na sa de non par dka' ba 'am bsgrub par dka' ba la bya ste /
analyzed: pa shin tu dka' bas na sa de non par dka' ba 'am bsgrub par dka' ba la bya ste /
translated: It is therefore called Hard to Master or Hard to Accomplish because it is difficult to traverse or to achieve.

original: shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya /
analyzed: shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya /
translated: It is called Very Hard to Train.

original: sa drug pa aa bhi mu khi zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka la mi gnas shing mtshan ma med pa la gnas shing mtshan ma med pa la rang gi ngang
analyzed: sa drug pa aa bhi mu khi zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis ka la mi gnas shing mtshan ma med pa la gnas shing mtshan ma med pa la rang gi ngang
translated: The sixth level, the one called Clearly Manifest, is so called because, on the basis of transcendent wisdom, one does not abide in either samsara or nirvana, one abides naturally in the absence of attributes and one abides in and perceives the gnosis that is naturally engaged in the absence of attributes.

original: gis @139b 'jug pa'i ye shes la mang du gnas shing mngon du gzigs pas na mngon du gyur pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gis @139b 'jug pa'i ye shes la mang du gnas shing mngon du gzigs pas na mngon du gyur pa zhes bya /
translated: It is therefore called Clearly Manifest.

original: sa bdun pa d'u ram ga ma zhes bya ba mtshan ma med pa la bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa'i lam dang nye zhing ring du phyin pas na ring du song ba zhes bya /
analyzed: sa bdun pa d'u ram ga ma zhes bya ba mtshan ma med pa la bgrod pa gcig tu gyur pa'i lam dang nye zhing ring du phyin pas na ring du song ba zhes bya /
translated: The seventh level, that of The One of Fine Intelligence, is called that of The One Who Has Gone Far because one has come close to the path of the single way of experiencing what is beyond the ordinary imagination and has gone far beyond the ordinary.

original: sa brgyad pa aa tsal zhes bya ba ni mchan ma'i 'du shes dang mtshan ma med par rtsol ba'i 'du shes gnyi gas bskyod par mi nus pas mi g-yo ba zhes bya /🔽sa dgu pa s'a dhu ma ti zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa aa tsal zhes bya ba ni mchan ma'i 'du shes dang mtshan ma med par rtsol ba'i 'du shes gnyi gas bskyod par mi nus pas mi g-yo ba zhes bya / sa dgu pa s'a dhu ma ti zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The eighth level, that of The One of Immutable Wisdom, is called that of The One Who Is Immutable because one cannot be moved by either the perception of what is beyond the ordinary imagination or the perception of striving to attain what is beyond the ordinary imagination.

original: sa dgu pa la so so yang dag par rig pa brnyes pas na blo gros gzhan las 'phags pa yin te legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya /
analyzed: sa dgu pa la so so yang dag par rig pa brnyes pas na blo gros gzhan las 'phags pa yin te legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya /
translated: The ninth level, that of The One of Brilliant Intelligence, is called that of The One of Brilliant Intelligence because one has attained the states of authentic discernment.

original: sa bcu pa dharmma me gha zhes bya ba ni gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin kun la yang sprin dang 'dra bar khab cing thos pa'i chos nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la sprin bzhin du khab pas na chos kyi sprin zhes bya /
analyzed: sa bcu pa dharmma me gha zhes bya ba ni gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin kun la yang sprin dang 'dra bar khab cing thos pa'i chos nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la sprin bzhin du khab pas na chos kyi sprin zhes bya /
translated: The tenth level, that of The One Who Is Clothed in the Dharma, is called that of The One Who Is Clothed in the Dharma because one is like a cloud in that one is filled with all the powers of complete recall and states of meditative absorption and because one is like a cloud in that one fills the skylike teachings one has received with the teachings one has gained through one's own realization.

original: sangs rgyas kyis sa manta pra bh'a buddha bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni 'od zer mang po bkye bas 'dul ba'i sems can smin par mdzad cing chos kyi snang ba 'od dang 'dra bas thams cad la gsal bar byas pas na sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od ces
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis sa manta pra bh'a buddha bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni 'od zer mang po bkye bas 'dul ba'i sems can smin par mdzad cing chos kyi snang ba 'od dang 'dra bas thams cad la gsal bar byas pas na sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od ces
translated: The Buddha's stage is called Samantaprabha, which means that by emitting many rays of light, he ripens sentient beings to be trained and illuminates all with the light of the Dharma, like light.

original: bya / shukla bi darsha na bh'u mi:zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i drod la dang po rnam par byang ba dkar po mthong bas dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya /
analyzed: bya / shukla bi darsha na bh'u mi:zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i drod la dang po rnam par byang ba dkar po mthong bas dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa zhes bya /
translated: The stage of white insight is called Suklavidarśanabhūmi. On the heat of the stage of devoted conduct, one first sees the white purity, so it is called the stage of seeing white.

original: go tra bh'u mi: zhes bya ba ni dad pa shin tu che ba'i sa 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog la chos dang gang zag la bdag med par bzod pas na byang chub thob pa'i rigs dang ldan pas na rigs kyi sa zhes bya /
analyzed: go tra bh'u mi: zhes bya ba ni dad pa shin tu che ba'i sa 'jig rten gyi chos kyi mchog la chos dang gang zag la bdag med par bzod pas na byang chub thob pa'i rigs dang ldan pas na rigs kyi sa zhes bya /
translated: The stage of great faith is called Gotrabhūmi. On the supreme mundane quality, one has patience with the selflessness of phenomena and persons, so it is called the stage of lineage because one possesses the lineage that will attain enlightenment.

original: aashta mi ka bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: aashta mi ka bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa la bya ste /
translated: The eighth stage is called Aṣṭamaka Bhūmi.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gral dang po nas yas bgrangs na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i gral dang po nas yas bgrangs na /
translated: If one counts from the first stage of attaining the result of an arhat,🔽the eighth stage is the stage of entering the stream-enterer.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la 'jug pa grangs brgyad pa la bab pas na brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya /🔽darsha na bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni dri shy'ata preksha na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la 'jug pa grangs brgyad pa la bab pas na brgyad pa'i sa zhes bya / darsha na bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni dri shy'ata preksha na zhes bya ste /
translated: The darśana-bhūmi is called the “stage of seeing.”

original: dri sha ni mthong ba /
analyzed: dri sha ni mthong ba /
translated: Darśana means “seeing.”

original: bh'u mi ni sa ste /
analyzed: bh'u mi ni sa ste /
translated: Bhūmi means “stage.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pas de khon nyid rtag par mthong bas na mthong pa'i sa zhes bya /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pas de khon nyid rtag par mthong bas na mthong pa'i sa zhes bya /
translated: Because one who abides in the result of stream-enterer constantly sees suchness, it is called the stage of seeing.🔽The tanū-bhūmi is called the “stage of thinning.”

original: ta n'u bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong bas 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags sra ba mor byas pas na bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya /
analyzed: ta n'u bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni lan cig phyir 'ong bas 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags sra ba mor byas pas na bsrabs pa'i sa zhes bya /
translated: Because the once-returner thins the hard-to-abandon afflictions of the desire realm, it is called the stage of thinning.

original: b'i ta r'a ga bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la bya ste /
analyzed: b'i ta r'a ga bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa la bya ste /
translated: The vītarāga-bhūmi is called the “stage of nonattachment.”

original: sa 'di la gnas pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems spangs pas na 'dod pa'i @140a * //
analyzed: sa 'di la gnas pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems spangs pas na 'dod pa'i @140a * //
translated: Because one who abides on this stage abandons the desire to be attached to the desire realm and the desire to harm,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yin te /
translated: one is free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa zhes bya /
translated: The level of freedom from attachment.

original: kri t'a bhi bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i sa la bya ste /
analyzed: kri t'a bhi bh'u mi zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i sa la bya ste /
translated: The level of the arhat is called the level of what has been done.

original: kri ta ni byas pa /
analyzed: kri ta ni byas pa /
translated: Kṛta means done.

original: aa bhi ni aa bhi du ma sh'i la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: aa bhi ni aa bhi du ma sh'i la zhes bya ste /
translated: Abhi means abhi-duḥkha-śīla, which means

original: bsrung ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas na /
analyzed: bsrung ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas na /
translated: the nature of protection.

original: sngar byas te grub pa'i don mi nyams par bsrung ba'i phyir byas pa srung ba'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sngar byas te grub pa'i don mi nyams par bsrung ba'i phyir byas pa srung ba'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is the level of protecting what has been done, it is called the level of protecting what has been done.

original: dngos su na dgra bcom pa'i sa la bya /
analyzed: dngos su na dgra bcom pa'i sa la bya /
translated: In fact, it is the level of the arhat.

original: mos pas spyod pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rim pa'i ming la aa dhi mukti tsarya bh'u mi zhes bya ba /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rim pa'i ming la aa dhi mukti tsarya bh'u mi zhes bya ba /
translated: The names of the stages of the path of earnest aspiration and the stages conducive to penetrating insight are called the level of practice of devoted interest.

original: bskal pa grangs med ba gcig gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings la mos pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med ba gcig gi bar du byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings la mos pa bsgoms te /
translated: For one incalculable eon, bodhisattvas meditate on devoted interest in the expanse of reality.

original: da dung de bzhin nyid ma mthong pas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya /
analyzed: da dung de bzhin nyid ma mthong pas na mos pas spyod pa'i sa zhes bya /
translated: Since they have still not seen suchness, it is called the level of practice of devoted interest.

original: a'a lo ka labdha zhes bya ba chos kyi dbyings la mos pas bsgoms pa'i bye brag gis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med de brjod pa tsam du rig la /
analyzed: a'a lo ka labdha zhes bya ba chos kyi dbyings la mos pas bsgoms pa'i bye brag gis rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med de brjod pa tsam du rig la /
translated: The stage called “attaining light” is so called because by cultivating interest in the expanse of reality, one realizes that all phenomena, which are investigated as being characterized by general and specific properties, do not exist as things but are mere expressions.

original: chos la des par rtog pa'i bzod pa'i snang ba dang po thob pas na snang ba thob pa zhes bya /
analyzed: chos la des par rtog pa'i bzod pa'i snang ba dang po thob pas na snang ba thob pa zhes bya /
translated: And because one has attained the first appearance of the acceptance that realizes the nature of phenomena, it is called “attaining light.”

original: a'a lo ka briddhi zhes bya ba chos kyi snang ba de nyid rgyas par bya ba'i brtson pa brtan par rtsom pas na snang ba mched pa zhes bya /
analyzed: a'a lo ka briddhi zhes bya ba chos kyi snang ba de nyid rgyas par bya ba'i brtson pa brtan par rtsom pas na snang ba mched pa zhes bya /
translated: The stage called “increasing light” is so called because one begins to make a firm effort to increase that very light of the Dharma.

original: ta tv'a rtheek de sh'a nu pra be sha zhes bya ba chos kyi snang ba mched pas phyi rol gyi yul med cing sems tsam du rtogs te /
analyzed: ta tv'a rtheek de sh'a nu pra be sha zhes bya ba chos kyi snang ba mched pas phyi rol gyi yul med cing sems tsam du rtogs te /
translated: The stage called “entry into the domain of thatness” is so called because, by increasing the light of the Dharma, one realizes that external objects do not exist and that there is only mind.

original: gzung ba'i g-yeng ba dang bral bas na de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig zhugs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gzung ba'i g-yeng ba dang bral bas na de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig zhugs pa zhes bya /
translated: And because one is free of the distraction of apprehended objects, one has entered into one aspect of the meaning of thatness.

original: aa nantarya sa m'a dhi zhes bya ba dad pa rab kyis sa 'di la 'dzin pa'i g-yeng ba spangs nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa de ma thag tu thob par 'gyur bas na bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya
analyzed: aa nantarya sa m'a dhi zhes bya ba dad pa rab kyis sa 'di la 'dzin pa'i g-yeng ba spangs nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa de ma thag tu thob par 'gyur bas na bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya
translated: The “stage of uninterrupted meditative absorption” is so called because those with the highest degree of faith, having eliminated the distractions of grasping, will immediately attain nonconceptual supramundane gnosis.

original: / nirbhe dha bha g'i ya zhes bya ba ni ni shci tu bhi dha ni bhe dha ph'a g'i ya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / nirbhe dha bha g'i ya zhes bya ba ni ni shci tu bhi dha ni bhe dha ph'a g'i ya zhes bya ste /
translated: The “stage of certain conduct” is so called because it is the stage of certain realization.

original: nir ni nges pa 'am gdon mi za ba /
analyzed: nir ni nges pa 'am gdon mi za ba /
translated: Nir means certain or definite;

original: be dha ni rtogs pa 'am 'byed pa /
analyzed: be dha ni rtogs pa 'am 'byed pa /
translated: vedha means realization or penetration;

original: bha ga ni cha'am skal ba /
analyzed: bha ga ni cha'am skal ba /
translated: bhaga means fortune or portion;

original: a'i ya ni phan pa 'am mthun pa lta bu la bya ste /
analyzed: a'i ya ni phan pa 'am mthun pa lta bu la bya ste /
translated: and ā means beneficial or conducive.

original: dngos su na 'phags pa'i sa ni ma thob la /
analyzed: dngos su na 'phags pa'i sa ni ma thob la /
translated: In fact, one has not attained the noble levels,

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa las ni 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa las ni 'das pa yin te /
translated: but one has gone beyond the level of ordinary beings.

original: 'phags pa'i lam mthong ba dang sgom pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i nang nas mthong ba'i lam gyi cha gcig bo dang nye bas na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam mthong ba dang sgom pa rnam pa gnyis yod pa'i nang nas mthong ba'i lam gyi cha gcig bo dang nye bas na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya /
translated: From among the two types of the path of seeing and the path of meditation, it is called “the stage that is conducive to penetrative insight” because it is close to the path of seeing.

original: aushma ga ta zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshe @140b 'phags pa'i lam nyon mongs pa'i shing thams cad sreg pa'i me dang 'dra ba'i drod sngar byung bas na dro bar gyur pa zhes bya /
analyzed: aushma ga ta zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i tshe @140b 'phags pa'i lam nyon mongs pa'i shing thams cad sreg pa'i me dang 'dra ba'i drod sngar byung bas na dro bar gyur pa zhes bya /
translated: Ushmagata means that because the heat of the noble path, which is like a fire that burns all the trees of the afflictions, first arises when one is in the stage that is conducive to penetrative insight, it is called “heat.”

original: m'urdha zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba snga ma mi brtan pa g-yo ba'i rtse mor phyin pas na rtse mo zhes bya /
analyzed: m'urdha zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba snga ma mi brtan pa g-yo ba'i rtse mor phyin pas na rtse mo zhes bya /
translated: Murdha means that because one has reached the peak of the unstable roots of virtue that existed previously, it is called “peak.”

original: ksham ti zhes bya ba ni bden pa la bzod pa rab 'bring du mar phye ba'i nang nas bzod pa rab dang ldan pa ste /🔽de las nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ksham ti zhes bya ba ni bden pa la bzod pa rab 'bring du mar phye ba'i nang nas bzod pa rab dang ldan pa ste / de las nyams par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Kshanti means that from among the many divisions of the degrees of acceptance of the truths, it is the acceptance that possesses the highest degree.

original: ngan song du mi ltung bas na bzod pa zhes bya /
analyzed: ngan song du mi ltung bas na bzod pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called “acceptance” because one will not fall back from that and will not fall into the lower realms.

original: lo ki k'a gra dharmma zhes bya ba sa 'di 'jig rten pa'i chos kyang yin la /
analyzed: lo ki k'a gra dharmma zhes bya ba sa 'di 'jig rten pa'i chos kyang yin la /
translated: Lokottara-agra-dharma means that this stage is a mundane phenomenon,

original: sngan chad ma mthong bas 'phags pa'i lam lta bu 'jig rten pa'i chos dang mi mthun pa yang 'jig rten ba'i chos kyi mcho ga 'dis cha mnyam pa'i rgyu med par 'thob par nus te /
analyzed: sngan chad ma mthong bas 'phags pa'i lam lta bu 'jig rten pa'i chos dang mi mthun pa yang 'jig rten ba'i chos kyi mcho ga 'dis cha mnyam pa'i rgyu med par 'thob par nus te /
translated: but since it has not been seen before, it is a mundane phenomenon that is not in accord with mundane phenomena, such as the noble path. It is possible to attain it without a homogeneous cause by means of this supreme mundane phenomenon.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi phul du byung bas na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi phul du byung bas na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya /
translated: Since it is the best of mundane phenomena, it is called the supreme mundane phenomenon.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyi gang zag gi rim pa'i ming la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyi gang zag gi rim pa'i ming la /
translated: The names of the stages of the individual of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha

original: pra tye ka buddha zhes bya ba ae ka barga n'a ma pra ti buddha bo dhi pra tye ka buddha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pra tye ka buddha zhes bya ba ae ka barga n'a ma pra ti buddha bo dhi pra tye ka buddha zhes bya ste /
translated: . Pratyekabuddha means eka-arga-nāma-prati-buddho bodhi-pratyekabuddha.

original: sems can mang pos don mi mdzad kyi /
analyzed: sems can mang pos don mi mdzad kyi /
translated: Since they do not benefit many sentient beings,

original: bdag gcig pu byang chub pa dang mya ngan las 'das par sgrub pas na rang sangs rgyas zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu byang chub pa dang mya ngan las 'das par sgrub pas na rang sangs rgyas zhes bya /
translated: they accomplish their own enlightenment and nirvāṇa, so they are called pratyekabuddhas.

original: khadga bi sh'a na kalpa zhes bya ba khadga bi sh'a na tu lya tv'a ta /🔽khadga bi sh'a na kalpa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khadga bi sh'a na kalpa zhes bya ba khadga bi sh'a na tu lya tv'a ta / khadga bi sh'a na kalpa zhes bya ste /
translated: The term pratyekabuddha is derived from pratyekabuddha-tulyatva.

original: rang sangs rgyas bskal pa brgya'i bar du tshogs bsags pas dbang po rnon po phal dang mi 'dre bar bse ru dang 'dra ba gcig tu bzhugs pas na rang sangs rgyas bse ru lta bu zhes bya /🔽bargga ts'a ri zhes bya ba bargga ni sde 'am tshogs sam mang bo gcig tu 'dus pa la bya /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas bskal pa brgya'i bar du tshogs bsags pas dbang po rnon po phal dang mi 'dre bar bse ru dang 'dra ba gcig tu bzhugs pas na rang sangs rgyas bse ru lta bu zhes bya / bargga ts'a ri zhes bya ba bargga ni sde 'am tshogs sam mang bo gcig tu 'dus pa la bya /
translated: The term pratyekabuddha-kalpa refers to the fact that they are solitary buddhas who, like rhinoceroses, dwell alone, their faculties being of a sharpness that is not shared by ordinary people, because they have accumulated merit for a hundred eons.

original: ts'a ri ts'a ra ga tyartha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ts'a ri ts'a ra ga tyartha zhes bya ste /
translated: The term khuddaka-carika is derived from khuddaka-cari-gatya-artha.

original: 'gro ba yin pas rang sangs rgyas phal dang thabs cig tu gshegs shing ba zhugs pa dang spyod pa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba yin pas rang sangs rgyas phal dang thabs cig tu gshegs shing ba zhugs pa dang spyod pa la bya ste /
translated: It refers to the fact that they travel together with other ordinary solitary realizers, that they go and enter into the same places and that they engage in the same conduct.

original: tshogs dang spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshogs dang spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, it refers to their group practice and conduct.

original: shr'a ba ka zhes pa gcig tu na shri n'a na t'i ti shr'a ba ka zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shr'a ba ka zhes pa gcig tu na shri n'a na t'i ti shr'a ba ka zhes bya ste /
translated: The term śrāvaka is derived from śrāvaka-nāta-tīti-śrāvaka.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las chos kyi lung ma mnos par bdag nyid kyis rtogs par mi nus te nyan pa la yang bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las chos kyi lung ma mnos par bdag nyid kyis rtogs par mi nus te nyan pa la yang bya /
translated: One cannot realize it by oneself without receiving the transmission of the Dharma from a tathāgata.

original: yang gcig tu na samyaka dzny'a na pha lan shr'a ba sint'a ti shr'a ba ka zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na samyaka dzny'a na pha lan shr'a ba sint'a ti shr'a ba ka zhes bya ste /
translated: In another way, it is called samyak-jñāna-phalān-śrava-āsin-tī-śrāvaka.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gzhan la sgrogs shing thos par byed pas na nyan thos zhes bya /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa gzhan la sgrogs shing thos par byed pas na nyan thos zhes bya /
translated: It is called śrāvaka because it proclaims and makes others hear the attainment of the fruits of stream entry and so forth through right knowledge.

original: sro t'a panna zhes bya ba sro ta ni chu'i rgyun lta @141a * //🔽bu la bya /
analyzed: sro t'a panna zhes bya ba sro ta ni chu'i rgyun lta @141a * // bu la bya /
translated: Srota-āpanna is called srota in the sense of a stream of water.

original: a'a panna ni nang du zhugs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: a'a panna ni nang du zhugs pa la bya ste /
translated: Āpanna means to enter.

original: spyir na mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshor 'bab pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyi chu bo'i rgyun du zhugs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: spyir na mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshor 'bab pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyi chu bo'i rgyun du zhugs pa la bya ste /
translated: In general, it means to enter the stream of the noble path that flows into the ocean of nirvāṇa.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, it is called stream entry.

original: sapta kridbha ba pa ra ma zhes bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa bsgoms pas spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma zad la /
analyzed: sapta kridbha ba pa ra ma zhes bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa bsgoms pas spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma zad la /
translated: Sapta-kṛt-va-param means that for a stream enterer, the afflictions to be abandoned by meditation are not exhausted.

original: 'bras bu thob pas me'i nang du yang lan bdun skye /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pas me'i nang du yang lan bdun skye /
translated: Since they have obtained the result, they take rebirth in fire seven times and

original: lha'i nang du yang lan bdun skye ba la bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i nang du yang lan bdun skye ba la bya ste /
translated: they take rebirth among the gods seven times.🔽Since they remain in samsara for twenty-eight rebirths, four times seven,

original: mir skye ba'i srid pa bar ma bdun dang / lhar skye ba'i srid pa bar ma bdun gyis bsnan na skye ba bdun bzhi nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi bar du 'khor ba'i nang na bzhugs pas na re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bya /
analyzed: mir skye ba'i srid pa bar ma bdun dang / lhar skye ba'i srid pa bar ma bdun gyis bsnan na skye ba bdun bzhi nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi bar du 'khor ba'i nang na bzhugs pas na re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bya /
translated: with seven intermediate existences of birth as a human and seven intermediate existences of birth as a god, they are called “those who take rebirth at the most seven times.”

original: ku lam ku la zhes bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa gsum dang bzhi man chad las grol ba /
analyzed: ku lam ku la zhes bya ba rgyun du zhugs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa gsum dang bzhi man chad las grol ba /
translated: Kulaṅkula means “stream enterer” who is liberated from three or four afflictions of the desire realm.

original: skye ba gnyis sam gsum gyi bar du 'khor ba na gnas shing lha dang mi'i rigs bzang por skye bas na rigs su skye ba zhes bya /
analyzed: skye ba gnyis sam gsum gyi bar du 'khor ba na gnas shing lha dang mi'i rigs bzang por skye bas na rigs su skye ba zhes bya /
translated: Since they remain in samsara for two or three rebirths and are born in the excellent families of gods and humans, they are called “those born in a family.”

original: sa kri d'a ga mi zhes bya bas krita ni lan cig a'a ga mi ni 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: sa kri d'a ga mi zhes bya bas krita ni lan cig a'a ga mi ni 'ong ba ste /
translated: Sakṛdāgāmin means “once-returner.”

original: tshe de nyid la mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: tshe de nyid la mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: They do not pass into nirvana in that lifetime.

original: lan cig slar 'jig rten 'dir skye bas na lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya /
analyzed: lan cig slar 'jig rten 'dir skye bas na lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya /
translated: They are called “once returners” because they are born once again in this world.

original: ae ka bi tsi ka zhes bya ba lan cig phyir 'ong ba 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa bdun pa dang brgyad pa spangs pa /🔽skye ba gcig gis mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu 'am /
analyzed: ae ka bi tsi ka zhes bya ba lan cig phyir 'ong ba 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa bdun pa dang brgyad pa spangs pa / skye ba gcig gis mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu 'am /
translated: Ekavicika means “once returner.” They have abandoned the seventh and eighth afflictions of the desire realm.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa thob pa'i bar du chod pas na bar chad gcig pa zhes bya /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa thob pa'i bar du chod pas na bar chad gcig pa zhes bya /
translated: They are called “once returners” because they are separated from nirvana by one birth or because they are separated from attaining the state of nonreturner.

original: aa n'a g'a mi zhes bya ba tha ma'i skal ba can gyi chos rnam pa lnga spangs pas slar 'dod pa'i khams su mi skye bas phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya /
analyzed: aa n'a g'a mi zhes bya ba tha ma'i skal ba can gyi chos rnam pa lnga spangs pas slar 'dod pa'i khams su mi skye bas phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya /
translated: Anagami means “nonreturner.” They are called “nonreturners” because they do not take rebirth in the desire realm by abandoning the five qualities of the final stage.

original: aanta ra pa ri nirbb'a ni zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba srid pa gcig nas 'phos pa pha rol tu yang ma skyes par srid pa bar mdo'i tshe dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' bas na bar ma dor yongs su
analyzed: aanta ra pa ri nirbb'a ni zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba srid pa gcig nas 'phos pa pha rol tu yang ma skyes par srid pa bar mdo'i tshe dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byas nas mya ngan las 'da' bas na bar ma dor yongs su
translated: Antaraparinirvanin means “one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state.” They are called “nonreturners” because they manifest the result of an arhat in the intermediate state between death and the next birth without being reborn in the next life after having transmigrated from one existence.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya /
translated: It is called nirvana.

original: au pa badya pa rirbb'a ni zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba lam la zhugs shing brtson pa tshe 'phos nas pha rol tu skyes ma thag tu nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /
analyzed: au pa badya pa rirbb'a ni zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba lam la zhugs shing brtson pa tshe 'phos nas pha rol tu skyes ma thag tu nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs te /
translated: Upapadya-parinirvanin means that a nonreturner who has entered the path and is striving, after death and immediately after being born in the next life, abandons all afflictions.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed pas na skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya /
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed pas na skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya /
translated: Since he actualizes nirvana with remainder, it is called attaining nirvana after being born.

original: aa bhi sam sk'a ra pa ri nirbb'a ni zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba @141b 'khor bas rgyun ma bcad pa pha rol tu skyes nas brtson ni brtson la lam ma byang ba rtsol ba dang bcas pas mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pas na mngon par
analyzed: aa bhi sam sk'a ra pa ri nirbb'a ni zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba @141b 'khor bas rgyun ma bcad pa pha rol tu skyes nas brtson ni brtson la lam ma byang ba rtsol ba dang bcas pas mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pas na mngon par
translated: Abhisamskara-parinirvanin means that a nonreturner who has not severed the continuum of cyclic existence, after being born in the next life, strives, but since he has not completed the path, he attains nirvana through exertion.

original: 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya /
analyzed: 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya /
translated: Since he attains nirvana through exertion, it is called attaining nirvana through application.

original: aan bhi sam sk'ar pa ri nirbb'a yi zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba lam la brtson zhing 'grus par zhugs pa ma yin gyi nam bsam pa'i rgyud smin pa'i tshe dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu 'thob cing mya ngan las 'da' bas na mngon bar 'du byed pa
analyzed: aan bhi sam sk'ar pa ri nirbb'a yi zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba lam la brtson zhing 'grus par zhugs pa ma yin gyi nam bsam pa'i rgyud smin pa'i tshe dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu 'thob cing mya ngan las 'da' bas na mngon bar 'du byed pa
translated: Anupūrvaparinirvāyin means that nonreturners who are not diligent and energetic on the path attain the result of an arhat and pass into nirvāṇa when their mental continuum ripens.

original: med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya /
analyzed: med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya /
translated: They are called “those who attain nirvāṇa without mental application.”🔽Ūrdhvasrotas means that nonreturners who do not pass into nirvāṇa in the very place where they were born first go to the god realm and then pass into nirvāṇa.

original: a'urdha sro ta zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba thog ma gzhi gar skyes pa de nyid du mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i steng du lha'i khams su skyes nas gdod mya ngan las 'da' bas na gong du 'pho ba zhes bya /
analyzed: a'urdha sro ta zhes bya ba phyir mi 'ong ba thog ma gzhi gar skyes pa de nyid du mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i steng du lha'i khams su skyes nas gdod mya ngan las 'da' bas na gong du 'pho ba zhes bya /
translated: They are called “those who go to the highest.”

original: k'a ya s'akshi zhes bya ba nirb'an sa dri shya ni ro dha sa m'a patte /
analyzed: k'a ya s'akshi zhes bya ba nirb'an sa dri shya ni ro dha sa m'a patte /
translated: Kāyasākṣin means nirvāṇasadṛśa nirodhasamāpatti.

original: k'a ye na s'aksha ka ra na k'a ya s'akshi zhes bya ste phyir mi 'ong ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags kyis kyang lus kyis mngon du byed pa zhes bya /
analyzed: k'a ye na s'aksha ka ra na k'a ya s'akshi zhes bya ste phyir mi 'ong ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags kyis kyang lus kyis mngon du byed pa zhes bya /
translated: Anāgamyasākṣātkaraṇakāyasākṣī means that, like nirvāṇa, the nonreturner enters the meditative absorption of cessation, in which the mind and mental factors have ceased, but the body is manifest.

original: shraddh'a nu sa ri zhes bya ba /
analyzed: shraddh'a nu sa ri zhes bya ba /
translated: Śraddhānusārin

original: shraddha zhes bya ba ni dad pa /
analyzed: shraddha zhes bya ba ni dad pa /
translated: Śraddhā means faith.

original: aa nu sa ri ni rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: aa nu sa ri ni rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: Anusārin means follower.

original: bdag nyid kyi shes pas rtogs pa med kyi /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi shes pas rtogs pa med kyi /
translated: One does not realize it through one’s own knowledge.

original: lung las thos pa bzhin du dad pas 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug pas na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya /
analyzed: lung las thos pa bzhin du dad pas 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'jug pas na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya /
translated: One follows the ārya path through faith in accordance with what one has heard from scripture. Therefore it is called a follower through faith.

original: dharmm'a nu sa ri zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dharmm'a nu sa ri zhes bya ba /
translated: Dharmanusārin

original: dharmma aa nu sa ri dun sh'i lan ya sya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dharmma aa nu sa ri dun sh'i lan ya sya zhes bya ste /
translated: Dharmanusāriṇo dunniścayāḥ

original: dbang po rnon po gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing chos kyi tshul dang mthun par rigs par sbyor bas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog cing chos kyi tshul dang mthun par rigs par sbyor bas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya /
translated: Those of sharp faculty are not dependent on others. They are called followers of reality because they apply reasoning in accordance with the way of the Dharma.

original: shraddh'a dhi mukta zhes bya ba shraddha y'a margga ma dhi mukta shraddh'a dhi mukta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shraddh'a dhi mukta zhes bya ba shraddha y'a margga ma dhi mukta shraddh'a dhi mukta zhes bya ste /
translated: The one called Saddhamuditd is so called because she is the one who is delighted with the true Dharma.🔽

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rtul pos lam bsgoms nas 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thob pas na dgra bcom pa la zhugs pa man chad gang zag chen po bdun gyi bye brag gi ming ste dad pas mos pa zhes bya /🔽drishti pr'apta zhes bya ba drishti ni mthong ba /🔽pr'apta ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dbang po rtul pos lam bsgoms nas 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thob pas na dgra bcom pa la zhugs pa man chad gang zag chen po bdun gyi bye brag gi ming ste dad pas mos pa zhes bya / drishti pr'apta zhes bya ba drishti ni mthong ba / pr'apta ni thob pa ste /
translated: One called “freed by faith” is a person who is a follower of faith, who is of dull faculty, who has attained the result of an arya by cultivating the path, and who is a specific type of the seven great persons from the approacher to the fruit of an arhat.

original: dbang po rnon po chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas lam gzigs shing 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thob pas na dgra bcom pa la zhugs pa man chad gang zag chen po bdun gyi bye brag gi ming ste mthong bas thob pa zhes bya /🔽sa ma ya bi mukta zhes bya ba @142a * //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas lam gzigs shing 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thob pas na dgra bcom pa la zhugs pa man chad gang zag chen po bdun gyi bye brag gi ming ste mthong bas thob pa zhes bya /🔽sa ma ya bi mukta zhes bya ba @142a * //
translated: One called “one who obtains by seeing” is a person who is a follower of reality, who is of sharp faculty, who has seen the path and obtained the result of an arya, and who is a specific type of the seven great persons from the approacher to the fruit of an arhat.🔽One called “one liberated regardless of circumstances” is a person who is a follower of reality, who is of sharp faculty, who has seen the path and obtained the result of an arya, and who is a specific type of the seven great persons from the approacher to the fruit of an arhat.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dgra bcom pa dbang po rtul po dus dang yo byad la sogs pa dang ldan na nyon mongs pa las grol zhing 'bras bu 'thob kyi /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dgra bcom pa dbang po rtul po dus dang yo byad la sogs pa dang ldan na nyon mongs pa las grol zhing 'bras bu 'thob kyi /
translated: Arhats who are followers by faith are dull faculty. If they possess such things as time and material necessities, they are liberated from afflictions and obtain the result.

original: mi ldan na thar pa thob par mi nus pas na dus kyi rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
analyzed: mi ldan na thar pa thob par mi nus pas na dus kyi rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
translated: But if they do not possess them, they are unable to obtain liberation and are called arhats liberated according to circumstances.

original: aa sa ma ya bi mukta zhes bya ba dgra bcom pa dbang po rnon po chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yo byad dang dus la ltos mi dgos par nyon mongs pa spong nus pas na dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
analyzed: aa sa ma ya bi mukta zhes bya ba dgra bcom pa dbang po rnon po chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba yo byad dang dus la ltos mi dgos par nyon mongs pa spong nus pas na dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
translated: Arhats who are followers of reality are sharp faculty. They are called arhats liberated regardless of circumstances asamayavimukta because they are able to abandon afflictions without needing to rely on material necessities and time.

original: pradzny'a y'a bi mukta zhes bya ba pra dzny'a bi mukta pradzny'a bi mukta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pradzny'a y'a bi mukta zhes bya ba pra dzny'a bi mukta pradzny'a bi mukta zhes bya ste /
translated: Arhats who are liberated by wisdom prajñāvimukta are called arhats liberated by wisdom prajñāvimukta.

original: dgra bcom pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma bsgrubs par shes rab kyis zag pa nyi tshe las grol bar byas pas na shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma bsgrubs par shes rab kyis zag pa nyi tshe las grol bar byas pas na shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
translated: Arhats who do not achieve the meditative attainment of cessation are liberated from a portion of contaminants by wisdom.

original: au bha ya to bh'a ga bi mukti zhes bya ba au bha ya ni gnyis ka / bh'a ga ni cha /
analyzed: au bha ya to bh'a ga bi mukti zhes bya ba au bha ya ni gnyis ka / bh'a ga ni cha /
translated: Ubhaya means “both,” bhāga means “part,”

original: bi mukta ni rnam par grol ba'i sde /
analyzed: bi mukta ni rnam par grol ba'i sde /
translated: and vimukta means “liberated.”

original: dgra bcom pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa gnyis ka las grol bas na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa gnyis ka las grol bas na /
translated: Since the arhats are liberated from both the obscurations of the afflictions and the obscurations of meditative absorption,

original: gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya /
translated: they are called “liberated from both parts.”

original: su pra ti panno bha ga ba ta shra ba ka sam gha zhes bya ba shra ma ny'arthannirb'a nam pra ti panna zhes bya ste /
analyzed: su pra ti panno bha ga ba ta shra ba ka sam gha zhes bya ba shra ma ny'arthannirb'a nam pra ti panna zhes bya ste /
translated: The one called Supratipanna Bhagavat Śrāvakasaṃgha means “the Bhagavat’s Saṅgha of Śrāvakas who have entered well.”

original: dge sbyong gi don mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pas na bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi don mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pas na bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya /
translated: Since they have entered nirvāṇa, the purpose of being a monk, the Bhagavat’s Saṅgha of Śrāvakas is called “those who have entered well.”🔽The one called Nyāyapratipanna means “those who have entered through reasoning.”

original: n+y'a ya pra ti panna zhes bya ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang drod dang rtse mo la sogs pa'i rigs pa'i rim pas zhugs pas na /
analyzed: n+y'a ya pra ti panna zhes bya ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang drod dang rtse mo la sogs pa'i rigs pa'i rim pas zhugs pas na /
translated: Since they have entered through the stages of reasoning such as the four establishments of mindfulness, heat, peak, and so on,

original: rigs par zhugs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: rigs par zhugs pa zhes bya /
translated: they are called “those who have entered through reasoning.”

original: ri dzu pra ti panna zhes bya ba ri dzu m'arya margga zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: ri dzu pra ti panna zhes bya ba ri dzu m'arya margga zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The term ridzuk pratipanna means ridzumārga, the path of seeing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ma 'khrugs shing drang la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ma 'khrugs shing drang la /
translated: Since one enters it without disturbing the eightfold noble path and

original: de la zhugs pas na drang por zhugs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: de la zhugs pas na drang por zhugs pa zhes bya /
translated: makes it straight, it is called “entering the straight.”🔽The term sampra-tipanna means that since the śrāvakas are in accord with

original: sam pra ti panna zhes bya ba nyan thos rnams tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun pas na mthun par zhugs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sam pra ti panna zhes bya ba nyan thos rnams tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun pas na mthun par zhugs pa zhes bya /
translated: discipline and view, they are said to “enter in accord.”🔽The term anudharmacarin means that since one practices in accord with

original: aa nu ddharmmatsa ri zhes bya ba dge ba'i chos ji skad bstan pa bzhin du mthun par spyod pas na rjes su mthun pa'i chos la spyod pa zhes bya /
analyzed: aa nu ddharmmatsa ri zhes bya ba dge ba'i chos ji skad bstan pa bzhin du mthun par spyod pas na rjes su mthun pa'i chos la spyod pa zhes bya /
translated: the virtuous dharmas as they are taught, one is said to “practice the dharmas🔽in accord with the Dharma.”🔽The term dharmanudharmapratipanna means that dharmas are the Dharma,

original: dharmm'a nu dharmma pra ti panna zhes bya ba dharmma ni chos te mya ngan las 'das pa la bya /
analyzed: dharmm'a nu dharmma pra ti panna zhes bya ba dharmma ni chos te mya ngan las 'das pa la bya /
translated: which refers to nirvāṇa.

original: aa nu dharmma ni de'i rjes su mthun par spyod pa'i chos te /
analyzed: aa nu dharmma ni de'i rjes su mthun par spyod pa'i chos te /
translated: Anudharma is the Dharma that is practiced in accord with that.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa yin te /
translated: It is the eightfold noble path.

original: de la zhugs pas @142b chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: de la zhugs pas @142b chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa zhes bya /
translated: Those who engage in it are said to engage in the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi ming gi rnam grangs la /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi ming gi rnam grangs la /
translated: Synonyms for the excellent teaching.

original: s'u tra zhes bya ba aartha su tsan da s'u tra zhes bya ste /
analyzed: s'u tra zhes bya ba aartha su tsan da s'u tra zhes bya ste /
translated: Sutra means articulates meaning concisely.

original: sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'ang rung sangs rgyas kyis gnang ste nyan thos kyis bshad pa yang rung /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bshad pa'ang rung sangs rgyas kyis gnang ste nyan thos kyis bshad pa yang rung /
translated: Whether it is taught by the Buddha or taught by a disciple with the Buddha's permission,

original: don mdo tsam du ston zhing smos pas na mdo'i sde zhes bya /
analyzed: don mdo tsam du ston zhing smos pas na mdo'i sde zhes bya /
translated: it is called a sutra because it concisely presents and mentions the meaning.

original: ge yam zhes bya ba gee kee shapda zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ge yam zhes bya ba gee kee shapda zhes bya ste /
translated: Geya means melodious narration.

original: mdo sde bshad pa'i don dbyangs kyis brjod pas na dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa zhes bya /
analyzed: mdo sde bshad pa'i don dbyangs kyis brjod pas na dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called melodious narration because it narrates the meaning of the sutras in song.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na g'a ta by'a na ge ya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na g'a ta by'a na ge ya zhes bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, geya means to be sung by Gautama.

original: mdo sde las 'byung ba'i tshig nyid gzu bor ma gsungs te drang ba'i don du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: mdo sde las 'byung ba'i tshig nyid gzu bor ma gsungs te drang ba'i don du gsungs pa la /
translated: It is called melodious narration because it is not taught in the literal way that it appears in the sutras but is taught with an interpretable meaning.

analyzed: da dung bshad cing shes par bya ba gzhan yod pas na brtag par bya bar yang drang du ni rung mod kyis dbyangs kyis bsnyad par nye bas na dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde zhes bya /
translated: The section of melodious expression is so called because it is close to melodious expression.

original: bya ka ra na zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi cir gyur pa dang 'gyur ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa bye brag tu lung ston pas na lung du bstan pa'i sde zhes bya /🔽g'a th'a zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug par sbyar te bshad pas na tshigs su bcad pa'i sde zhes bya /
analyzed: bya ka ra na zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos la sogs pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi cir gyur pa dang 'gyur ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi rtogs pa bye brag tu lung ston pas na lung du bstan pa'i sde zhes bya / g'a th'a zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug par sbyar te bshad pas na tshigs su bcad pa'i sde zhes bya /
translated: The section of predictions is so called because it predicts what is not understood by others, such as the bodhisattvas and sravakas and so on of the past, present and future.🔽The section of verses is so called because it is explained by applying verses of two lines, three lines, four lines, five lines and six lines.

original: au d'a na zhes bya ba aa serya dha na au d'a na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: au d'a na zhes bya ba aa serya dha na au d'a na zhes bya ste /
translated: The section of extensive teachings is so called because it is explained by applying verses of two lines, three lines, four lines, five lines and six lines.

original: gang zag 'ga' zhig gi phyir bshad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag 'ga' zhig gi phyir bshad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not explained for the sake of some individual.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yun ring du gzhag pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ma bskul ma gsol bar ched du brjod cing gsungs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yun ring du gzhag pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ma bskul ma gsol bar ched du brjod cing gsungs pa la bya ste /
translated: It is a statement made by the Buddha himself, not requested by others, in order to establish the teachings for a long time.🔽For example, the sutras say,

original: dper na phyi dro'i dus kyi tshe bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs te gdan la bzhugs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams la ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do zhes mdo las gsungs pa lta bu ste ched du brjod pa'i sde🔽zhes bya / ni d'a nan zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba la sogs pa thog ma ji las glengs te bshad pa dang / gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di dang byung ba 'di'i tshe bslab pa bcas pa lta bu la bya ste /
analyzed: dper na phyi dro'i dus kyi tshe bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog las bzhengs te gdan la bzhugs nas dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams la ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do zhes mdo las gsungs pa lta bu ste ched du brjod pa'i sde zhes bya / ni d'a nan zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang 'dul ba la sogs pa thog ma ji las glengs te bshad pa dang / gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di dang byung ba 'di'i tshe bslab pa bcas pa lta bu la bya ste /
translated: In the evening, the Bhagavan arose from his meditative composure and, sitting on his seat, he made this statement to the saṅgha of monks.🔽The term nidana refers to the initial topic discussed in the sutras, the vinaya and so on, or to the occasion, the time and the situation in which a precept was formulated.

original: gleng gzhi'i sde zhes bya /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i sde zhes bya /
translated: The term nidana refers to the initial topic discussed in the sutras, the vinaya and so on, or to the occasion, the time and the situation in which a precept was formulated.

original: aa ba d'a na zhes bya ba /
analyzed: aa ba d'a na zhes bya ba /
translated: The term avadana refers to

original: ya tra ba ga martha ma n+ya sya da nam drisht'anta bist'a ra sya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ya tra ba ga martha ma n+ya sya da nam drisht'anta bist'a ra sya zhes bya ste /
translated: yatrabhagavataḥ purvajanmacyutasya janma nidarśitam bhavati.

original: chos nyan pa rnams kyis go zhing rtogs par bya ba'i phyir @143a * //
analyzed: chos nyan pa rnams kyis go zhing rtogs par bya ba'i phyir @143a * //
translated: In order that the listeners may understand and realize it,

original: sngon btags par byung ba gzhan las drangs te /
analyzed: sngon btags par byung ba gzhan las drangs te /
translated: it is illustrated by other stories from the past.

original: dpe rgyas par bstan pas na rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde zhes bya /🔽ai ti britta ka zhes bya ba ni ai ti ae bi ste de lta bu /
analyzed: dpe rgyas par bstan pas na rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde zhes bya / ai ti britta ka zhes bya ba ni ai ti ae bi ste de lta bu /
translated: Since it teaches extensively through examples, it is called avadana.🔽Avadana is derived from iti and vrittaka.

original: britti ka zhes bya ba ni byung ba'am 'byung 'gyur la bya ste /
analyzed: britti ka zhes bya ba ni byung ba'am 'byung 'gyur la bya ste /
translated: Iti means “thus” and vrittaka means “that which has happened” or “that which will happen.”

original: sngon byung ba'i gtam bzlas shing bshad pa yin pas na de lta bu byung ba'i sde zhes bya /
analyzed: sngon byung ba'i gtam bzlas shing bshad pa yin pas na de lta bu byung ba'i sde zhes bya /
translated: Since it is a recitation and explanation of past events, it is called itivrittaka.🔽Jataka means that which is born.

original: dz'a ta ka zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe gang dang gang du skyes pa dang / dka' ba ci dad ci mdzad pa bshad pa yin pas skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde zhes bya /
analyzed: dz'a ta ka zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe gang dang gang du skyes pa dang / dka' ba ci dad ci mdzad pa bshad pa yin pas skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde zhes bya /
translated: Since it explains where the Bhagavan was born and what austerities and deeds he performed when he was practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva in the past, it is called the Jataka collection.

original: be pu lya zhes bya ba ni bi pu lya sy'a ba bee pu lya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: be pu lya zhes bya ba ni bi pu lya sy'a ba bee pu lya zhes bya ste /
translated: Vaipulya means vipula.

original: shin tu rgyas par bshad pas sam /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas par bshad pas sam /
translated: Since it is explained extensively,

original: mdo sde rgya chen po'i nang nas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa shin tu rgya che zhing yangs par bshad pa yin pas na shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zhes bya /
analyzed: mdo sde rgya chen po'i nang nas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa shin tu rgya che zhing yangs par bshad pa yin pas na shin tu rgyas pa'i sde zhes bya /
translated: Since the extensive sutras explain the levels, transcendent perfections and so forth in a very extensive and detailed manner, they are called extensive sutras.

original: aa dbhu ta dharmma zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos rnams kyi mkhyen pa dang rdzu 'phrul dang byin gyis rlabs ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba bshad pa yin pas na rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde zhes bya /
analyzed: aa dbhu ta dharmma zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang nyan thos rnams kyi mkhyen pa dang rdzu 'phrul dang byin gyis rlabs ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba bshad pa yin pas na rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde zhes bya /
translated: Adbhutadharma means that they explain the knowledge, miracles and blessings of the buddhas, bodhisattvas and shravakas in a marvelous and wonderful way, so they are called the class of marvelous events.

original: au pa de sha zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i don de kho na nyid mthong ba gzhan gyis zhib mor bshad cing gtan la bab pa rjes su mthun pa'i chos bshad pa'i ma mo lta bu chos mngon pa la bya bas na gtan la phab pa'i sde zhes
analyzed: au pa de sha zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i don de kho na nyid mthong ba gzhan gyis zhib mor bshad cing gtan la bab pa rjes su mthun pa'i chos bshad pa'i ma mo lta bu chos mngon pa la bya bas na gtan la phab pa'i sde zhes
translated: Upadeasha means that the meaning of the sutras is explained in detail and ascertained by others who have seen thatness and that it is like a mother who explains the Dharma in accordance with the Abhidharma, so it is called the class of clear science.

original: bya / brahma ts'arya zhes bya ba brahma bh'u ta sh'i ta bh'u ta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bya / brahma ts'arya zhes bya ba brahma bh'u ta sh'i ta bh'u ta zhes bya ste /
translated: Brahmacharya means brahmabhutat shita bhuta.

original: tshangs pa 'am bsil bar gyur pas te don du na mya ngan las 'das pa la bya /
analyzed: tshangs pa 'am bsil bar gyur pas te don du na mya ngan las 'das pa la bya /
translated: Brahma or cool means nirvana.

original: ts'arya ta ra ga too zhes bya ste gang gis thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ts'arya ta ra ga too zhes bya ste gang gis thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Carita means to attain and

original: spyod pa la bya bas na mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir spyod pas na tshangs par spyod pa zhes bya /
