original: stambha na zhes bya ba sngags kyis lus khengs shing las byed mi nus pa'i ming ste rengs byed ces bya /🔽mo ha na zhes bya ba sngags kyis sems blun zhing mi dran par 'gyur ba'i ming ste rmongs byed ces bya /
analyzed: stambha na zhes bya ba sngags kyis lus khengs shing las byed mi nus pa'i ming ste rengs byed ces bya / mo ha na zhes bya ba sngags kyis sems blun zhing mi dran par 'gyur ba'i ming ste rmongs byed ces bya /
translated: Stambhana means “to paralyze the body” through mantra and is called “paralyzing.”🔽Mohana means “to make the mind dull and forgetful” through mantra and is called “deluding.”

original: ao ha na zhes bya ba sngags kyis sems khral khrul khyer bar byed pa'i ming ste 'khrul byed ces bya /
analyzed: ao ha na zhes bya ba sngags kyis sems khral khrul khyer bar byed pa'i ming ste 'khrul byed ces bya /
translated: Ohanana means “to make the mind distracted” through mantra and is called “distracting.”

original: 'dul ba las 'byung ba'i skad kyi ming la /
analyzed: 'dul ba las 'byung ba'i skad kyi ming la /
translated: The names of the languages found in the Vinaya

original: shiksha pa da zhes bya ba shiksha ni bi dyo b'a d'a na zhes bya ste rig pa 'am shes pa len zhing slob pa la bya /
analyzed: shiksha pa da zhes bya ba shiksha ni bi dyo b'a d'a na zhes bya ste rig pa 'am shes pa len zhing slob pa la bya /
translated: The term śikṣāpada is derived from śikṣā, which means “to take up” or “to learn” vidyā, or “knowledge,” and pada, which means “basis” or “foundation.”

original: ba da ni rten nam gzhi'i ming ste tshul khrims la brten nas nyon mongs pa zad par slob cing sbyor bas na bslab pa'i gzhi zhes bya /
analyzed: ba da ni rten nam gzhi'i ming ste tshul khrims la brten nas nyon mongs pa zad par slob cing sbyor bas na bslab pa'i gzhi zhes bya /
translated: Thus, śikṣāpada means “the basis of learning,” since it is on the basis of ethical conduct that one learns to eliminate the afflictions.

original: sh'i la zhes bya ba sh'i las m'a dhoo zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sh'i la zhes bya ba sh'i las m'a dhoo zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The term śīla is derived from śīta, which means “to abandon.”

original: legs par spyod pa la zhugs shing tshul khrims dam por bsrungs bas mi dge ba spangs pa'i ming la bya /
analyzed: legs par spyod pa la zhugs shing tshul khrims dam por bsrungs bas mi dge ba spangs pa'i ming la bya /
translated: It is called “śīla” because it is engaged in excellent conduct and because it is the observance of strict ethical conduct that abandons nonvirtue.

original: yang gcig tu na sh'i ta la tv'a tssh'i la zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na sh'i ta la tv'a tssh'i la zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, śīla is also called śīta-talvā-caṣṭa.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gdung bzhi zhing bsil bar gyur pa'i ming yang yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gdung bzhi zhing bsil bar gyur pa'i ming yang yin te /
translated: It is also called “śīla” because it is that which cools the heat of the afflictions.

original: dngos su na dang tshul gyis mi dge ba la mi spyod cing khrims srung ba'i ming ste tshul khrims zhes bya /
analyzed: dngos su na dang tshul gyis mi dge ba la mi spyod cing khrims srung ba'i ming ste tshul khrims zhes bya /
translated: In essence, śīla is the observance of ethical conduct, which means not engaging in nonvirtue either in actuality or in thought.

original: sam bar zhes bya ba lus dang ngag dang yid gsum mi dge ba mi byed de sdom zhing srung ba'i ming yang yin pas na sdom pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sam bar zhes bya ba lus dang ngag dang yid gsum mi dge ba mi byed de sdom zhing srung ba'i ming yang yin pas na sdom pa zhes bya /
translated: The term samvara means to restrain and protect the three doors of body, speech and mind from nonvirtue, and is therefore translated as vow.

original: dh'u ta gu na zhes bya ba ni dho ta gu na zhes 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dh'u ta gu na zhes bya ba ni dho ta gu na zhes 'byung ba ste /
translated: The term dhutangu means dhutangu.

original: dgon pa na gnas pa dang bsod snyoms len pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gong nas gong du sbyangs te dag cing gsal bar bya ba'i ming yin pas na sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya /
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas pa dang bsod snyoms len pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gong nas gong du sbyangs te dag cing gsal bar bya ba'i ming yin pas na sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya /
translated: It is a name for training and purifying the qualities of living in solitude, begging for alms and so on, and is therefore translated as ascetic practice.

original: san le kha zhes bya ba li kha bi le kha na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: san le kha zhes bya ba li kha bi le kha na zhes bya ste /
translated: The term śanlikha means śanlikha.

original: dge sbyong gi yo byad chos gos gsum dang lhung bzed la sogs pa ma gtogs pa spangs shing /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi yo byad chos gos gsum dang lhung bzed la sogs pa ma gtogs pa spangs shing /
translated: It is a name for renouncing all except the three Dharma robes and begging bowl, the requisites of a monk,

original: bya ba'i mgo bsnyungs te mi 'gyur bar lugs gcig tu spyod pa'i ming yin pas na yo byad bsnyungs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: bya ba'i mgo bsnyungs te mi 'gyur bar lugs gcig tu spyod pa'i ming yin pas na yo byad bsnyungs pa zhes bya /
translated: and for conducting oneself in a single way without wavering, and is therefore translated as austerity.

original: bo shadha zhes bya ba po sha ni pu shna te dge ba @155a * //
analyzed: bo shadha zhes bya ba po sha ni pu shna te dge ba @155a * //
translated: The term boshadha means bosha, which is virtue.

original: gso zhing rgyas par byed pa la bya /🔽dha ni dha ba ga ti shuddhoo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gso zhing rgyas par byed pa la bya / dha ni dha ba ga ti shuddhoo zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “purification” because it purifies and increases.

original: rgyug pa 'am dag par byed pa lta bu la bya /🔽spyir na dus drug tu khrims brgyad nod pa dang / dge slong khrims kyi yan lag las nyams pa rnams gso zhing sbyong ba'i ming ste gso sbyong zhes bya /
analyzed: rgyug pa 'am dag par byed pa lta bu la bya / spyir na dus drug tu khrims brgyad nod pa dang / dge slong khrims kyi yan lag las nyams pa rnams gso zhing sbyong ba'i ming ste gso sbyong zhes bya /
translated: Dha means “to run” or “to purify.”

original: barsho pa na yi ka zhes bya ba /
analyzed: barsho pa na yi ka zhes bya ba /
translated: In general, the term “purification” refers to the confession and purification of the eight classes of precepts received during the six monthly purification periods and of the precepts of the fully ordained monks that have been violated.

original: au pa na ya ti sa pra ba ya ti zhes bya ste /
analyzed: au pa na ya ti sa pra ba ya ti zhes bya ste /
translated: Varshopanāyika means “the one who enters the rainy season retreat.”🔽Upa means “to meet” or “to approach,” and nāyika means “to go.”

original: ba rsho ni dbyar /🔽au pa n'a yi k'a ni phrad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ba rsho ni dbyar / au pa n'a yi k'a ni phrad par byed pa ste /
translated: Varsha means “rainy season.”

original: dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes bco lnga la dge 'dun las su bsgo ba dang khrims su bya ba dang mal cha bsgo ba la sogs pa bya ba nas tshes bcu drug la dbyar gnas par byin gyis rlob pa'i cho ga byed pa dang / sbyor bas na sbyor zhing gnas par dam 'cha' ba'i ming ste /
analyzed: dbyar zla 'bring po'i tshes bco lnga la dge 'dun las su bsgo ba dang khrims su bya ba dang mal cha bsgo ba la sogs pa bya ba nas tshes bcu drug la dbyar gnas par byin gyis rlob pa'i cho ga byed pa dang / sbyor bas na sbyor zhing gnas par dam 'cha' ba'i ming ste /
translated: The one who enters the rainy season retreat is the one who enters the rainy season retreat by performing the ceremony of entering the rainy season retreat on the fifteenth day of the middle month of summer and by observing the rules of the rainy season retreat from the sixteenth day of the month until the end of the rainy season.

original: dbyar sbyor zhes bya /
analyzed: dbyar sbyor zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, it is called “the rainy season retreat.”

original: barsho pa ga ti zhes bya ba /
analyzed: barsho pa ga ti zhes bya ba /
translated: Varshopagata means “one who has entered the rainy season retreat.”

original: ba ri sha ni dbyar /
analyzed: ba ri sha ni dbyar /
translated: Varsha means “summer,”

original: au pa ga ti ni khas len pa ste /
analyzed: au pa ga ti ni khas len pa ste /
translated: and upagata means “to accept.”

original: gtsug lag khang ngam gnas de nas gud du mi 'phags par gnas par dam 'cha' zhing cho ga bya ba'i ming ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ngam gnas de nas gud du mi 'phags par gnas par dam 'cha' zhing cho ga bya ba'i ming ste /
translated: It is the name of a ceremony in which one vows to remain in a temple or a certain place without going elsewhere.

original: dbyar gnas par dam bcas pa zhes bya /
analyzed: dbyar gnas par dam bcas pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called “entering the rainy season retreat.”

original: pra b'a ra nam zhes bya ba pra mukta ba ra na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pra b'a ra nam zhes bya ba pra mukta ba ra na zhes bya ste /
translated: Pravarana means pra+mukta+varana.

original: dbyar gnas par dam bcas pa'i tshe thos pa dang mthong ba dang dogs pas rgol zhing rtsod du mi gnang ba las skabs phye bas na dgag dbye zhes bya /
analyzed: dbyar gnas par dam bcas pa'i tshe thos pa dang mthong ba dang dogs pas rgol zhing rtsod du mi gnang ba las skabs phye bas na dgag dbye zhes bya /
translated: When one enters the rainy season retreat, one is not allowed to argue, dispute, or doubt what one has heard or seen.

original: ka thi n'a sta ra zhes bya ba ka thi na ni sra ba ste chos gos mi 'khum par brkyang ba'i gtan pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: ka thi n'a sta ra zhes bya ba ka thi na ni sra ba ste chos gos mi 'khum par brkyang ba'i gtan pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: Katina-uttarasara means katina is “firm,” like a board that prevents a robe from shrinking.

original: chos gos sum phrugs gcig la byin gyis brlabs /
analyzed: chos gos sum phrugs gcig la byin gyis brlabs /
translated: One consecrates a set of three robes.

original: dge 'dun dbyar gnas par dam bcas pa rnams kyis chos gos zla ba lnga ba'i bar du lhag pa dang bral ba dang kha zas snga dro yang dang yang za ba dang / so sor 'dus shing za ba la sogs pa ltung bar mi 'gyur bar brtan par thub cing bag brkyad pa'i ming ste sra brkyang zhes bya'o //🔽aasta ra ni chos gos bkram pa 'am bting ba dang 'dra bar kun la khyab pa'i ming ste btid ba la bya /
analyzed: dge 'dun dbyar gnas par dam bcas pa rnams kyis chos gos zla ba lnga ba'i bar du lhag pa dang bral ba dang kha zas snga dro yang dang yang za ba dang / so sor 'dus shing za ba la sogs pa ltung bar mi 'gyur bar brtan par thub cing bag brkyad pa'i ming ste sra brkyang zhes bya'o // aasta ra ni chos gos bkram pa 'am bting ba dang 'dra bar kun la khyab pa'i ming ste btid ba la bya /
translated: The Saṅgha who have taken the vow to remain in the rainy season retreat are not subject to downfalls such as being without their extra robes for more than five months, eating again in the morning, eating in groups, and so forth.

original: bsdus na sra brkyang bting bar btags /
analyzed: bsdus na sra brkyang bting bar btags /
translated: The name of the month Aṣṭami is derived from the word aṣṭamā, which means “spread out” or “laid out,” like a spread-out or laid-out robe, and refers to the month in which the rainy season retreat is laid out.🔽In short, it is called Aṣṭami because the rainy season retreat is laid out.

original: gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i ming la /
analyzed: gnod sbyin la sogs pa'i ming la /
translated: The names of yakṣa and so forth.

original: yaksha zhes bya ba by'a ka ra na las yaksha p'u dza yin zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yaksha zhes bya ba by'a ka ra na las yaksha p'u dza yin zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Yakṣa is derived from the word yakṣapūjā, which means “worshiped by all.”

original: kun gyis mchod cing sbyin pa la bya /
analyzed: kun gyis mchod cing sbyin pa la bya /
translated: It refers to those who are worshiped and given offerings by everyone.

original: tshig gzhin du drangs na ya ka tsid kshinnant'a ta yaksha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshig gzhin du drangs na ya ka tsid kshinnant'a ta yaksha zhes bya ste /
translated: If the word is taken literally, it is called yakṣa because it means “to destroy all.”

original: ya ka tsi da ni su yang rung ba la bya /
analyzed: ya ka tsi da ni su yang rung ba la bya /
translated: Yakṣa means “anyone at all.”

original: kshinnan'a t'i ni gnod par byed pa la bya ste /
analyzed: kshinnan'a t'i ni gnod par byed pa la bya ste /
translated: Kṣiṇṇātin means “to harm.”

original: gnyi ga'i don dang sbyar nas gnod sbyin du btags /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i don dang sbyar nas gnod sbyin du btags /
translated: When applied to the meaning of both, it is called yakṣa.

original: r'a ba na zhes bya ba @155b ru ni shapda yin la /🔽ra ba na sya pattyan r'a pa na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: r'a ba na zhes bya ba @155b ru ni shapda yin la / ra ba na sya pattyan r'a pa na zhes bya ste /
translated: Rāvaṇa means “to cry out.”🔽Rāvaṇasya puttraḥ means “the son of Rāvaṇa.”

original: skad sgrog cing 'byin pa'i bu yin pas na sgra sgrogs kyi bu zhes bya /
analyzed: skad sgrog cing 'byin pa'i bu yin pas na sgra sgrogs kyi bu zhes bya /
translated: Since he is the son who cries out and makes noise, he is called the son of Rāvaṇa.🔽Rākṣasa means “to harm.”

original: r'akshas zhes bya ba ra ba na dang / bi bhi sha na la sogs pa mi la gnod par byed pa'i srin po la bya bas na srin po zhes bya /
analyzed: r'akshas zhes bya ba ra ba na dang / bi bhi sha na la sogs pa mi la gnod par byed pa'i srin po la bya bas na srin po zhes bya /
translated: Since it is applied to piśāca and vibhīṣaṇa and so on, who harm humans, it is called rākṣasa.

original: pi sh'a tsa zhes bya ba pi sh'a tsa mashta t'i ti pi sh'a tsa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: pi sh'a tsa zhes bya ba pi sh'a tsa mashta t'i ti pi sh'a tsa zhes bya ste ;
translated: Piśāca means piśācam aśnāti iti piśāca.

original: yi dags smad rigs mi sha la sogs pa rje na par za bas na sha za zhes bya /
analyzed: yi dags smad rigs mi sha la sogs pa rje na par za bas na sha za zhes bya /
translated: Since it is a hungry ghost of the lowest class who eats the flesh of humans and so on, it is called piśāca.

original: ka ta pu ta na zhes bya ba gdon gyi ming ste /
analyzed: ka ta pu ta na zhes bya ba gdon gyi ming ste /
translated: Kaṭapūtan means “demon.”

original: ka ta ni lus /
analyzed: ka ta ni lus /
translated: Kaṭa means “body.”🔽Pūtan means “to rot.”

original: pu ta ni rul bar byed pa yin pas na lus srul po zhes bya /
analyzed: pu ta ni rul bar byed pa yin pas na lus srul po zhes bya /
translated: Therefore, it is called kaṭapūtan.

original: skanda ta zhes bya ba skanda ti sho sha yo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skanda ta zhes bya ba skanda ti sho sha yo zhes bya ste /
translated: The one called Skanda is called Skandati-śoṣayati.

original: ma h'a de ba'i sras k'arta ka'i mtshan gyi skabs su ni phyi 'gro zhes bya /
analyzed: ma h'a de ba'i sras k'arta ka'i mtshan gyi skabs su ni phyi 'gro zhes bya /
translated: In the context of the name Kārttikeya, the son of Mahādeva, it is called outer goer.

original: gdon gyi skabs su ni skems byed ces bya /
analyzed: gdon gyi skabs su ni skems byed ces bya /
translated: In the context of a demon, it is called drying up.

original: aunm'a da zhes bya ba sems mi dran zhing myos par byed pa'i gdon yin pas smyo byed ces bya /
analyzed: aunm'a da zhes bya ba sems mi dran zhing myos par byed pa'i gdon yin pas smyo byed ces bya /
translated: The one called Unmādayanti is a demon that causes the mind to be forgetful and crazed, so it is called insanity.

original: tstsha ya zhes bya ba grib mas mi dag la gnod pa dang / gdon gyis mi'i grib ma gnon zhing gnod par byed pas na grib gnon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tstsha ya zhes bya ba grib mas mi dag la gnod pa dang / gdon gyis mi'i grib ma gnon zhing gnod par byed pas na grib gnon zhes bya'o //
translated: The one called Cāṣa is a demon that harms humans through shadows and harms humans by pressing down on the shadow with a demon, so it is called shadow presser.

original: aa pa sma ra zhes bya ba dran pa nyams shing brgyal bar byed pa'i gdon gyi ming ste brjed byed ces bya /
analyzed: aa pa sma ra zhes bya ba dran pa nyams shing brgyal bar byed pa'i gdon gyi ming ste brjed byed ces bya /
translated: The one called Apasmāra is the name of a demon that causes loss of memory and fainting, so it is called forgetfulness.

original: ao sta ra ka zhes bya ba au ra si tstsha da ni zhes bshad de nyal ba la brang nas gnon zhing gnod par byed pas na gnon po zhes btags /
analyzed: ao sta ra ka zhes bya ba au ra si tstsha da ni zhes bshad de nyal ba la brang nas gnon zhing gnod par byed pas na gnon po zhes btags /
translated: The one called Ostāraka is explained as Urasacchada, which means it harms by pressing on the chest while sleeping, so it is called presser.

original: panytsi ka zhes bya ba bu lnga brgya dang 'grogs te rtse ba dang / cho lo lngas rtse ba'i ming ste lngas rtse na zhes bya /
analyzed: panytsi ka zhes bya ba bu lnga brgya dang 'grogs te rtse ba dang / cho lo lngas rtse ba'i ming ste lngas rtse na zhes bya /
translated: Pañcālika is the name of a man who plays with five hundred sons, and pañcālika is the name of a game played with five dice.

original: d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba dim bi ha ya si ga to zhes bya ste /
analyzed: d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba dim bi ha ya si ga to zhes bya ste /
translated: Ḍākinī means “one who goes in the sky” (ḍimbhī-hāyası-gātr).

original: sngags grub pa nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul thob pa'i ming ste mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya /
analyzed: sngags grub pa nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul thob pa'i ming ste mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya /
translated: It is the name of a woman who has attained magical powers such as flying through the sky and so on by accomplishing mantra.

original: be t'a da zhes bya ba mi shi ba'i ro'i nang du gdon zhugs te gnod par byed pas na ro langs zhes bya /
analyzed: be t'a da zhes bya ba mi shi ba'i ro'i nang du gdon zhugs te gnod par byed pas na ro langs zhes bya /
translated: Vetāla means “one who enters the corpse of a dead person” (mṛta-prāṇa-āviṣṭa).

original: mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brjod pa'i rnam grangs la /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis bdag tu brjod pa'i rnam grangs la /
translated: The synonyms for the self as expressed by the tīrthikas are as follows.

original: a'atma ni pa ra m'atma la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: a'atma ni pa ra m'atma la zhes bya ste /
translated: Ātman is parāmātmā.

original: bdag ces bya ba lus gtso bo'i phung po 'di bor nas phung po gzhan len cing dngos po rtag la phung po gzhan 'dor ba ni sbrul gyi pags pa brjes pa dang 'dra bar 'dor te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba lus gtso bo'i phung po 'di bor nas phung po gzhan len cing dngos po rtag la phung po gzhan 'dor ba ni sbrul gyi pags pa brjes pa dang 'dra bar 'dor te /
translated: It is said that the so-called self is the body, the principal aggregate. After abandoning this body, it takes up another body. It is permanent and the other aggregates are discarded. It is discarded like a snake that has shed its skin.

original: nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin pas na bdag ces bya /
analyzed: nga dang nga yir 'dzin pa'i gzhi yin pas na bdag ces bya /
translated: It is called self because it is the basis for grasping at “I” and “mine.”

original: satva ni mu stegs can gyi sa bdag tu brtags pa'i bye brag yin te sems la bdag yin par 'dzin cing sems kyi rgyud la mi 'chad par 'dod pas na sems can zhes bya /
analyzed: satva ni mu stegs can gyi sa bdag tu brtags pa'i bye brag yin te sems la bdag yin par 'dzin cing sems kyi rgyud la mi 'chad par 'dod pas na sems can zhes bya /
translated: Sattva is a particular type of self imputed by the tīrthikas. Since they apprehend the mind to be the self and assert that the continuum of the mind is uninterrupted, it is called sentient being.

original: dz'i ba ni ji srid du lus 'tsho ba de srid du srog ces bya ba'i bdag de lus la gnas /🔽lus @156a * //
analyzed: dz'i ba ni ji srid du lus 'tsho ba de srid du srog ces bya ba'i bdag de lus la gnas / lus @156a * //
translated: Jīva is the self called life force that, for as long as the body lives, abides in the body.🔽When the body dies, it is said to depart, like a bird leaving a broken nest.

original: shi nas rdza bcag pa'i bye'u dang 'dra bar 'byung ste 'gro bas na srog 'dzin pa'i ming ste srog ces bya /🔽dzantu dza ya ta ai ti dzantu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shi nas rdza bcag pa'i bye'u dang 'dra bar 'byung ste 'gro bas na srog 'dzin pa'i ming ste srog ces bya / dzantu dza ya ta ai ti dzantu zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus it is called life force.

original: bdag tshe rabs kun du skye zhing 'byung bas na skye ba zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag tshe rabs kun du skye zhing 'byung bas na skye ba zhes bya /
translated: Jantu is derived from jantu jāyate, meaning that since the self is born and arises in all lifetimes, it is called a being.

original: po sha ni lus dang 'gro ba'i rgyud bdag 'dis gsos shing bskyed de yod par byas pas na gso ba zhes bya /
analyzed: po sha ni lus dang 'gro ba'i rgyud bdag 'dis gsos shing bskyed de yod par byas pas na gso ba zhes bya /
translated: Pokaṇa is derived from poṣaṇa, meaning that since this self nourishes, produces, and makes exist the body and the continuum of the life of beings, it is called a nourisher.

original: bu ru sha ni skyes bu mgo stong yod pa zhig rig byed kyi sgra 'don zhing brjod pa zhig yod pa skad 'byung ba dang / skyes bu rtsal dang ldan pa zhig khod na yod par 'dod pa la bya bas na skyes bu zhes bya /🔽pum ga la ni pu na:pu narga ti shu li ya ta ai ti zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bu ru sha ni skyes bu mgo stong yod pa zhig rig byed kyi sgra 'don zhing brjod pa zhig yod pa skad 'byung ba dang / skyes bu rtsal dang ldan pa zhig khod na yod par 'dod pa la bya bas na skyes bu zhes bya / pum ga la ni pu na:pu narga ti shu li ya ta ai ti zhes bya ste /
translated: The term “person” (puruṣa) is said to refer to a being with a thousand heads reciting and uttering the sounds of the Vedas, or to a being with great strength.

original: yang dang yang lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rgyud du skye zhing sbyor bas na yang sbyor ba zhes kyang bya /🔽purya te gal te tse pa pum ga la zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: yang dang yang lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rgyud du skye zhing sbyor bas na yang sbyor ba zhes kyang bya / purya te gal te tse pa pum ga la zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The term “aggregate” (pūg) is said to refer to the fact that one is born again and again in the continuums of gods, humans, and so on and is connected to them.🔽It is also called “repeated connection” (pūrvayoga).

original: skyes nas dar gyi bar du ni gang /
analyzed: skyes nas dar gyi bar du ni gang /
translated: The term “pūg” is also said to refer to the period from birth to maturity.

original: dar yol nas shi ba'i bar du ni zag pa la yang bya ste /
analyzed: dar yol nas shi ba'i bar du ni zag pa la yang bya ste /
translated: The term “pūg” is also said to refer to the period from maturity until death.

original: tshig 'di gnyis kar yang drang du rung gis kyang sngan chad ming du btags te grags pa bzhin du bzhag nas gang zag ces btags /🔽ma nu dza ni ma no dzth'a  tattv'ad  ces bya ste /
analyzed: tshig 'di gnyis kar yang drang du rung gis kyang sngan chad ming du btags te grags pa bzhin du bzhag nas gang zag ces btags /🔽ma nu dza ni ma no dzth'a  tattv'ad  ces bya ste /
translated: Both of these terms are suitable to be applied to the present topic, but the term “person” is used here in accordance with the name that is well known.🔽The term “individual” (pudgala) is said to refer to the fact that one is born again and again in the continuums of gods, humans, and so on and is connected to them.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po shed ces bya ba las byung bas na shed las skyes zhes bya /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po shed ces bya ba las byung bas na shed las skyes zhes bya /
translated: Since they arise from the lord of beings called Śiva, they are called Śaiva.

original: ma na pa ti ma notpa da tyam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ma na pa ti ma notpa da tyam zhes bya ste /
translated: Mānava means “born from Manu.”

original: mu stegs can gyi gzhung gis skye dgu'i bdag po 'jig rten thams cad bskyed pa de las byung ba la bya /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gzhung gis skye dgu'i bdag po 'jig rten thams cad bskyed pa de las byung ba la bya /
translated: According to the texts of the tīrthikas, the lord of beings, the creator of the entire world, arose from him.

original: bod la yang shed kyis kyang bskal /
analyzed: bod la yang shed kyis kyang bskal /
translated: In Tibet, it is also said “created by Śiva.”

original: shed kyis tshe bskal te byed pa'i mkhan po shed kyis byas pa skad du byung bas na shed bur btags /
analyzed: shed kyis tshe bskal te byed pa'i mkhan po shed kyis byas pa skad du byung bas na shed bur btags /
translated: Since it is said that the creator was created by Śiva, it is called the son of Śiva.

original: k'a ra ka ni mu stegs kyi gzhung las skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa thams cad bdag rtag pas byas par 'dod pas na byed pa po zhes bya /
analyzed: k'a ra ka ni mu stegs kyi gzhung las skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa thams cad bdag rtag pas byas par 'dod pas na byed pa po zhes bya /
translated: Kāraka means “agent.” According to the texts of the tīrthikas, the permanent self is the agent that creates all things, such as birth and destruction.🔽Kartr means “employer.”

original: ka ra barti ka ni bdag ces bya ba rtag pa des dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kun byed du 'dzud pas na byed du 'jug pa po zhes bya /
analyzed: ka ra barti ka ni bdag ces bya ba rtag pa des dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kun byed du 'dzud pas na byed du 'jug pa po zhes bya /
translated: The permanent self called the “I” is the employer that engages in all virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: bed ka ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong bar byed pas na tshor ba po zhes bya /
analyzed: bed ka ni las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu myong bar byed pas na tshor ba po zhes bya /
translated: The word vedaka is used because the self experiences the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: dza na ka ni bdag gtso bor gyur te dbang po dang yid dang yul du phrad pa las shes par 'gyur bar bshad pas na shes pa po zhes bya /
analyzed: dza na ka ni bdag gtso bor gyur te dbang po dang yid dang yul du phrad pa las shes par 'gyur bar bshad pas na shes pa po zhes bya /
translated: The word jña is used because the self is the principal factor and it is explained that consciousness arises from the contact of the sense faculties, the mind and objects.

original: pa shya ka ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi yul thams cad mthong ba yang bdag ces bya ba'i mthu yin pas na mthong ba po zhes bya /
analyzed: pa shya ka ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi yul thams cad mthong ba yang bdag ces bya ba'i mthu yin pas na mthong ba po zhes bya /
translated: The word paśya is used because the power of the self is the seer of all external objects such as form and so on.

original: autth'a pa ka ni phung po slong zhing skyed pas na slong ba po zhes bya /
analyzed: autth'a pa ka ni phung po slong zhing skyed pas na slong ba po zhes bya /
translated: The word utthāpaka is used because the self raises and generates the aggregates.

original: sa mutth'a pa ka zhes bya ba sam ni sa manta te kun zhes bya /
analyzed: sa mutth'a pa ka zhes bya ba sam ni sa manta te kun zhes bya /
translated: The word samutthāpaka is used because sam means samanta, all.

original: autth'a pa ka ni tshig @156b lhag tu smos pa dang sbyar te phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa kun skyed pas na kun nas slong ba po zhes bya /🔽dud 'gro'i rgyud la /
analyzed: autth'a pa ka ni tshig @156b lhag tu smos pa dang sbyar te phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa kun skyed pas na kun nas slong ba po zhes bya / dud 'gro'i rgyud la /
translated: The word utthāpaka is used because it is connected with the word utthāpaka and it is the all-raiser because it raises all the aggregates, bases and so on.

original: tirya ka tsa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: tirya ka tsa zhes bya ba /
translated: In the animal realm, the word tiryaṅca is used.

original: tirya aanytsa t'i ti tiryanytsi zhes bya ste mi ltar 'greng ste 'gro ba ma yin pa phyugs kyi khams su gtogs pa dud de 'gro bas na dud 'gro zhes bya /
analyzed: tirya aanytsa t'i ti tiryanytsi zhes bya ste mi ltar 'greng ste 'gro ba ma yin pa phyugs kyi khams su gtogs pa dud de 'gro bas na dud 'gro zhes bya /
translated: Tiryagyonis are called tiryagyonis because they move in a crooked way, like cattle, and do not move like humans.

original: ga ru da zhes bya ba khyung gi ming ste nam mkha' lding zhes bya /
analyzed: ga ru da zhes bya ba khyung gi ming ste nam mkha' lding zhes bya /
translated: Garuda is the name of a garuḍa, which is called a “soarer in the sky.”

original: t'a raksha khyung /
analyzed: t'a raksha khyung /
translated: Tārakṣa is a garuḍa.

original: su parna 'dab bzang /
analyzed: su parna 'dab bzang /
translated: Suparṇa is a good winged one.

original: ga ru da 'dab chags zhes bya /
analyzed: ga ru da 'dab chags zhes bya /
translated: Garuḍa is a winged one.

original: 'di rnams ma 'dom na thams cad nam mkha' lding du gdags /
analyzed: 'di rnams ma 'dom na thams cad nam mkha' lding du gdags /
translated: If these are not distinguished, all are called soarers in the sky.

original: kinna ra zhes bya ba dud 'gro rdzu 'phrul can gyi ming ste /
analyzed: kinna ra zhes bya ba dud 'gro rdzu 'phrul can gyi ming ste /
translated: Kiṃnara is the name of a magical animal.

original: byad gzugs mi dang yud kyis 'dra bas na mi 'am ci zhes bya /
analyzed: byad gzugs mi dang yud kyis 'dra bas na mi 'am ci zhes bya /
translated: They are called kiṃnara because their bodies are similar to humans.

original: ma ho ra ga zhes bya ba ma h'a ni chen po /
analyzed: ma ho ra ga zhes bya ba ma h'a ni chen po /
translated: Mahoraga is mahā, which is great,

original: au ra ga ni ltos 'gro ba la bya ste /
analyzed: au ra ga ni ltos 'gro ba la bya ste /
translated: and uraga, which is a snake.

original: klu 'brug gi khams su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: klu 'brug gi khams su gtogs pa ste /
translated: They are nāgas belonging to the class of dragons.

original: sbrul chen po yin pas na lto 'phye chen po zhes bya /
analyzed: sbrul chen po yin pas na lto 'phye chen po zhes bya /
translated: They are called great belly crawlers because they are great snakes.

original: b'a su ki zhes bya ba b'a su ka pattye na b'a su ki zhes bya ste /
analyzed: b'a su ki zhes bya ba b'a su ka pattye na b'a su ki zhes bya ste /
translated: Vāsuki is called vāsukipattyeva vāsuki.

original: klu'i rgyal po nor rgyas kyi bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po nor rgyas kyi bu zhes bya ste /
translated: The king of the nagas is called Vaisravana.

original: t'a la ha ka ka zhes bya ba rta rin po che sngo skya'i ming ste /
analyzed: t'a la ha ka ka zhes bya ba rta rin po che sngo skya'i ming ste /
translated: The name of the precious horse is called Talaharaka.

original: sbrin gyi shugs ltar mgyogs pas na sbrin  gyi shugs can zhes bya /
analyzed: sbrin gyi shugs ltar mgyogs pas na sbrin  gyi shugs can zhes bya /
translated: Since it is swift like the speed of a cloud, it is called the one with the speed of a cloud.

original: aee r'a ba ti zhes bya ba ai ra ni sa /
analyzed: aee r'a ba ti zhes bya ba ai ra ni sa /
translated: Airavati.

original: aa ba ti ni srung ba de'i bu yin pas na glang po sa srung gi bu zhes bya /
analyzed: aa ba ti ni srung ba de'i bu yin pas na glang po sa srung gi bu zhes bya /
translated: Since he is the son of the protector of that, he is called the son of the protector of elephants.

original: gling bzhi dang 'jig rten bshad pa /
analyzed: gling bzhi dang 'jig rten bshad pa /
translated: The four continents and the world🔽Purvavideha.

original: p'urba bi de ha zhes bya ba p'urba ni shar phyogs la bya /
analyzed: p'urba bi de ha zhes bya ba p'urba ni shar phyogs la bya /
translated: Purva is the east,

original: bi ni bi shishta ste bye brag tu 'phags pa dang bzang po /
analyzed: bi ni bi shishta ste bye brag tu 'phags pa dang bzang po /
translated: vi is visista, which means special or excellent,

original: de ha ni lus 'phags te /
analyzed: de ha ni lus 'phags te /
translated: and deha is body.

original: lus 'phags par bzang ba la ming du btags pas na shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya /
analyzed: lus 'phags par bzang ba la ming du btags pas na shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya /
translated: Since it is named after the excellent body in the east, it is called the eastern excellent body.

original: dzambu dv'i pa zhes bya ba dzambu ni lho phyogs kyi gling 'di'i byang phyogs kyi rgya mtsho'i 'gram na shing chen po dzambu zhes bya ba shing tog rdza ma tsam chags pa'i 'bras bu chu'i nang du lhung ba rnams dzambu chu bo'i gser du 'gyur ba zhig yod
analyzed: dzambu dv'i pa zhes bya ba dzambu ni lho phyogs kyi gling 'di'i byang phyogs kyi rgya mtsho'i 'gram na shing chen po dzambu zhes bya ba shing tog rdza ma tsam chags pa'i 'bras bu chu'i nang du lhung ba rnams dzambu chu bo'i gser du 'gyur ba zhig yod
translated: The fruit that falls into the water becomes gold of the Jambū River.

original: de / de la mtshan mar btsugs te ming du btags pas na dzambu'i gling zhes btags /
analyzed: de / de la mtshan mar btsugs te ming du btags pas na dzambu'i gling zhes btags /
translated: Since the name of the continent is derived from the name of the tree, it is called Jambudvīpa.

original: aa ba ra go d'a ni ya zhes bya ba aa ba ra ni nub phyogs /
analyzed: aa ba ra go d'a ni ya zhes bya ba aa ba ra ni nub phyogs /
translated: Avaragodānīya is so called because in the west

original: go ni ba lang /
analyzed: go ni ba lang /
translated: go means “ox,”

original: d'a ni sbyin zhing spyod pa ste /
analyzed: d'a ni sbyin zhing spyod pa ste /
translated: and dānīya means “to give” or “to practice.”

original: de la ba lang lhag par mang zhing spyod pa las ming du btags te nub kyi ba lang spyod ces bya /
analyzed: de la ba lang lhag par mang zhing spyod pa las ming du btags te nub kyi ba lang spyod ces bya /
translated: Since oxen are especially numerous and practiced there, it is called Godānīya, or “Oxen Practice,” in the west.

original: autta ra ku ru zhes bya ba autta ra ni byang phyogs /
analyzed: autta ra ku ru zhes bya ba autta ra ni byang phyogs /
translated: Uttarakuru is so called because in the north

original: ku ni kum si ta te ngan pa /
analyzed: ku ni kum si ta te ngan pa /
translated: ku means “bad,”

original: ru ni ra ba ste sgra /
analyzed: ru ni ra ba ste sgra /
translated: and ru means “sound.”

original: byang phyogs kyi gling de na mi'i skad du smra ba med de skad ngan pas brda byed pa la yang bya /🔽yang sngon @157a * //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi gling de na mi'i skad du smra ba med de skad ngan pas brda byed pa la yang bya / yang sngon @157a * //
translated: In that northern continent, there is no human language; they communicate with unpleasant sounds.

original: gyi mkhan po kha cig gi bshad pa las byang phyogs kyi gling gi mi lo stong thub pas sgyid cing bde ba las 'chi kar sgra mi snyan pa 'byung ste dus las 'da' 'o zhes kyang 'chad de /
analyzed: gyi mkhan po kha cig gi bshad pa las byang phyogs kyi gling gi mi lo stong thub pas sgyid cing bde ba las 'chi kar sgra mi snyan pa 'byung ste dus las 'da' 'o zhes kyang 'chad de /
translated: Also, in the explanations of some former abbots, it is explained that the people of the northern continent live for one thousand years, are lazy, and are happy. At the time of death, Kuru appears and they die.

original: spyir gnyis ka dang sbyar na mthun te byang gi sgra mi snyan du btags /
analyzed: spyir gnyis ka dang sbyar na mthun te byang gi sgra mi snyan du btags /
translated: If one applies both explanations in general, it is consistent to call it Kuru in the north.

original: lo ka zhes bya ba lu dzya ta ai ti zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lo ka zhes bya ba lu dzya ta ai ti zhes bya ste /
translated: As for the term loka, it is said lujya iti.

original: sems can la sogs pa 'chi zhing mi rtag la 'jig pa'i gzhi yin pas na 'jig rten zhes bya /
analyzed: sems can la sogs pa 'chi zhing mi rtag la 'jig pa'i gzhi yin pas na 'jig rten zhes bya /
translated: Since it is the basis for the death, impermanence, and destruction of sentient beings and so on, it is called the world.

original: yul dang mtho ris kyi shing gi ming la /
analyzed: yul dang mtho ris kyi shing gi ming la /
translated: The names of trees in the higher realms and in the world🔽.

original: shra ba sti zhes bya ba drang srong mnyan po zhes bya ba dang / drang srong yod pa zhes bya gnyis kyis grong khyer 'di dang po btsugs pa yin pas na mnyan yod ces bya /
analyzed: shra ba sti zhes bya ba drang srong mnyan po zhes bya ba dang / drang srong yod pa zhes bya gnyis kyis grong khyer 'di dang po btsugs pa yin pas na mnyan yod ces bya /
translated: Since this city was first established by two sages named Śrāvastī and Ṛṣivadana, it is called Śrāvastī.

original: nee rri ti di sha zhes bya ba ni rga ti ri ta zhes bya ste /🔽nir ni bral ba /
analyzed: nee rri ti di sha zhes bya ba ni rga ti ri ta zhes bya ste / nir ni bral ba /
translated: Naireṛita means ṛta, which is truth, and nir means free.

original: ri ta ni bden pa ste srin po'i rgyal po bden bral zhes bya /
analyzed: ri ta ni bden pa ste srin po'i rgyal po bden bral zhes bya /
translated: Thus, it is the king of rākṣasas called Free of Truth.

original: lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams na gnas pa'i phyogs skyong gi ming ste /
analyzed: lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams na gnas pa'i phyogs skyong gi ming ste /
translated: This is the name of the guardian of the direction in the southwest.

original: bden bral gyi phyogs zhes bya /
analyzed: bden bral gyi phyogs zhes bya /
translated: It is called the direction of Free of Truth.

original: p'a ri y'a tra ko bi d'a ra zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs na p'a ri y'a tra ni par'i ti sa manta y'a tra ste /
analyzed: p'a ri y'a tra ko bi d'a ra zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs na p'a ri y'a tra ni par'i ti sa manta y'a tra ste /
translated: If one derives the name from the Sanskrit word pāriyātrakovidāra, pāriyātra means “beautiful place.”

original: lha'i spos kyi shing bzang po'i drung du lha thams cad 'dus te rdzi phyogs su ni dpag tshad brgya'i bar du dri zhim po'i ngad ldang / rdzi phyogs ma yin pa'i logs su ni dpag tshad lnga bcu'i bar du dri zhim po'i ngad ldang ba'i shing gi ming ste yongs su 'du zhes bya /
analyzed: lha'i spos kyi shing bzang po'i drung du lha thams cad 'dus te rdzi phyogs su ni dpag tshad brgya'i bar du dri zhim po'i ngad ldang / rdzi phyogs ma yin pa'i logs su ni dpag tshad lnga bcu'i bar du dri zhim po'i ngad ldang ba'i shing gi ming ste yongs su 'du zhes bya /
translated: In the presence of the excellent incense tree of the gods, all the gods gather and the sweet scent of the incense rises for a hundred leagues in the direction of the wind and for fifty leagues in the direction opposite to the wind.

original: ko bi d'a ni kum bi d'a ra ya ti ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ko bi d'a ni kum bi d'a ra ya ti ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The name of the tree is “partaking of all.”

original: spos kyi shing chen po yal ga mang zhing sdong po che bas sa chen po brtol te 'byung ba dang 'dra bas sa brtol zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spos kyi shing chen po yal ga mang zhing sdong po che bas sa chen po brtol te 'byung ba dang 'dra bas sa brtol zhes bya ste /
translated: The great incense tree has many branches and a large trunk, and it appears as if it has split open the great earth, so it is called “earth-splitter.”

original: bsdus pas shing yongs 'du sa brtol zhes bya /
analyzed: bsdus pas shing yongs 'du sa brtol zhes bya /
translated: In summary, it is called “partaking of all, earth-splitter.”

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas kyi ming la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas kyi ming la /
translated: The names of the places in the desire realm:

original: bhoo ma zhes bya ba bhoo moo bhoo ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bhoo ma zhes bya ba bhoo moo bhoo ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Bhojana is called bho-mo-bho-ma.

original: sa la brten pa'i gnod sbyin gyi ming ste sa bla zhes bya /
analyzed: sa la brten pa'i gnod sbyin gyi ming ste sa bla zhes bya /
translated: The name of the yaksha who dwells on the earth is called “earth-dwelling.”

original: aanta ri ksha b'a si zhes bya ba aanta ri ksha bar snang la bya /🔽b'a sa gnas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: aanta ri ksha b'a si zhes bya ba aanta ri ksha bar snang la bya / b'a sa gnas pa la bya ste /
translated: The gods of Nirmāṇarati are called Tuṣita, meaning “those who delight in their own emanations.”

original: nyi zla la sogs pa rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris su gtogs pa kha cig nam mkha' la rgyu ba ltar snang bas na bar snang la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyi zla la sogs pa rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris su gtogs pa kha cig nam mkha' la rgyu ba ltar snang bas na bar snang la gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The gods of Paranirmitavaśavartin are called Nirmāṇarati, meaning “those who delight in the emanations of others.”🔽The gods of Brahmakāyika are called Paranirmitavaśavartin, meaning “those who control the emanations of others.”

original: tsa tu rma h'a r'a dza k'a yi ka zhes bya ba tsa tu ra ni bzhi /
analyzed: tsa tu rma h'a r'a dza k'a yi ka zhes bya ba tsa tu ra ni bzhi /
translated: The gods of Brahmapurohita are called Paranirmita, meaning “those who emanate others.”🔽The gods of Mahābrahmāṇa are called Brahmapurohita, meaning “priests of Brahmā.”

original: ma h'a r'a dza ni rgyal po chen po /🔽k'a ya ni tshogs pa 'am gnas sam ris la bya /
analyzed: ma h'a r'a dza ni rgyal po chen po / k'a ya ni tshogs pa 'am gnas sam ris la bya /
translated: The gods of Parīttābha are called Mahābrahmāṇa, meaning “great Brahmā.”

original: ai ka ni tshig gong ma'i rkyen du sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: ai ka ni tshig gong ma'i rkyen du sbyar ba yin te /
translated: The gods of Apramāṇābha are called Parīttābha, meaning “those of limited light.”🔽The gods of Ābhāsvara are called Apramāṇābha, meaning “those of immeasurable light.”

original: spyir na ris den spyod cing gnas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: spyir na ris den spyod cing gnas pa la bya ste /
translated: The gods of Parīttaśubha are called Ābhāsvara, meaning “those of light.”🔽The gods of Apramāṇaśubha are called Parīttaśubha, meaning “those of limited virtue.”🔽The gods of Śubhakṛtsna are called Apramāṇaśubha, meaning “those of immeasurable virtue.”🔽The gods of Bṛhatphala are called Śubhakṛtsna, meaning “those who are virtuous in every way.”🔽The gods of Avṛha are called Bṛhatphala, meaning “those of great fruit.”

original: rgyal po chen po bzhis ris su gtogs pa lag na gzhong thogs dang / phreng thogs dang / @157b rtag tu myos dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi'i 'khor dang 'di bzhi la bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhis ris su gtogs pa lag na gzhong thogs dang / phreng thogs dang / @157b rtag tu myos dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi'i 'khor dang 'di bzhi la bya ste /
translated: The gods of Atapa are called Avṛha, meaning “those who are not great.”🔽The gods of Sudarśana are called Atapa, meaning “those who are not hot.”🔽The gods of Sudṛśa are called Sudarśana, meaning “those who have good vision.”

original: tshig spyir bsdus na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris zhes bya /
analyzed: tshig spyir bsdus na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris zhes bya /
translated: The gods of Akaniṣṭha are called Sudṛśa, meaning “those who have good sight.”

original: tra yastringsha zhes bya ba tra ya ni gsum /
analyzed: tra yastringsha zhes bya ba tra ya ni gsum /
translated: Trayastrimsa means thirty three.

original: stringsha ni sum cu ste /
analyzed: stringsha ni sum cu ste /
translated: Trayas means three and trinsa means thirty.

original: 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag las ni mtho ris ri rab kyi steng na lha'i gtso bo sum cu rtsa gsum bzhugs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag las ni mtho ris ri rab kyi steng na lha'i gtso bo sum cu rtsa gsum bzhugs te /
translated: According to worldly treatises, the principal gods of the Heaven of the Thirty three live on top of Mount Meru in the higher realms.

original: drag po bcu gcig dang / nyi ma bcu gnyis dang / nor lha brgyad dang / tha skar gyi bu gnyis dang sum cu rtsa gsum bzhugs pas na sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya /
analyzed: drag po bcu gcig dang / nyi ma bcu gnyis dang / nor lha brgyad dang / tha skar gyi bu gnyis dang sum cu rtsa gsum bzhugs pas na sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya /
translated: Since the eleven Rudras, the twelve suns, the eight gods of wealth and the two sons of ashhâdhâ live there, it is called the Heaven of the Thirty three.

original: chos mngon pa las ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i gnas na g-yas g-yon gnyis kyi gral du nye ba'i dbang po bcu drug bcu drug seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa dang / gung na lha'i dbang po brgya byin seng ge'i khri la bzhugs te spyir na lha'i gtso bo sum cu rtsa gsum bzhugs pa las btags te zhes 'byung /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i gnas na g-yas g-yon gnyis kyi gral du nye ba'i dbang po bcu drug bcu drug seng ge'i khri la bzhugs pa dang / gung na lha'i dbang po brgya byin seng ge'i khri la bzhugs te spyir na lha'i gtso bo sum cu rtsa gsum bzhugs pa las btags te zhes 'byung /
translated: According to the Abhidharma, in the Heaven of the Thirty three, on the two sides of the row, there are sixteen Maheshauras sitting on lion thrones and in the middle sits Indra, the lord of the gods, on a lion throne. In general, since the principal gods of the Heaven of the Thirty three live there, it is called the Heaven of the Thirty three.

original: sgra bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sgra bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called the Heaven of the Thirty three according to the literal meaning.

original: y'a ma zhes bya ba aa su ra bi bha dbha ya ya ta aa pa ya ta zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: y'a ma zhes bya ba aa su ra bi bha dbha ya ya ta aa pa ya ta zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The gods called Yāma are called Asuravibhavayayatāpavayata.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i ris man chad na lha ma yin gyis 'thab pa'i 'jigs pa dang ma bral la /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i ris man chad na lha ma yin gyis 'thab pa'i 'jigs pa dang ma bral la /
translated: Below the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the gods are not free from the fear of fighting with the demigods.

original: 'di yan chad ni lha ma yin dang 'thab pa'i 'jigs pa las 'das te bral bas 'thab bral zhes btags te /🔽bsod nams kyis phyin pa dang / mel tshe thun re re la skoms shing skul ba skad 'byung ba dang / sngon mtshe ma dang zung ma zhes btags pa ni yi ge gzhung dang sbyar na gtan tshigs mi che bar 'gyur te mi btsan par byas so //🔽tu shi ta zhes bya ba tu sha ni pri to zhes bya ba dga' ba /🔽ai ta ni pr'apta ste 'thob pa'am ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni lha ma yin dang 'thab pa'i 'jigs pa las 'das te bral bas 'thab bral zhes btags te / bsod nams kyis phyin pa dang / mel tshe thun re re la skoms shing skul ba skad 'byung ba dang / sngon mtshe ma dang zung ma zhes btags pa ni yi ge gzhung dang sbyar na gtan tshigs mi che bar 'gyur te mi btsan par byas so // tu shi ta zhes bya ba tu sha ni pri to zhes bya ba dga' ba / ai ta ni pr'apta ste 'thob pa'am ldan pa ste /
translated: Above this heaven, the gods are beyond the fear of fighting with the demigods and are free from it. Therefore, it is called the Heaven Free of Conflict.

original: chos kyi dga' ba dang bde ba lhag par che bas na dga' ldan zhes bya /
analyzed: chos kyi dga' ba dang bde ba lhag par che bas na dga' ldan zhes bya /
translated: The gods called Tuṣita are called Tuṣita because they are endowed with the joy of Dharma.🔽The gods called Nirmāṇarati are called Nirmāṇarati because they delight in creating emanations.🔽The gods called Paranirmitavaśavartin are called Paranirmitavaśavartin because they delight in creating emanations for others.

original: ni rm'a na ra ti zhes bya ba sva yannirm'a na k'a man pa ri bhu nydza ta zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ni rm'a na ra ti zhes bya ba sva yannirm'a na k'a man pa ri bhu nydza ta zhes bya ste /
translated: The term nirmanaratir means one who enjoys emanations (nirmanaratir).🔽

original: rang gis gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ci dga' bar sbrul nas 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams la spyod pas na 'phrul dga' zhes bya /🔽pa ra ni rmi ta ba sha barti zhes bya ba pa ra ni rmi t'a bho ga na ba she na brta yi tum sh'i la zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang gis gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams ci dga' bar sbrul nas 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams la spyod pas na 'phrul dga' zhes bya / pa ra ni rmi ta ba sha barti zhes bya ba pa ra ni rmi t'a bho ga na ba she na brta yi tum sh'i la zhes bya ste /
translated: The gods called Nirmāṇarati are called that because they enjoy the objects of desire that they themselves have emanated.

original: gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i longs spyod sprul pa rnams la phan tshun spyod par dbang byed pas na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i longs spyod sprul pa rnams la phan tshun spyod par dbang byed pas na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya /
translated: The gods called Paranirmitavaśavartin are called that because they have power over the objects of desire that others have emanated.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa'i ming la /🔽brahma k'a yi ka zhes bya ba /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa'i ming la / brahma k'a yi ka zhes bya ba /
translated: The names of the levels of the first concentration🔽Brahmakāyika

original: brahma ni tshangs pa /
analyzed: brahma ni tshangs pa /
translated: Brahma means “pure”

original: @158a * // k'a yi ka ni ris su gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: @158a * // k'a yi ka ni ris su gtogs pa ste /
translated: and kāyika means “belonging to a class.”

original: 'dod pa'i khams las thar nas bsam gtan dang po'i sar phyin pa'i ming yin te tshangs ris zhes bya /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las thar nas bsam gtan dang po'i sar phyin pa'i ming yin te tshangs ris zhes bya /
translated: The name of the first level of the first concentration is Brahmakāyika because it is the level where one goes after escaping from the desire realm.

original: brahma pu ro hi ta zhes bya ba /
analyzed: brahma pu ro hi ta zhes bya ba /
translated: Brahmapurohita.

original: brahma na pu ro dhi ya te zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brahma na pu ro dhi ya te zhes bya ste /
translated: Brahmapurodhitā.

original: tshangs pa chen po'i mdun du rtag tu 'dug  la tshig 'don zhing smra bas na tshangs pa mdun na 'don zhes bya /
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po'i mdun du rtag tu 'dug  la tshig 'don zhing smra bas na tshangs pa mdun na 'don zhes bya /
translated: Since they always sit in front of Mahābrahmā and recite and speak, they are called Brahmapurohita.

original: bra hma pa ri sh'a dya zhes bya ba brahma na pa ri ts'a ra ka zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bra hma pa ri sh'a dya zhes bya ba brahma na pa ri ts'a ra ka zhes bya ste /
translated: Brahmapāriṣadya.

original: lha'i ris de'i tshangs pa rnams tshangs pa chen po'i khams dang zham 'bring du gtogs pa'i phyir tshangs 'khor zhes bya /🔽ma h'a bra hma zhes bya ba tshe dang byad gzugs dang mdog la sogs pa tshangs pa phal dang mi 'dra bar 'phags la /
analyzed: lha'i ris de'i tshangs pa rnams tshangs pa chen po'i khams dang zham 'bring du gtogs pa'i phyir tshangs 'khor zhes bya / ma h'a bra hma zhes bya ba tshe dang byad gzugs dang mdog la sogs pa tshangs pa phal dang mi 'dra bar 'phags la /
translated: Since the Brahmakāyika gods are included in the retinue of Mahābrahmā, they are called Brahmapāriṣadya.🔽Mahābrahmā.

original: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag po mdzad pas na tshangs pa chen po zhes bya /
analyzed: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag po mdzad pas na tshangs pa chen po zhes bya /
translated: Since his lifespan, body, color, and so on are superior to the ordinary Brahmakāyika gods, and since he acts as the lord of the Sahā world, he is called Mahābrahmā.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa'i ming la /🔽pa r'i tt'a bh'a zhes bya ba ba r'itta ae sham aa bh'a sva bh'u mi beekshya ti zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa'i ming la /🔽pa r'i tt'a bh'a zhes bya ba ba r'itta ae sham aa bh'a sva bh'u mi beekshya ti zhes bya ste /
translated: The names of the second concentration level.🔽Parīttābha.

original: ris 'di na gnas pa 'di bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa la gnas rim pa gsum yod pa'i tha ma yin te /
analyzed: ris 'di na gnas pa 'di bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa la gnas rim pa gsum yod pa'i tha ma yin te /
translated: The gods of this class are the lowest of the three levels of the second concentration.

original: gong ma gnyis las 'od chung ba'i phyir 'od chung zhes bya /
analyzed: gong ma gnyis las 'od chung ba'i phyir 'od chung zhes bya /
translated: They are called Parittabha, or Limited Radiance, because their light is less than that of the two higher classes.

original: aa pra m'a n'a bh'a zhes bya ba /
analyzed: aa pra m'a n'a bh'a zhes bya ba /
translated: Apramanabha means

original: n'a bh'a pra m'a na me shan sh'akya ma bra ma hu na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: n'a bh'a pra m'a na me shan sh'akya ma bra ma hu na zhes bya ste /
translated: naabhapramanameshanakyamabrahmahuhuva.

original: lha de dag gi 'od sa 'og ma bas tshad gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir tshad med 'od ces bya /
analyzed: lha de dag gi 'od sa 'og ma bas tshad gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir tshad med 'od ces bya /
translated: Because the light of these gods cannot be measured in comparison with the light of the gods of the lower level, they are called Apramanabha, or Immeasurable Radiance.🔽Abhasvara means

original: a'a bh'a sva ra zhes bya ba a'a bh'a sa ni 'od /
analyzed: a'a bh'a sva ra zhes bya ba a'a bh'a sa ni 'od /
translated: abhasa means light;

original: wa ra ni 'od byed pa 'am gsal bar byed pa lta bu'i tshig gi rkyen te lha'i gnas kyi 'od kyis gnas kun du rgyas par snang bar gyur pas na 'od gsal zhes bya /
analyzed: wa ra ni 'od byed pa 'am gsal bar byed pa lta bu'i tshig gi rkyen te lha'i gnas kyi 'od kyis gnas kun du rgyas par snang bar gyur pas na 'od gsal zhes bya /
translated: vara means like a light that illuminates or shines; the gods of this class are called Abhasvara, or Luminous, because the light of their realm shines everywhere.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa'i ming la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa'i ming la /
translated: The names of the levels of the third concentration are🔽Parittashubha means

original: pa r'itta shu bha zhes bya ba pa r'itta ni chung ngu /
analyzed: pa r'itta shu bha zhes bya ba pa r'itta ni chung ngu /
translated: paritta means small;

original: shu bha dge ba ste /
analyzed: shu bha dge ba ste /
translated: shubha means virtue.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i yid kyi sa'i ba de ba la dge ba zhes bya /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i yid kyi sa'i ba de ba la dge ba zhes bya /
translated: The fourth level of the third absorption is called Lesser Virtue.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa la gnas rim pa gsum yod pa'i tha ma  yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa la gnas rim pa gsum yod pa'i tha ma  yin te /
translated: It is the lowest of the three levels of the third absorption.

original: sa gong ma gsum pas dge ba chung ba'i phyir dge chung zhes bya /
analyzed: sa gong ma gsum pas dge ba chung ba'i phyir dge chung zhes bya /
translated: It is called Lesser Virtue because the virtue of the three higher levels is greater.🔽The fourth level of the third absorption is called Immeasurable Virtue.

original: aa bra m'a na shu bha zhes bya ba lha'i gnas der skyes pa de dag gi bde ba sa 'og ma pas tshad gzung du med pa'i phyir tshad med dge zhes bya /
analyzed: aa bra m'a na shu bha zhes bya ba lha'i gnas der skyes pa de dag gi bde ba sa 'og ma pas tshad gzung du med pa'i phyir tshad med dge zhes bya /
translated: The bliss of those born in that god realm is immeasurable compared to that of the lower levels, so it is called Immeasurable Virtue.🔽The fifth level of the third absorption is called Vast Virtue.

original: shu bha krit+sna zhes bya ba lha de dag gi dge ba las lhag pa lha'i ris man chad gzhan la med pas dge rgyas zhes bya /
analyzed: shu bha krit+sna zhes bya ba lha de dag gi dge ba las lhag pa lha'i ris man chad gzhan la med pas dge rgyas zhes bya /
translated: The virtue of those gods is greater than that of the gods below them, so it is called Vast Virtue.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa'i ming la /🔽aa na bhra ka zhes bya ba bhra ka ni sprin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa'i ming la / aa na bhra ka zhes bya ba bhra ka ni sprin te /
translated: The fourth absorption has four levels.🔽The first level of the fourth absorption is called No Cloud.

original: sprin @158b lta bu med pas na aa na bhraka zhes bya ste sbrin 'khrigs pa dang 'dra bar 'dab chags pa med de /
analyzed: sprin @158b lta bu med pas na aa na bhraka zhes bya ste sbrin 'khrigs pa dang 'dra bar 'dab chags pa med de /
translated: It is called No Cloud because there are no clouds there.

original: gzhal med khang dang bcas par skye zhing 'chi 'pho la /
analyzed: gzhal med khang dang bcas par skye zhing 'chi 'pho la /
translated: Beings are born there with their celestial palaces and die and transmigrate there.

original: de yan chad kyang gnam gyi rim pa sbrin ltar 'gebs pa med pas sprin med ces bya /🔽punya bras ba zhes bya ba punya ni bsod nams /
analyzed: de yan chad kyang gnam gyi rim pa sbrin ltar 'gebs pa med pas sprin med ces bya / punya bras ba zhes bya ba punya ni bsod nams /
translated: Above that, since the levels of the sky are not covered by clouds, it is called Cloudless.

original: pra sa ba ni skyes pa'am 'byung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: pra sa ba ni skyes pa'am 'byung ba la bya ste /
translated: Puṇyaprasava is called Puṇyaprasava because puṇya means merit and prasava means to be born or to arise.

original: mi g-yo ba'i bsod nams las lha de dag skyes pas na bsod nams skyes zhes bya /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i bsod nams las lha de dag skyes pas na bsod nams skyes zhes bya /
translated: Since those gods are born from the merit of the immovable level, they are called born from merit.

original: brihatpha la zhes bya ba gnas gzhan yod pa'i so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i mchog skye bas na 'bras bu che zhes bya /
analyzed: brihatpha la zhes bya ba gnas gzhan yod pa'i so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i mchog skye bas na 'bras bu che zhes bya /
translated: Bṛhatphala is called Bṛhatphala because it is the supreme result of the merit of all ordinary beings who have other abodes.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i ming la /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i ming la /
translated: The names of the gods of the pristine abodes are as follows:

original: shubdha b'a sa zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i lam gyi chus sems kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bkrus pas phyir mi 'ong ba la sogs pa sems can dag pa sha stag gnas te /
analyzed: shubdha b'a sa zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i lam gyi chus sems kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bkrus pas phyir mi 'ong ba la sogs pa sems can dag pa sha stag gnas te /
translated: Śubhakṛtsna is called Śubhakṛtsna because it is the abode of only pure sentient beings such as nonreturners and so on, who are washed of the stains of affliction of the mind by the water of the ārya path.

original: so so'i skye bo dang ma 'dres pas na gnas gtsang ma zhes bya /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang ma 'dres pas na gnas gtsang ma zhes bya /
translated: Since it is not mixed with ordinary beings, it is called the pristine abode.

original: aa bri ha zhes bya ba gnas gtsang ma ris lnga yod pa'i nang na tha ma yin pas na mi che ba zhes bya /
analyzed: aa bri ha zhes bya ba gnas gtsang ma ris lnga yod pa'i nang na tha ma yin pas na mi che ba zhes bya /
translated: Avirha means that since it is the lowest of the five pure abodes, it is called the abode of the non-great.

original: aa t'a pa zhes bya ba lha'i ris 'dir skyes pa rnams bsam pa dge ba'i phyir sa 'og mar skyes pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa dang / sa gong ma ma thob kyang mi dga' ba med pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba chen po med pas mi gdung ba zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: aa t'a pa zhes bya ba lha'i ris 'dir skyes pa rnams bsam pa dge ba'i phyir sa 'og mar skyes pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa dang / sa gong ma ma thob kyang mi dga' ba med pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba chen po med pas mi gdung ba zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Atapa means that because those born in this god realm have virtuous thoughts, those born in lower levels do not outshine them, they are not unhappy even though they have not attained higher levels and they have no great torment of affliction, it is called the abode of no torment.

original: su dri sha zhes bya ba lha'i ris 'dir skyes pa rnams rab tu zhi ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir mig sngar mdzes shing bzang bas na gya nom snang zhes bya /
analyzed: su dri sha zhes bya ba lha'i ris 'dir skyes pa rnams rab tu zhi ba'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir mig sngar mdzes shing bzang bas na gya nom snang zhes bya /
translated: Sudrsa means that because those born in this god realm have the special quality of complete peace, they are beautiful and good to look at, so it is called the abode of beautiful appearance.

original: su darsha na zhes bya ba lha'i ris 'dir skyes pa rnams zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin spel mar bsgoms pa'i sgrib pa lhag ma cung zad cig lus su zad de /
analyzed: su darsha na zhes bya ba lha'i ris 'dir skyes pa rnams zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin spel mar bsgoms pa'i sgrib pa lhag ma cung zad cig lus su zad de /
translated: Sudarsana means that those born in this god realm have only a little remaining obscuration from alternating the cultivation of contaminated and uncontaminated concentration.

original: mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag cing mthong bas na bzang ba'i phyir shin tu mthong ba zhes bya /
analyzed: mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag cing mthong bas na bzang ba'i phyir shin tu mthong ba zhes bya /
translated: It is called Excellent Vision because it is a vision that is extremely pure and good.

original: aa ka nishtha zhes bya ba aa ni ma yin pa /🔽ka nishtha ni 'og ma la bya /
analyzed: aa ka nishtha zhes bya ba aa ni ma yin pa / ka nishtha ni 'og ma la bya /
translated: Akanistha means not below.

original: spyir na gzugs kyi khams kyi dang po ste /
analyzed: spyir na gzugs kyi khams kyi dang po ste /
translated: In general, it is the first of the form realms.

original: gong na gzhan med pas 'og min zhes bya /
analyzed: gong na gzhan med pas 'og min zhes bya /
translated: Since there is nothing higher, it is called the Unsurpassed.

original: yang mdo snga kha cig gi nang nas aa gha nishtha zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang mdo snga kha cig gi nang nas aa gha nishtha zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some earlier sutras, it is called Agha-nistha.

original: aa gha ni rdul phra mo bsags pa /
analyzed: aa gha ni rdul phra mo bsags pa /
translated: Agha means a collection of subtle particles.

original: nishtha ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: nishtha ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: Nistha means ultimate.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi ya thog yin pas bsags pa'i mtha' zhes kyang bya ste skabs dang sbyar zhing gdags /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi ya thog yin pas bsags pa'i mtha' zhes kyang bya ste skabs dang sbyar zhing gdags /
translated: Since it is the beginning of the form realms, it is also called the ultimate collection.

original: mah'a ma he shvar y'a ta na zhes bya ba 'og min gyi phyogs kyi gnas zhig na byang chub @159a * //
analyzed: mah'a ma he shvar y'a ta na zhes bya ba 'og min gyi phyogs kyi gnas zhig na byang chub @159a * //
translated: In a place in the direction of the Unsurpassed,

original: sems dpa' dbang phyug chen po'i nang na rnam par snang mdzad chen po bzhugs te /
analyzed: sems dpa' dbang phyug chen po'i nang na rnam par snang mdzad chen po bzhugs te /
translated: the bodhisattva Maha-Mahesvara-Tana resides as Vairochana the Great.

original: chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa bsten zhing myong bar gyur pa'i gnas yin pas na dbang phyug chen po che ba'i gnas zhes bya /🔽gzugs med pa'i sa'i ming la a'a k'a sh'a nantya ma zhes snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ba'i dus na gzugs kyi 'du shes las 'das te /
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs pa bsten zhing myong bar gyur pa'i gnas yin pas na dbang phyug chen po che ba'i gnas zhes bya / gzugs med pa'i sa'i ming la a'a k'a sh'a nantya ma zhes snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ba'i dus na gzugs kyi 'du shes las 'das te /
translated: It is the abode of the enjoyment of the Dharma and the place where one experiences it, so it is called the abode of the great lord of the great.🔽The names of the formless realms are as follows. The name of the first is called the sphere of infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa'i 'du shes 'byung bas nam mkha' mtha' yas /🔽a'a ya ta ni skye ba'i gnas yin pas skye mched de /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa'i 'du shes 'byung bas nam mkha' mtha' yas / a'a ya ta ni skye ba'i gnas yin pas skye mched de /
translated: When one is applying oneself to entering into meditative absorption, one transcends the perception of form and the perception arises that thinks, Space is infinite.🔽Therefore it is called infinite space.

original: bsdus na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ste /
analyzed: bsdus na nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ces bya ste /
translated: The suffix -āyatana means abode, so it is called the base of infinite space.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyang tshul 'di bzhin bshad /
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyang tshul 'di bzhin bshad /
translated: The base of infinite consciousness, the base of nothingness, and the base of neither perception nor nonperception are explained in the same way.

original: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa la sogs pa'i ming la /
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa la sogs pa'i ming la /
translated: The names of the higher realms and the definite goodness and so forth are as follows.

original: aa bhyung ya zhes bya ba lha dang mi la sogs pa'i go 'phang mthon po dang / dbang thang thob pa'i ming ste mngon par mtho ba zhes bya /
analyzed: aa bhyung ya zhes bya ba lha dang mi la sogs pa'i go 'phang mthon po dang / dbang thang thob pa'i ming ste mngon par mtho ba zhes bya /
translated: Abhyudaya means the attainment of high status as a god, human, and so on, and is translated as “high rebirth.”

original: ni: shre ya zhes bya ba thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming ste /
analyzed: ni: shre ya zhes bya ba thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i ming ste /
translated: Śreyas means liberation, nirvāṇa.

original: sgra dang sbyar na nges par legs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sgra dang sbyar na nges par legs pa zhes bya /
translated: When applied to the words, it is translated as “sublime.”

original: aa pa brga ya thar pa'i ming ste /
analyzed: aa pa brga ya thar pa'i ming ste /
translated: Apavarga is a name for liberation.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad byang zhing bsal ba la bya bas na byang grol zhes bya /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad byang zhing bsal ba la bya bas na byang grol zhes bya /
translated: Since it means “to clear away and eliminate all afflictions and branch afflictions,” it is translated as “enlightenment” and “liberation.”

original: aoo pa dhi she sha nirb'a na zhes bya ba ;
analyzed: aoo pa dhi she sha nirb'a na zhes bya ba ;
translated: Saupadhiśeṣanirvāṇa means

original: dgra bcom pa lta bu khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa lta bu khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs nas /
translated: that, like an arhat, all the afflictions of the three realms have been abandoned,

original: phung po tsam ma bor ba'i ming ste /
analyzed: phung po tsam ma bor ba'i ming ste /
translated: but the mere aggregates have not been cast off.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called “nirvāṇa with remainder of aggregates.”

original: ni ru pa dhi she sha nirb'a na zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang spangs la /
analyzed: ni ru pa dhi she sha nirb'a na zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa thams cad kyang spangs la /
translated: Nirupadhiśeṣanirvāṇa means that all the afflictions have been abandoned🔽and

original: phung po lnga'i sdug bsngal gyi me yang zhi bar byed pa'i ming ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i sdug bsngal gyi me yang zhi bar byed pa'i ming ste /
translated: It is also the name for the pacification of the fire of the suffering of the five aggregates.

original: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /🔽pra ti sam khy'a ni ro dha zhes bya ba /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya / pra ti sam khy'a ni ro dha zhes bya ba /
translated: It is called “nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.”🔽Pratisaṃkhyānirodha means “cessation through discernment.”

original: shes rab kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi so sor brtags nas nyon mongs pa 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i ming ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi so sor brtags nas nyon mongs pa 'gags pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i ming ste /
translated: It is the name for the attainment of nirvana, the cessation of the afflictions, through discerning the four noble truths with wisdom.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya /
translated: It is called “cessation through discernment.”

original: aa pra ti sam khya ni ro dha zhes bya ba rkyen ma tshang bas 'gog gi brtags pas mi 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: aa pra ti sam khya ni ro dha zhes bya ba rkyen ma tshang bas 'gog gi brtags pas mi 'gog pa ste /
translated: Apratisaṃkhyānirodha means “cessation through lack of conditions.” It is cessation through the lack of conditions, not through discernment.

original: dper na gzugs gcig la mig gi rnam par shes pa lhag par zhen cing dmigs pa'i skyes bu gzugs gzhan la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la @159b sogs pa de dang dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i yul dmigs su de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pas mi dmigs pa 'das zin pa la ni dmigs su mi rung bas na sems dang sems las byung ba ma 'ongs pa rnams🔽skye ba la gtan gyi gegs su gyur pa'i ming ste /
analyzed: dper na gzugs gcig la mig gi rnam par shes pa lhag par zhen cing dmigs pa'i skyes bu gzugs gzhan la dmigs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la @159b sogs pa de dang dus gcig tu 'byung ba'i yul dmigs su de ma thag pa'i rkyen med pas mi dmigs pa 'das zin pa la ni dmigs su mi rung bas na sems dang sems las byung ba ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la gtan gyi gegs su gyur pa'i ming ste /
translated: Since it is not suitable to focus on past objects that have already ceased, future minds and mental factors

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya /
translated: are called nonanalytical cessation because they are a permanent obstruction to their arising.

original: sam skri ta zhes bya ba samba ra ma bhu ya he tu pra tya yee tri ta zhes bya ba rgyu dang rkyen sna tshogs shing 'dus pas byas pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming yin te 'dus byas zhes bya /
analyzed: sam skri ta zhes bya ba samba ra ma bhu ya he tu pra tya yee tri ta zhes bya ba rgyu dang rkyen sna tshogs shing 'dus pas byas pa'i chos thams cad kyi ming yin te 'dus byas zhes bya /
translated: The term saṃskṛta means that which is produced by various causes and conditions coming together. It is the name for all conditioned phenomena.

original: aa sam skri ta zhes bya ba nam mkha' la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i ming ste 'dus ma byas zhes bya /
analyzed: aa sam skri ta zhes bya ba nam mkha' la sogs pa rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i ming ste 'dus ma byas zhes bya /
translated: Asamskrita means “uncompounded,” such as space and so forth, which are not produced from causes and conditions.

original: s'a sra ba zhes bya bas ha a'a sra be na bartta zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: s'a sra ba zhes bya bas ha a'a sra be na bartta zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Sāsrava means “with outflows,” from sa and asrava.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba yan chad rma'i sgo drug nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i ming ste zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo man chad mtshams med pa'i sems can dmyal ba yan chad rma'i sgo drug nas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i ming ste zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya /
translated: From the peak of existence down to the Avīci hell, the afflictions such as attachment arise from the six doors of the wounds, and so it is called “with outflows.”

original: aa n'a sra ba zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas gsum dang lam gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa med pas na zag pa med pa zhes bya /
analyzed: aa n'a sra ba zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas gsum dang lam gyi bden pa nyon mongs pa med pas na zag pa med pa zhes bya /
translated: Anāsrava means “without outflows,” from a and asrava. It refers to the three uncompounded [phenomena] and the truth of the path, because they are without afflictions.

original: sa manta tya ya zhes bya ba santi sa mashtsa soo bo dha ru pattya na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa manta tya ya zhes bya ba santi sa mashtsa soo bo dha ru pattya na zhes bya ste /
translated: Samatā means “similarity,” from samanta and tyaya.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma rgyur gyur pa dang / phyi ma 'bras bur gyur pa gnyis shes pa'i rang bzhin du 'dra bas na mtshungs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma rgyur gyur pa dang / phyi ma 'bras bur gyur pa gnyis shes pa'i rang bzhin du 'dra bas na mtshungs pa zhes bya /
translated: The previous consciousness is the cause and the subsequent consciousness is the result, and because they are similar in being the nature of consciousness, they are called “similar.”

original: aa nanta ra ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa zhes bya ;
analyzed: aa nanta ra ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis gzhan gyis bar du ma chod pa zhes bya ;
translated: Anantara means that cause and effect are not separated by another.

original: pra tya ya ni rkyen yin te bar med par mtshungs pa'i rkyen zhes 'chad pa yang yin te /
analyzed: pra tya ya ni rkyen yin te bar med par mtshungs pa'i rkyen zhes 'chad pa yang yin te /
translated: Pratyaya means condition, and it is also explained as a condition that is similar and without a break.

original: dngos su na sems dang sems las byung ba skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar ma chod par sngar byung ba'i ming ste /
analyzed: dngos su na sems dang sems las byung ba skad cig ma gzhan gyis bar ma chod par sngar byung ba'i ming ste /
translated: In actuality, it is the name for what has arisen previously without being interrupted by another moment of mind or mental factor.

original: sngon chad de ma thag par btags pa yang mi 'gal bas de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya /
analyzed: sngon chad de ma thag par btags pa yang mi 'gal bas de ma thag pa'i rkyen zhes bya /
translated: Since it is not contradictory to designate it as the immediately preceding, it is called the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent.

original: ra s'a ya na zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs na /
analyzed: ra s'a ya na zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs na /
translated: If the term is derived from the Sanskrit word rasayana,

original: ra sa ni bcud dam nying khu lta bu la bya /
analyzed: ra sa ni bcud dam nying khu lta bu la bya /
translated: rasa means something like a nutrient or essence.

original: a'a ya na ni aa ya pa ga too las drangs te thob pa'am len pa la bya ste /
analyzed: a'a ya na ni aa ya pa ga too las drangs te thob pa'am len pa la bya ste /
translated: Ayana is derived from ayapatagata and means to obtain or take.

original: spyir na 'phrul gyi sman gyi ming ste /
analyzed: spyir na 'phrul gyi sman gyi ming ste /
translated: In general, it is the name of a magical medicine.

original: sman bzang po'i mthu dang bcud kyis tshe lo grangs mang por thub pa dang / gzhon zhing nad med par 'gyur ba len cing 'thob par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sman bzang po'i mthu dang bcud kyis tshe lo grangs mang por thub pa dang / gzhon zhing nad med par 'gyur ba len cing 'thob par byed pa yin te /
translated: By the power and potency of the excellent medicine, they will live for many years and be young and healthy.

original: sman bcud kyis len zhes bya /
analyzed: sman bcud kyis len zhes bya /
translated: This is called “medicinal alchemical powers.”

original: tsany'u ra zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs na /
analyzed: tsany'u ra zhes bya ba'i sgra las drangs na /
translated: If we derive the term from the Sanskrit cūrṇā,

original: tsa na ni tsa na shra na a'a d'a na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tsa na ni tsa na shra na a'a d'a na zhes bya ste /
translated: cūrṇa means cūrṇaśramana-ādyāna.

original: pha rol gyi stobs dang mthu len cing 'phrog bas na stobs la bya /
analyzed: pha rol gyi stobs dang mthu len cing 'phrog bas na stobs la bya /
translated: Since it takes and robs the power and strength of others, it means “power.”

original: au ra ni au aa gr'a khy'a zhes bya ste /
analyzed: au ra ni au aa gr'a khy'a zhes bya ste /
translated: Ūra means ūragakhāya.

original: mchog gam dam pa la bya bas na stobs mchog ces bya /🔽n'a r'a ya na zhes bya ba na ra sya pattya na n'a r'a ya na zhes @160a * //
analyzed: mchog gam dam pa la bya bas na stobs mchog ces bya / n'a r'a ya na zhes bya ba na ra sya pattya na n'a r'a ya na zhes @160a * //
translated: Since it means “supreme” or “holy,” it is called “supreme power.”🔽Nārāyaṇa means narasyapattinārāyaṇa.

original: bya ste / yab sred med kyi sras yin pas na sred med kyi bu zhes bya /
analyzed: bya ste / yab sred med kyi sras yin pas na sred med kyi bu zhes bya /
translated: Since he is the son of the father, Nārāyaṇa, he is called “son of Nārāyaṇa.”

original: tantra ku la dza ta zhes bya ba nor dang khyim dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa la chags pas sems phan tshun du g-yeng ba'i phyir thag 'khrug pa lta bu zhes bya /
analyzed: tantra ku la dza ta zhes bya ba nor dang khyim dang bu dang chung ma la sogs pa la chags pas sems phan tshun du g-yeng ba'i phyir thag 'khrug pa lta bu zhes bya /
translated: The tantrakulajaṭa is called “like a tangled skein” because the mind is distracted here and there by attachment to wealth, home, children, spouse, and so on.

original: gu da gunydzi ka bh'u ta zhes bya ba sred pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa mang du byed pas dgrol dka' ba'i phyir dru gu 'dzings pa lta bu zhes bya /
analyzed: gu da gunydzi ka bh'u ta zhes bya ba sred pa dang ldan pa'i rtog pa mang du byed pas dgrol dka' ba'i phyir dru gu 'dzings pa lta bu zhes bya /
translated: The gudgunjaka bhūta is called “like a tangled mass of string” because it is difficult to unravel due to the many thoughts associated with craving.

original: munydza ba la ba dza dz'a ta zhes bya ba nor dang khyim la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa la chags pas sdug bsngal mang po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rtsa 'di gnyis dang 'dra bar rno zhing rtsub pas na rtsva munydza dang bal rdza lta bur gyur🔽pa zhes bya /
