analyzed: munydza ba la ba dza dz'a ta zhes bya ba nor dang khyim la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa la chags pas sdug bsngal mang po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rtsa 'di gnyis dang 'dra bar rno zhing rtsub pas na rtsva munydza dang bal rdza lta bur gyur pa zhes bya /
translated: The munja vallava bāḍajaṭa is called “like the munja grass and the vallava grass” because it is sharp and rough like these two grasses, and it is the basis for many sufferings due to attachment to wealth, home, and so on.

original: aa dza banydza bi sam panna zhes bya ba /
analyzed: aa dza banydza bi sam panna zhes bya ba /
translated: The ajavañjava sampanna is called “like a bird’s nest.”

original: aa dza ba nya ni 'ong ba /
analyzed: aa dza ba nya ni 'ong ba /
translated: Ajavañjana means “coming.”

original: dza bi ni 'gro ba /
analyzed: dza bi ni 'gro ba /
translated: Javana means “going.”

original: sam banna ni gyur pa'am zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: sam banna ni gyur pa'am zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Sampanna means “having become” or “having entered.”

original: 'gro ba lnga kun du 'khor zhing rgyu ba la bya bas na 'ong ba dang 'gro bar gyur pa zhes btags /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga kun du 'khor zhing rgyu ba la bya bas na 'ong ba dang 'gro bar gyur pa zhes btags /
translated: Since it is the basis of the five types of reincarnating beings, it is called the coming and going of reincarnating beings.

original: panytsa ka sh'a ya zhes bya ba snyigs ma lnga yin te /
analyzed: panytsa ka sh'a ya zhes bya ba snyigs ma lnga yin te /
translated: Pañcakaṣāya means the five degenerations.

original: sngon las sems can rnams tshe dang lta ba la sogs pa nyams shing bri ste sman gyi nying khu bskus pa'i tshigs ma dang 'dra bar tshe dang sems can dang dus ni dman par gyur te /
analyzed: sngon las sems can rnams tshe dang lta ba la sogs pa nyams shing bri ste sman gyi nying khu bskus pa'i tshigs ma dang 'dra bar tshe dang sems can dang dus ni dman par gyur te /
translated: Since the life span, view, and so on of sentient beings declined and deteriorated due to their previous karma, life span, sentient beings, and time became inferior, like a stalk of grain smeared with the essence of medicine.

original: nyon mongs pa dang lta ba la sogs pa'i shas ni phyir zhing skyes pas na snyigs ma lnga zhes bya /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang lta ba la sogs pa'i shas ni phyir zhing skyes pas na snyigs ma lnga zhes bya /
translated: Since the force of afflictions, views, and so on increased, they are called the five degenerations.

original: ma h'a byutpa ta bye brag tu rtogs byed chen po /
analyzed: ma h'a byutpa ta bye brag tu rtogs byed chen po /
translated: Mahāvyutpatti is the great analysis.

original: ma dhya byutpa ta bye brag tu rtogs byed 'bring po /
analyzed: ma dhya byutpa ta bye brag tu rtogs byed 'bring po /
translated: Madhyavyutpatti is the medium analysis.

original: kvalpa byutpa ta bye brag tu rtogs byed chung ngu /
analyzed: kvalpa byutpa ta bye brag tu rtogs byed chung ngu /
translated: Kaḥvavyutpatti is the small analysis.

original: ba tsa byutpa ta skang bye brag tu bshad pa 'di ni 'bring po'o //
analyzed: ba tsa byutpa ta skang bye brag tu bshad pa 'di ni 'bring po'o //
translated: Vācāvyutpatti is the medium analysis of language.

original: chen po'i dka' ba'i gnas dang sgra'i gzhung dang sbyar te bshad pa'i panydzi ka ma dhya byutpa ta yin /
analyzed: chen po'i dka' ba'i gnas dang sgra'i gzhung dang sbyar te bshad pa'i panydzi ka ma dhya byutpa ta yin /
translated: The Pañjikā Madhyavyutpatti is a commentary on the difficult points of the Great [Sutra] and is explained in conjunction with the treatise on grammar.

original: no ; / pho brang 'on cang dor bod dang rgya gar gyi mkhan po thams cad kyis chos skad gtan la phab ste /
analyzed: no ; / pho brang 'on cang dor bod dang rgya gar gyi mkhan po thams cad kyis chos skad gtan la phab ste /
translated: In the palace of 'On chang do, all the Indian and Tibetan scholars determined the Dharma language.

original: rje blon mol nas reg zid du mdzad pa skad gsar gyi ming sngon ma thogs pa dang / gtan la ma phab pa la mkhas pa rnams 'tshogs te ming du btags shing gtan la phab ste /
analyzed: rje blon mol nas reg zid du mdzad pa skad gsar gyi ming sngon ma thogs pa dang / gtan la ma phab pa la mkhas pa rnams 'tshogs te ming du btags shing gtan la phab ste /
translated: After the lord and ministers discussed it, they decided to add the old names to the new language and to have the scholars gather to give names and determine [the language] for what had not been determined.

original: lha btsan po khri lde srong btsan gyis bskul nas bkas bcad de mi bcos par gzhag pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lha btsan po khri lde srong btsan gyis bskul nas bkas bcad de mi bcos par gzhag pa rdzogs so /
translated: Having been requested by the divine king Khri lde srong btsan, the edict was issued and it was decided not to change it. It is finished.

original: // / bkas bcad pa bla dpe bzhin bris pa gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin du zur ma bcos so //
analyzed: // / bkas bcad pa bla dpe bzhin bris pa gzhan gyis kyang de bzhin du zur ma bcos so //
translated: This written edict, which is like a model, was written by others in the same way without making any changes.

original: sgra sbyor bam po gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: sgra sbyor bam po gnyis pa'o /
translated: The two-volume grammar.
